title: Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter selects the candidate to submit a pre-questionnaire.  The hiring manager reviews it and reaches out to the candidate for next steps.  In some cases, the hiring manager may conduct a phone screen interview and the have a panel interview or schedule a panel interview.  The next round with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: This caught me by surprise and this was the first questioned someone have asked me.. "How would I go about making a pen?"

title: Assistant Construction Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was pretty straight forward. It was a panel interview (4) and lasted approximately 45 mintues. After the first interview, was asked to come back for a second interview with the stake-holders. This interview went great as well and we even talked about a possible offer and timeframes. After weeks (4-5) of following up with the hiring manager via email and voice mail, I did not hear back. Finally received a call from a recruiter who said, "the reason why no one called you back is no one knew how to approach you, since your current salary was significantly hire than what we are offering for this position". We discussed room for negotiation and higher position. Recruiter said, she will discuss with hiring manager and get back to me. AGAIN, no response. If Kaiser wants good, talented people working for them, become better communicators and please offer hire compensations, compared to the area.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why are you the right fit for the position.

title: Business Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted directly by my manager who interviewed me over the phone since I was out of state. After being offered the position, someone from University Recruiting contacted me to discuss logistics.
Interview Questions: Tell me about previous relevant work experience

title: Telephone Advice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: 2-3 hours, questions about nursing and nursing judgement what would you advice pt etc I. What would you do if you knew you made error who would you go to. If you did not understand something how likely are you to ask questiond
Interview Questions: What would you do if a pt called in with this complaint

title: Bilingual Appointment Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  I got an email from a recruiter 4 business days later instructing me to go to their HR building to take 4 assessments.  I had to pass all 4 in order to be considered for the position.  After I was done with the test the receptionist at the HR facility told me right away my results.  She told me since I passed my recruiter will contact me in a few days to set up an appointment for my bilingual assessment.  The recruiter contacted me 2 weeks later with the time and dates to come in for the assessment.  I didn't get my test results until 3 business days later stating that I passed.  About 1 week later a recruiter contacted me going over my resume and test results.  She told me she will forward my stuff to the hiring manager and they will set me up for an interview.  It's been 2 weeks going on 3 weeks and I have not heard from anyone.  I even emailed the recruiter to check on my application and got no response.  This whole process from beginning to end took about 2 months.
Interview Questions: They have not interviewed me yet.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel that interviewed me and it was a behavioral interview, a lot of 'give me an example of a time when you did this or that". They all took turns asking questions. At the end they indicated they would contact me further if they decided do a 3rd interview, or just contact me in general to let me know, but I never heard back from them. I even emailed after a week went by to ask. I was ok with not moving further along in the process, but I think it was dis-respectful to not at least respond to my email letting me know they hadn't chosen me to go further.
Interview Questions: What my super power is

title: Underwriting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received an email back about a week later asking me to fill out a personality questionnaire, wrote about 2 full pages in response and sent it in. A few days later I was contacted by the underwriting department to set up an interview. I had 3 interviews, mostly personality and experience questions as they did not expect me to know much about underwriting. Received an offer but decided to go in another direction. Positive experience overall, very nice and helpful and understanding people.
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I filled out my profile online, and applied for the jobs I felt I was qualified for.  It took a while, and if you're not selected, you really don't hear back.  But once I was selected, I had 3 interviews and an offer all within a month.
Interview Questions: Typical behavior questions that asked what experience helped me prepare for certain scenarios that they presented.  I also had to do a short presentation.

title: IT Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I got a call from the hiring manager about a week after applying. He wanted to schedue an in-person interview for the next day (no screening). It was a panel interview with the hiring manager and several other team-adjacent personnel-- introductions and the usual interview questions. 

I had the general background to do the job, but I think it was clear to everyone that I may not be a good cultural fit. At the end of the interview they said they had "no timeline" for next steps. Five weeks later I received a canned notice that someone else had been selected for the job.
Interview Questions: How would you go about wrangling someone that's hard to schedule for a meeting?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied in February, received email from recruiter in late March, completed required questionnaire, phone screen with recruiter then on site interview panel with hiring department. Waited a little over 4 weeks for formal offer, but it was well worth the wait.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Masters Level Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and contacted by hiring manager about a week after for an interview. 45 minute phone interview with two managers on the team that I was applying for. Heard back a week after interviewing. Very smooth and easy process and very friendly interviewers
Interview Questions: Role-specific questions, lots of walking through resume and past experiences. No curveballs they are very interested in making sure you have the right background

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Group session, behavioral questions, round table, multiple managers; its a comfortable environment, they make you feel welcome; had some role play on different scenarios, very long process, behavioral questions are rated and I assume the persons with the highest ratings receive an offer
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you received criticism

title: Certified Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Interview was carried out very well, introductions with potential team members in the Unit, and a variety of questions regarding patient care and expectations needed for the role. Basic questions were asked on supplies and procedures in that particular unit.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a regular BP of a fairly healthy patient.

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very good but slow process for a response and onboarding. If you don't get it you never get a response. Once your in there is not much training.  They are always too busy to give you proper training.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call about a month later regarding my interest for this position. I was then given a phone interview that felt nothing like an interview; the interviewer described the job requirements and whether I would would be able to perform the job requirements. A group interview followed with a total of 4 people in attendance; 3 were hired (including myself). During the interview, we performed a couple of group exercises that resembled answering questions in a "Jeopardy" type of way. Then, we were asked to interview another candidate and tell the interviewers (Managers and HR personnel) why they should be hired. I received a job offer less than a week later.
Interview Questions: Anything that would prevent you from performing this job?

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an online application. Received an email a couple weeks later to set up a phone interview. Was contacted about a week after the phone interview for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple projects with different deadlines?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Mostly social with several different sessions including one on one with chief and multiple physicians and group panel. Waited 2 weeks for offer letter and they gave me one month to respond
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Masters Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone call interview that lasted 90 minutes. It was three short interviews with groups members from the team. The first 30 minutes was with three people and they asked the basic questions, tell me about yourself, why Kaiser and about the position. The second and third interview was about the same format and questions.
Interview Questions:
Why Kaiser?
Why this position?
Tell me about yourself?
Ask specific question on the resume about my experiences

title: Enterprise Data Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring in-charge was also an architect in the team. I had applied for the post of enterprise data architect.  The recruiter at KP had passed my resume to this hiring in-charge. He did a telephonic interview for over an hour two days earlier. After the telephonic interview, he called me and asked whether I am available for an interview at Pleasanton, CA. I shared I can make myself available the next week. He urged me to come the day after since they wanted to finalize the candidate. 
I went there and there was no list of interviewers to start with. The guy who called me started the interview process and started asking me about preparing solution design document and application design. I was surprised but answered them well as I have considerable experience in SDD. Three more interviewers spoke with me and all of them clearly had no interest in doing the interview. One interviewer was very busy looking at his emails behind the monitor. Only one thing brought me a surprise "Your resume sounds more suitable for another opening we have for enterprise data architect"  and I said, "Am I not here for that post?" 
There was either a chaos or I was a victim of the quota system. In a quota system, the panel has to interview a minimum of 5 people but the panel has already decided the candidate and needs 4 guinea pigs to meet the quota.
Interview Questions: Solution design document features

title: Rotational Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Support product director on key integrations (internal and external) by attending meetings, driving technical requirements, coordinating across teams (including 3rd party vendors). SLDC, Deployment Release, Management DevOps. Communicate progress, roadblocks, issues on a regular basis to the product director and senior management
Interview Questions: Questions related to HTML, XML, XSLT, Javascript

title: Senior Quality Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: An hour long interview with the whole team (4 people), many behavioral questions (5-6) and detailed questions on resume as well, asked to demonstrate excel and writing skills. Not a bad experience tho.
Interview Questions: Write one paragraph to explain one of your previous project

title: Software Test Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial telephone interview, followed by an in-person interview, followed by a telephone interview with a group.   The in-person interview was here in the Denver area.
Interview Questions:
General background
Tool familiarity
What you're looking for

title: Emergency Department RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Kennesaw, GA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Responses on applications took a while, but they have many applicants. After confirmation of recreiving my app they sent a questionaire. I was contacted for an interview within 4 days of completion of questionaire. However got no response tmwhen I applied 2 weeks prior to that.
Interview Questions: Scenarios presented for certain patients presenting to ED, asked what would I expect to be ordered. Easy questions.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. There were 7 other people interviewing for a job. We had to sit in alphabet order. There was four interviewers. We went around the whole table and introduce ourselves. Then we had to pair up and ask or partner what customer service skills/jobs have they had, and then present them to the room. We then had two out three questions that were written on the board out loud one by one. Why do we want to work at a call center? How do we handle stress? Lastly we were asked four questions by the interviewers one by one. One question at a time. We were all asked the same questions. Why should we hire?
Interview Questions:
Why should we hire you?
Describe a time when you delivered customer service that you were not satisfied with.
Why do you want to work at a call center?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (McLean, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Met with 2 people after initial phone interview.  Entire process took 6 weeks. I was recruited by a former colleague worker.  When u got the job I was the only one hired for full time.
Interview Questions: How I would handle it if a person was not helping another person with work load.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was an interview panel consisting of three people:  The director, manager, and one charge RN.  I was the only person being interviewed.  It was a comfortable environment for an interview. I have heard that Kaiser often interviews multiple applicants at one sitting though, but this was not the experience I had.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflict with a manager, etc. in the past?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Clackamas, OR) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: First was the application, then an email stating I've been selected and there will be phone interviews done during specific days and times and to keep that time open. The phone interview was roughly ten minutes. Very friendly easy going staff. Then they called the next day to schedule the second interview in person. This interview included seven managers, a director, and an educator. Not all questions were behavioral and the director was very open and friendly.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about your resume.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Clackamas, OR) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied in October for the new grad program but didn't hear back till the 2nd week of December. I got an email saying that I was selected for a phone interview. Phone interview lasted for about 15 minutes (4 questions) and I got a call back the next day that I was going in for the second round which was the panel interview (lasted about 45 minutes). Panel interview was with 9 nurse managers from the Medical-Surgical team. The nurse managers were so awesome and nice about the entire process. I've never felt such a welcoming feeling in a nursing interview (and this was with 9 people!!!!!). After my panel interview, I got a call and an email that I got the job the next day.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I got a call to answer a couple brief questions. she said will call me back if I am suitable for the position. I did not get a call back. The phone call lasted 10 minutes only.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Alameda, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and about a month later there was a panel interview. Long process and very unprofessional. I interviewed in person and didn't get a courtesy email or anything. These people are so unprofessional. So glad I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clais Examiner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with the manager of the department at the time. He was really down to earth and made the interview process like a conversation rather than being intimidating.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for Kaiser Permanente?

title: Senior Reimbursement Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job on January 9, 2017 and received an email from the hiring manager on January 11th for a 60-minute phone interview. I was offered several time slots, but I chose the last time/date to get a better feel of what my competition was like. The interview lasted about 1 1/2 hours and the questions were pretty straightforward. The hiring manager was pretty friendly, and she said she would be in contact with me to schedule a panel interview within the week. I will update this thread if I hear back from them. I also mentioned that I had one other SOLID offer on the table.
Interview Questions: Why am I looking to leave my current position?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA)
Interview Descriptions: You sit down with a panel of kaiser professionals, they fire off situational interview questions. I wasn't hired, they took 6 weeks to tell me I didn't get the job which I felt was unprofessional i was invited to interview by they director of the department and was one of two OT's they were considering and have 16 years experience.  They told me I didn't have enough experience.  Never again will I bother with a kaiser position.
Interview Questions: What is the most stressful thing you have faced in your job?

title: Ambulatory Care Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: About two months after applying to the job posting, the Pharmacy Supervisor contacted me via email. We chatted briefly over the phone. He provided more details about the position, and we scheduled an in-person interview. During the next week, I interviewed in-person and received a job offer via phone. The interview itself was relaxed and consisted of behavioral questions. The interviewees were the hiring supervisor and a pharmacy supervisor from another location.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you had a difficult patient. 
Tell me about a time when you disagreed with a coworker or supervisor.

title: Customer Service Representative/TSR Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Call Center simulated test on the computer, if you pass then called in for a 1 on 1 interview. Before the interview you are given a paper with about 5 questions on it. You are to write down your answers and the interviewer will go over it during the interview.
Interview Questions: What would you do if it’s time for your break and your stuck on a call?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It went well I was stressing for nothing. I loved the atmosphere! The hiring manager was super nice. Def recommend applying at Kaiser if you want great opportunities and great benefits too.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work for Kaiser or interested in the position.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: first interview was from hr. focused on behavioral strengths, weaknesses. second interview was on sit in person. Asked spontaneous question on where i saw myself in the future. then asked about problems faced in the organization and quick first hand solutions
Interview Questions: tell me about a time you failed at something

title: Advice RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was called to come in for an in-person interview. Nurse Manager interviewed us in a group.  Interview process was straight-forward and not many questions were asked. When talking to other nurses in my cohort, some were asked more interview questions and were interviewed by two nurse managers instead of one.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at the AACC?
Why did you leave your previous job?

title: Plan Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral "canned" interview.  Anyone can research how to answer a behavioral type interview question to ensure the interviewer hears that you understood the problem, evaluated the options and used judgement on how to proceed as well as "what you learned" in the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict with your manager...

title: Clinical Sodial Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: IUpon arriving at the clinic after completing a long worksheet they told me ,,you had to be bilingual which I hadn't noticed in their ad.   I had to wait at least an hour.  The people were not particularly polite.
Interview Questions: Was I bilingual?

title: Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a group interview then individual interview with a panel. It was not difficult, but when you have the chance to talk, make yourself heard and memorable. If you do not they will not ask you back for the panel interview
Interview Questions: tell me about a time you had to deal with an upset patient/customer? how did you handle it?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview that took an hour. Got a call 4 days later to be called for a panel interview. The whole process would take a month. It's a long process.
Interview Questions: Series of executive questions

title: EDTech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel with 3 managers and one ED Tech. They introduce themselves to you describing their roles. They walk give you a tour of the ED and description of the jobs role.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself?

Tell us about a time you had a conflict with a coworker and how did it resolve?

Which one comes first?  Blood order, EKG, and call light


Tell us about your last job and why your a fit for this position?


What did you like the most about your last job? And what was the worst?

title: Contact Center Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: You will be interviewed by a panel of people, usually numbering between 5 and 10.  This seems excessive, and it is. They feel the need to get input from many different sources, but it is a "Kaiser" method that you will see if you apply at any job in Kaiser.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to support a process change that you did not agree with.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: good and pleasant, nice employer, hiring is not as complicated as other companies, may require a lot of time for the process to take place, will need to get in touch with the recruiter on regular bassis
Interview Questions: what is your strength and weakensses

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: was referred, went through two interviews one with the hiring manager and another with his boss 5 minutes into the second interview I was tested on my accounting knowledge.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser

title: Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sandy Springs, Fulton, GA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the panel of radiology supervisors from different locations. The interview literally lasted 10 minutes. The position is fairy new at the location that they are hiring for so they didn't have much to tell me about it.
Interview Questions: Basic scenario questions.

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was hired through an agency. The interview was nothing but a ton of online forms that I had to fill out. I was offered the job without ever having to talk to anyone from Kaiser Permanente.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Claims Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to set up a phone meeting. The hiring manager called me on my cell phone. It took only a 15 min. All she did was explain the position and answer a few questions that i had.
Interview Questions: Asked me if I had questions regarding the position

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process went pretty fast and to the point.  The interviewer started with the typical "tell me about yourself", then asked a set of about 10 questions (pretty much all situational), then allowed time for me to ask questions.  She explained details about the hours, company culture, benefits, etc. and said she would get back to me in about a week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the most challenging personnel issue that you have ever had to deal with

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Two phone screen, first with HR/recruiter, second with manager, followed by three face-to-face interviews.  The first interview was with a panel of managers,the second was with the clinical team, and the third was with higher level administration.  Each interview was 1-2 weeks apart.  I received a "soft" offer a few days after the 3rd interview, with a formal offer the next week.  Everyone was very nice and the whole process was very positive and professional.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?  What do you know about Kaiser Mental Health?  Standard behavioral questions, e.g. "tell us about a time when you had to manage conflict."  Followed by a clinical vignette.

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They give a panel interview. Definitely made me nervous, but everyone was nice and professional. Arrive on time, being punctual is key. Have a professional resume and dress professionally.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself bringing to Kaiser Permanente as a professional?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: After reaching out to HR through the website, I was quickly emailed by a physician recruiter. Next steps included a phone interview with HR. She sent out my CV/cover letter to the sites I was interested in. Also required 3 letters of recommendation. I was then contacted by interested sites for a phone interview and then on-site interview. On-site interview included tour and physician interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your clinic.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fremont, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for MA full time position in Fremont ca in October. I was called for an interview in November, the interview was great they made me feel very comfortable.two weeks later I was offered the position via phone call from manager.  Still waiting on call from recruiter. Playing the waiting game isn't fun but  very happy I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Contract and Grant Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: First there was a panel telephone conference, then an inperson panel interview.  Final decision took quite some time as did the paperwork, health screen, etc.  But the compensation plan made the delays worth it.
Interview Questions: How would you handle (this particular impossible situation)?  Several 'how would you handle..." questions.  This is still done today, to see if a particular individual #1 has the appropriate knowledge to work in our field, but also to see how they will fit in.  We are very much a team and need to function that way.

title: Compensation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
The recruiter was wonderful. She was patient and gave me time to thing of the best answer. I felt confident and really great about the questions an answers.

HR in this company is very knowledgeable and are great people
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for Kaiser

title: Business Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: 1. Applied to position online; 2. Three days later sent assessment through email; 3. One week after assessment called by hiring manager for panel interview 4. Met with management team which included 4 Managers was efficient on time and very conversational 6. Contacted 1 week after to offer me the position
Interview Questions:
Name a time you had to convince a co worker of a new project, process or procedure?

What do you plan to do with your background and education?

How do you stay organized with projects that require timely follow up?

title: IT Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
First round: Met with multiple team members and leaders for casual conversations. 
Second round: Met with two people for a second time and a third for a first time-- a contributor for the program.
Interview Questions: What fears do you have taking on this role?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about a week. I had a phone interview with a recruiter and met with the manager and VP of finance several days later. Everyone I met and spoke to were very friendly.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Panorama City, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview.  They gave us a good idea of out job description.  And they all seemed nice and we're willing to answer all questions. It was a smooth interview because of they way they went about it.
Interview Questions: Was I willing to work at all hours of the day

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Gaithersburg, MD) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview that lasted over an hour with multiple clinical questions. It was definitely intense.  Prior to the panel interview, I was interviewed over the phone for an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to deal with a difficult doctor and what did you do?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for Kaiser housekeeping job on Friday and got a call back that same day to schedule a phone interview.. my phone interview was Monday and everything went good and I have a group interview on Nov 21st.. i don't know what to expect on the group interview. She said that we would be put in group. Does anyone know what to expect?
Interview Questions: What is customer service to you?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with leadership after approval from recruiter who gave me the green light. KP met my salary requirements so the process was conflict-free. All potential employees must be screened and approved by HR and there are some flaws in that system.
Interview Questions: Reasons for changing positions.

title: Quality Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: A table top discussion with members from the department were present during the interview process. It was a 3 part process: a phone interview, 1:1 interview with department manager, then panel interview with colleagues.
Interview Questions: Most difficult situation you were able to handle.

title: Accounting Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, got an email about 10 days later, set up a phone interview, followed up with an in person interview exactly 3 weeks after I applied online.  Never heard back from them.
Interview Questions: How I would handle ambiguity all the time?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: First I applied online. 3 months later after I forgot about I got an email to take an online assessment test. A week or so later I got a screening phone call to see if I’m still interested and ask basic background questions. Then a few days later came in for a Panel Interview with a department manager, Your would-be Direct Supervisor, and 2 Union representatives.
Interview Questions: Standard customer service “situational” questions. Google the STAR method if you’re not familiar. That’s what they want. A whole bunch of, “Tell me about a time...”

title: Legal Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of three parts.  First was the initial interview with the recruiting officer.  It was comprised of interview questions which are to be submitted to the supervisor of the legal department and a series of test to establish your proficiency and Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.  If you pass that part your resume and application will be submitted to the supervisor in the legal department.  That is when the second part  I have the interview process comes in; meeting with the direct supervisor. If you are chosen beyond that interview you will then meet with whom you will be working under  to see if you would fit personality wise.
Interview Questions: How does your skill-set fit in with Kaiser Permanente?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The first thing was an automated email for an online personality and customer service quiz. That was followed a few weeks later by a telephone interview. After that I was contacted about 2 weeks later to set up an in person interview. A portion of the interview allowed for shadowing of a current employee, then it was followed by a panel interview comprised of managers and fellow coworkers.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to teach a patient who wasn't very receptive.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online around mid sept got a call from a recruiter doing a phone interview she asked me couple questions just giving her my work background and experince, why do i want to work for kaiser and then said someone will be in touch with you to invite you for an in person interview. On 9/28 the RN manager from the department called me and scheduled interview on 10/03 i had 2 interviews my interview was scheduled from 10-11 am but actually took an hour in a half. I meet with the RN manger and 3 medical assistants they asked basic interview questions, work and school background, asked me to tell them about my self, i also asked them couple questions when we were done with the questions I was given a tour of the clinic and introduced to the Doctors, surgeons,MA's the same thing was done at the second interview met with other 3 MA's and given a tour and introduced to staff, the hiring RN told me that a recruiter will be contcting me withing a week(havent heard nothing yet) i also was told that since Im an external employee most likely I wont be starting till November because I have to do physical,Vaccines, and background check so she made it sound like they were offereing me the job but I havent heard back from them yet.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for kaiser

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had been putting in apps for Kaiser for nearly a year with no luck! I submitted myself for at least 8-10 different positions & was rejected everytime! So I was ecstatic when a friend just so happened to forward me an email for a recruiting event. I was able to RSVP the recruiter directly & she set me up with my area of interest & an appt! I was told it would be a group panel & a behavioral interview. The nurse manager & a nurse supervisor were present. I think it went well. They told me they would make a decision within 7-10 days. This site was REALLY helpful in my interview prep. I read through all the questions on here & practiced my answers; it really made a difference!
Interview Questions: I was given a copy of the Kaiser vision/mission statement & asked for my interpretation of it.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with about 25 other people broken into groups with two managers interviewing maybe 8-10 people at each table. They ask you all 4 questions but in different orders, they want the STAR format so make sure answers are very detailed and make sense you cant babble. Answers are scored from 1 to 4 4 being the highest, I assume they go for the people with the highest scores but that part I don't really know. Im playing the waiting game as they told us it would be 5 business days before we heard anything. But before all of this you have to take and pass a 5 part assessment that is kind of tricky but not impossible to pass.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you didn't provide the level of customer service you would have liked

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with approx 24 other people.  We were separated into 3 groups and had two managers/supervisors per table.  It is important to read the information sheet they provide in the email because they quiz you before the interview starts.  Don't stress, it is actually fun and meant to loosen you up for the actual interviewing questions.  Once the quiz session is over, they allow you a 10 minute break.  After the break, that is when they ask you the four questions.  They don't ask the same question back to back, instead the rotate the questions between the people at the table.  But you will have answered all four questions by the time they are finished.  Try to keep your answers short but concise, they stress this.  After that, they wait until all the groups are finished and then you are free to go.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: There were about 20 applicants and three managers in a room. They asked us to  introduce our partner (another applicant). And we had to each answer random question in front of everybody.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal work environment?

title: Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: they ask a lot  about the behavior sort of question like how would you solve this and that, and ask about XYZ experience on the resume like the internship or other activities, and about the XYZ skills you have on the resume, like asking you basic question about C++ and other things
Interview Questions: SQL question, what is the result of A left outer join with B

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. 3 groups. 12 people per group. 2 managers at each table. They go around the table... Everyone is asked the same 4 questions in different orders. Don't ramble. Be brief and confident. You'll have time to think of your answers while others are talking. Was offered the job within 2 days after the interview but declined due to the location of the call center. Online job post stated it would be in Buckhead, found out at interview it would be all the way in Gwinnett. No deal. Pay rate offered was great, and well above offers I received at other healthcare organaiztoons in the city. Would consider applying again.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you felt you did not deliver good customer service.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
- Phone screen call with HR
- One-on-One interview with manager
- Group interview with management

The manager spoke for appx. 45 min. and asked me two questions in the hour long interview. Even still, I was invited back for group interviews.

With KP, the positions/departments are extremely hit-or-miss. Some departments are awesome and positive, others are just the opposite.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between a consultant and a project manager?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with about 5 other candidates being interviewed by a panel of two. The interviewers had two full pages of questions to ask you and they pick on the candidates to answer and you just answer after the other. They ask a lot about your experience with a call center and the variety of duties that you performed.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser Permanente?

title: Java Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about an hour and they mostly pressed upon java basics. He asked me to elaborate more on my experience and my comfort ness in various technologies. He explained to me about the project and what they do and what they are going to do.
Interview Questions: Write a program to reverse a string?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Phone call, 2 hour interview. Very basic. The interview wasn't too hard. They focused more on your personality and whether or not you're a good fit for the company. Got offer within a week. HR took forever to get my documentation going.
Interview Questions: Answer a few accounting questions.

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with the Director. It was a straight forward, typical interview process. This was only the first interview phase in the process. Anticipate that the additional interviews to be more thorough.
Interview Questions: Past experience as it relates to job

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online around April 2016. Got called in for an interview October 2016 and job offer Feb 2017. 
Was nervous for my interview but the hiring managers interviewing were great and made me feel more at home.
Interview Questions: If you see a nurse doing something they're not supposed to how would you handle it

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied to Kaiser via online site. It took around 3-4 until a recruiter called me to do an over the phone screening. After a few weeks, I received a call for an interview. I interviewed with one manager and she said she'd call regardless the answer, but no call as been made. I decided to move on after that.
Interview Questions: What do you know about The Union

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: panel interview utilizing  behavioral interviewing questions; was quite easy and relaxed, they interviewed candidates one after the other. They must have a list of prepared questions and each interviewer seemed to have picked 2 questions each.
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself?  3 words to describe you? Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Director of Organizational Learning & Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had to advocate for an interview with the hiring manager even though I was highly qualified. I got one 30 minute interview and was not passed along to the panel interview because an external candidate had move direct experience in the function.
Interview Questions: My experience in improving employee engagement and proven outcomes.

title: Advanced Practice Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Via webex. Manager, a physician, HR rep are present during the interview. Questions were typical like why us, what can you offer, nothing clinical except for one question about prescribing.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply in our company?

title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online application led to phone interview with recruiter who forwarded notes to Chief Anesthesiologist. Then given face to face interview (before covid).  Met with OR manager and Preop/PACU manager. Also given extensive tour.
Interview Questions: Why leaving previous work, experience/ comfort level with pediatrics.

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interviews: 1 with current fellow/alumni of program, next with Program Director, final round in-person with several panels of local medical center executives and then individual interviews with Regional Executive Sponsors of the program (latter is on separate day)
Interview Questions: Mix of behavioral  and case questions

title: Echo Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a short interview. The department already knew me as I was a student there the prior year.  I already knew the manager and what they wanted from me.  There were familiar with my work.
Interview Questions: Why wasn't I asked any interview questions?

title: Pharmacy Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a panel interview which I was prepared for, however when the interview was granted to me I asked what the questions would be comprised of.  I was given incorrect information. I asked what the split will be between professional questions and pharmaceutical related questions. I was told that the first interview was strictly on personality traits and management issues, then they would ask a few clinical questions .  clinical interview would be granted at a later date. When I got into the panel, it was strictly clinical data and Pharmacy related questions. I was completely unprepared as had been told this other information weeks beforehand. I did not get the job however months later they called me and asked me to take the position when another Resident left.
Interview Questions: clinical case study situations were the primary composition

title: Clinical Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Recruiter phone interview. 
Hiring Manager phone interview. 
In person, panel interview. 
Follow up phone interview. 
Job offer via manager. 
Discussion of exact offer from recruiter. 
Time to think over offer. 
Acceptance of offer three days later.
Interview Questions:
Why Kaiser?
Why this position?
How do you feel about medication?

title: RN- Allergy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Personality test next day after application submitted. One week later phone interview. Panel interview a week after that. Job shadow a week after that. The next day they checked my references, and the following day gave me a job offer!
Interview Questions: What was one thing you did to improve your clinic?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Average but I knew the interviewer from a prior position. I was comfortable. I had to go take a typing test too to qualify.  And the ski TB test because it's a hospital
Interview Questions: Prior experience

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Got called about the position, and got the job offer in 36 hours! Incredible turn around! There were two interviews, one behavioral over the phone and one panel. Most of the questions were general behavior questions. I had to do my panel over WebEx since I was still in university, but they were very understanding and cooperative.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser Permanente

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
I had 5 nterviews. I was a contractor, not an employee for awhile first so they knew me then I had five interviews one was on the telephone and the rest were panel interviews.  All of the interviewers were very nice.

It takes awhile to get a job offer, so be patient. It is a long process however worth the wait.
Interview Questions: All about the job and what I would do in certain situations. Easier than expected.

title: Policy and Procedure Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was only asked to participate in one interview with a two person panel. Prior to the interview I completed a writing assignment. I was offered the job right away, but the required background check delayed my start date. Overall it was a great interview experience. I would rather complete a writing assignment than do numerous job interviews.
Interview Questions: What're your best and worst qualities as a writer

title: Direct Response Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It started off when the University Relations intern contacted me to set up the phone interview. There was only one phone call. Was supposed to be with the 3 managers sharing me, but was only with one.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the Kaiser website. I previously had posted on Dec 8, I never heard anything back after I did all my testing I kept calling and emailing but never heard anything back. But I kept applying and I finally got another interview for the same position but for a different location. Everything went by pretty quickly. I went in for an interview which was a group/panel, it was about 24 of us and 6 managers, it went really good, i already knew what to expect since I've done it previously, it was just a lot more people. But I received a offer that same day. Now I just have to go through the background check and drug testing. To everyone that comes on here to get an insight and to prepare yourself, do not give up applying, I didn't give up and now I'm apart of the team.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser ?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: After four group interviews, I was hired. The first interview included a panel of at least 6. It was overwhelming but I was confident. I did not get the position after being in bottom 2 due to seniority however in midst of that process, was offerred a position in a different department which I was employed with for 7 yeas.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Medicare Enroller Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my sales experience and spoke of similarities as to what the Enroller position entailed. I had summarized my resume for them to help them understand what my roles in sales was prior and what I am looking for in the future if I was hired.
Interview Questions: Do you have any problems working with the elderly?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, took assessment/personality test, did over the phone interview and in person group interview. Everything went well and the next day was offered the job. Now a month later, have already passed the drugs test, background check and was about to do my health screening, receive a call from recruitment that the position has been cancelled due to budget reasons. Had already put my 2 weeks notice at my current job and my last day was in four days, was ready to start at Kaiser in a week. Very poor planning and managing on Kaiser's end. Very unfortunate and upsetting. Did not expect to mislead and blindsided from this company.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Received an email for the schedule of the group panel interview.
The interview process was the most intense I've ever been into. There were 5 panels and 2 from HR and there were 10 applicants. After the group panel interview, they called us one by one and stated they'd let us know in a week about their decision. But I received a call same day that they have chosen me.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and why do you want to work at Kaiser

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process. Hiring process was awful. Interview was more of a conversation. Discussed areas of interest with investigators. Met with other research associates.  Long period between job offer and being officially hired.
Interview Questions: It was more of a conversation. Discussed areas of interest regarding research.

title: RN Float Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 nurse's asking the questions. I felt very comfortable. They each took turns asking me questions relating to how I handle a variety of situations and then asked me in the end if I had any questions... I thought up, rather quickly, 3 good questions to ask them.  I was told they had a few more to interview so I would know by next Tuesday... That's a week from today... I will check back when I hear something... I hope to hear good news!!!
Interview Questions:
When have I experienced a failure and what did I do about it and what did I learn? 
When I notice a coworker isn't performing a task up to training what do I do about it?
Name a time I had a difficult patient and/or family, what happened and what did I do about it?

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I first had to pass a medical terminology test. Once passed, I had a panel interview that consisted of the manager, a senior rep and a HR stewardess. They asked me about 4 questions each. They were all your standard interview questions. Since they were reading it from a piece of paper, not a lot of eye contact was made.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser Permanente?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Very prompt & precise. The turn around was 4 days.
The experience was very pleasant.
The interview environment was relaxed.
The questions asked were very rekevant and the interviewer attitude was very encouraging and friendly.
Interview Questions: Describe your project management process

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Placentia, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from the inpatient director for an interview after submitting an application online. Interviewed with 3 supervisors after completing a 1 hour written clinical multiple choice exam. The interview was heavily situational and assessing ones ability to problem solve and deal with difficult people/situations including clinical questions. Was told to wait a few weeks... Received a call a month later by a supervisor that they offered job to someone else.
Interview Questions: Have you worked graveyard before?

title: Manager, Provider Contracting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview comprised of 8 behavioral questions and a brief overview of my resume. There was a  3 person panel (Exec Director and two managers). Everyone was very polite which made the environment comfortable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to be diplomatic?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with pannel (3 people) on a friday, received call monday with offer. Asked basic questions about being a medical assistant and patient and work flow. Also doctor was present so he asked questions directed toward doctor and MA relationship
Interview Questions: what is team work to you

title: Business Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a total of 4 interviews. The first one was a screening interview by the manager, where he asked about my background, the usual "get to know you" interview. The next interview was to see what skills I have, such as Microsoft Project, Excel, my presentation skills, etc. I was asked about my projects and past work experience to see how relevant they were to this position. The third interview was about cultural fit. I was asked about my personality, if I did better with big groups, small groups, or alone. By the time you hit the fourth interview, you are said to be qualified for the position, but now they want to know if the position is a good fit for you. I was asked about what I wanted to get out of the job, what skills I wanted to improve on, what my long term and short term goals were. Overall it wasn't too hard as long as you are able to answer the standard questions for an analyst position. I was told my role on the team would be to be emphasized on data analytics over actual business operations but my interviews were still pretty standard. Make sure you ask them questions too, because they leave A LOT of time for that sometimes, so if your interview gets cut too short because you didn't ask more than 1 question, that can be bad
Interview Questions:
How would you delegate work to others?
What do you wish to improve from this job?

title: Executive Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter reached out to me to tell me about the position and arranged a phone interview. I first had a phone interview with the VP/Deputy Controller (not the usual) and then a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: The was the most informal interview I've had at KP.  It was more like a conversation; I discussed my work background and what I was looking for in the position.  The interviewer told me about the job and what he was looking for.

title: Claim Quality Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a telephone interview. The manager reached out to me via email to schedule the interview. She had quite a few questions for me, but had a hard stop deadline. It seemed to be more of a conversation than an interview. Telephone interviews can be difficult, because it is hard to read the interviewer and easy to get too comfortable.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a difficult team member?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with around 30 other applicants. Say your name, which college you attend (or job if you do not attend one), how long you've been there, and major. Then paired up with the person next to you and tell the interviewers (3) why your partner should get the position and vice versa.
Interview Questions: Why should we accept your partner for this position?

title: Regional Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a panel interview, where they already stated that since I was an internal candidate and met the minimum requirements they "had to" interview me.  They told me I was not ready in their opinion and  what I should do is take a cut in pay and apply for a manager of another department to get a more well rounded resume if I intended to reapply
Interview Questions: All the questions were situational

title: Clinic Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Started as a large group (25-30 people) before a 10 person panel. Included working with others. Some candidates we eliminated half way through, and then there was more focused questioning.
Interview Questions: Introduce a partner (another applicant).

title: Human Resources Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Alameda, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Online assesment...waiting...recruitment will call to ask questions why you want job...waiting... face to face panel...some come back for second panel i have heard but I did not. Took about 2 - 3 months from application to job offer. Alot of waiting kaiser just takes a long time prepare for that. Also, be aware that they tend to hire people who are temps at the service center rather then freshly brand new external candidates so try to prove your strengths and ability to learn quickly.
Interview Questions: Q: It was a 3 part question I can't remember specifically but I had to ask to repeat the last part.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview with HR,  then panel interview with the heads of various departments. 4 hr panel  interview filled with behavavioral type questions. Its been 2 weeks still haven't heard back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you successfully negotiated a win-win outcome between two departments with competing agendas and priorities regarding a significant business issue. What was your specific approach to handling this situation? Tell me about a time when you changed a person’s mind from being resistant to your idea to being supportive of your idea.

title: Marketing Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone screen with the manager. Then a month later, got onsite. There's no tech questions, all behavior questions for 2 hours straight.  I couldn't answer them all well because I didn't experience that much of "what if your boss hate you, what do you do?" kind of cases.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you don't like your boss's idea?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: easy questions, relaxed environment - the manager was really relaxed she was easy going. she didn't make you feel intimidated. gave a tour of the building, everyone I met was really kind making things that much easier
Interview Questions: typical questions, how would you handle an irate member?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was over the phone, brief but to the point. They answered all my questions throughly. They wanted to know what type of patients I had seen in the past, and if it included post op.
Interview Questions: What type of splints can you make?

title: Practice Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Informal discussion with different members of the team I was joining.   They had questions related to past job experiences, job descriptions, education background, trainings I had completed, what I liked and didn't like about previous positions, etc.
Interview Questions: What I like best about working at Kaiser Permanente?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The Process included an interview by phone with the recruiter, then with the manager, then , employees, then the VP. After the entire process was over, I was asked to come back for another 1:1.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Procurement Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position online. A few days later, I received an email stating they would like to schedule a phone interview. After scheduling the interview, they called me on-time the day of the meeting. We talked for about 15 minutes and the interviewer answered all of my questions. I was told if I was not going to move onto the next phase of the hiring process, I would receive notification by the end of the week. It was an average interview; short and informative.
I have been on other interviews for different positions. All of them are about the same. Kaiser is on-time with their meetings/appointments and very professional. Listen carefully to the questions they ask, so your answer cover everything they asked. Have questions to ask them about the position! Dress in comfortable casual business attire.
Interview Questions:
How many years experience do you have?
What are your short term and long term goals?
Are you aware that is is an exempt position?
How do you rank yourself with customer service?
What are you stongest skills when it comes to customer service?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
It was a group interview with 5 other people. We sat along a table across from the two interviewees. We went down the table as we were asked questions:
1. Tell us your name, if you're going to school or working, and why you want to volunteer.
2. How would your friends describe you?
3. Name a time you had to work to reach a goal.

After that they explained that we cannot choose what department we will be volunteering in as they will decide which department would be the best fit for us based on our answers. A little frustrating after trying to go for a certain department and being told you might get stuck hanging out in the gift shop. However, if you are there to only volunteer and not to help with any future career then you are golden.

Overall it was pretty laid back and easy. You are there to give your time, and they just want to make sure you will be available to help, and don't have a crazy busy schedule.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer.

title: Credentialing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Redwood City, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview, basic questions, a lot of information about the position and what is and / or expected. Fairly simple process. Interviewed with both Director and the Medical Staff Manager for about an hour
Interview Questions: What is your best quality

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by recruiter and got a interview request in 10 business days. Whole interview lasted about 1.5-2hr. It's a group interview and lots of the tranditional interview quetions have been asked.
Interview Questions:
5 yrs career goal
Motivation for the application

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Process exceeds 3 months frequently. 

The process is very generic and not very structured in nature. Interviews tend to be qualitative in nature. The decision making process on the back end is also very qualitative, even for engineers. 

Don't expect a normal silicon valley type interview where you are asked questions in areas such as:
Cognitive Ability
Troubleshooting
Leadership skills
Decision Making
Professional priority    
Communications  etc etc 

My advice: If you want to be successful interviewing at KP, work on your personality impact. Prepare questions for the interviewer about themselves. Show interest in the interviewer. (Make friends)
Interview Questions:
Questions are typical: 
"Tell me about a time you...",  
"Can you think of a challenge you had where...", 
"What's your worst / best experience with...".

title: Population Management Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application online, 2 days later they called and asked me to take MS Office timed test.  Two days after I took the test Kaiser called to set up interview.  I felt like the interview went well but am waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in April 2016, got a call from Department manager June 2016, went in for an interview 2 days later and got offered the job at the interview. Now I go through background check, drug testing, and the orientation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied in may but wasn't called for interview until late june. I was finally offered the job in August and wad told I'd be contacted by a recruiter the following week. I had to call the supervisor after 5 days because no one called me yet it then took 2 days for the recruiter to call me she asked a few questions and said she call me back re: pay,start date it has now been 5 days and no call back
Interview Questions: how do you deal with difficult people
