title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: First you take a test online that will screen some people out. Next you will get a phone call and will be asked to come in for a group interview. After the group interview, they will eliminate some and give a one-on-one interview.
Interview Questions: How did you react when you received feedback you did not agree with?

title: Psychological Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Telephone, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview and interviewer was professional and posed logical questions directly related to the position.  The interviewer's approach was positive and encouraging while not implying and commitment by the organization in reference to the position for which the applicant was applying.  The interview led to a commitment for an extended interview that would be scheduled in the future and involve further interviewing by a management staff member.  The interviewer also provided information regarding potential work schedule, that applicant would be required to provide services at multiple work sites and that applicant if chosen would be required to obtain a state psychological services license number.
Interview Questions: Please describe a situation in which you applied psychological knowledge or case management skills.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online as an external and received an email 2 weeks later to answer some basic questions.
Received a phone call from HR to schedule a phone interview.
After phone interview (within 4 days) received call from Dept. Manager to have an in-person interview.
Had my in-person interview with 2 Managers and 3 staff members, all very nice and laid-back.
Hope to hear from them soon!
Interview Questions:
Q: Why Kaiser?
Q: What does kindness mean to you?
Q: What are you strengths and weaknesses?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online not long before the application deadline. A week later, I sent messages to the recruiters on LinkedIn. A few days after that, I received a call from a recruiter (that I had not messaged) to set up an interview. I interviewed the following week. A few hours after the interview I got a call that I got that job. Work started about 10 days later.
Interview Questions: For a communications related role... How do you go about finding content for sharing on social media platforms?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
applied in April didn't receive callback until June
group panel interview 
not every professional or inviting 
long wait time 
process was overwhelming
they were 30 minutes late
interview didnt last long 
more of a casual conversation
Interview Questions: The questions were all over the place nothing to do with actual job title

title: Admitting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I initially started applying back in Jan of this year, after my application had been submitted I heard back from hr within a month. I had a phone interview that was about 30-40 min that consisted of going over my experience,job details and pay of the position. A month passed by and I was contacted by the department  manager I was asked to come in for a interview after my initial interview with the manager I did not hear anything for about two months. I kept following up with the hr recruiter and was able to get a hold of the dept manager from there she scheduled me for a panel interview that consisted of four managers. The staff was very polite and professional!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview with the hiring manager or recruiter, an at person interview with the hiring manager, and then a panel interview with the team of 4-7, the panel deliberates and provide a recommendation.  job offer within the week, HR processing, drug test, back ground check and start date will then be determined.
Interview Questions: If you were stuck in an island, you can bring 3 things with you, what will they be?

title: KP Launch Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: You apply online, then wait a few weeks for an interview email, and then call to schedule your interview. Pretty standard process and there is also a drug test that needs to be done.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was invited for an interview shortly after I applied. I interviewed with a panel of three supervisors, who had a script of information they were looking for. They were all very friendly and approachable, and answered all of my questions patiently. I was able to receive a tour of the lab after the interview.
The entire process lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Ward Clerk Transcriber Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
A recruiter contacts you first 
A recruiter forwards your application 
Manager contacts you 
A manager sets up your interview
Some people get hired same day 
Some wait a week at the most
Interview Questions:
How are you with computers? 
How do you handle fast and busy situations that can be stressful ? 
I got somewhat lucky I gave a brief introduction about my years of experience how I am with computers, employees, and handling emergency rooms.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fremont, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process contacted me before I had even applied for the position I as in the process of applying when a recruiter had called me asking to apply for this position. Panel interview with three people and five other candidates in the room .
Interview Questions: why should we hire you ? How would you handle conflict in the work place? Tell me about yourself?

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was just a Phone interview. There were around 200 people hired within a span of few months and we all got mixed requirements which did not necessarily matched our passed experience, which was in a way good that new things were learnt but also bad because there was a lag time to come up to speed without prior experience on that project.
Interview Questions: Name one Technology related product and one non technology related product that You like and why

title: Shared Services Team Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Alameda, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed twice, and it was an hour-long interview each time. The interviewers were on-time, and were conscious of keeping within the schedule given. Considering the length of the interview, I believe that doing it via a panel was the best route for them. They asked in-depth questions and followed-up on details on responses.
Interview Questions: My experience in terms of motivating team members.

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The process was the usual, except it went through a third party. I didn't think it added anything to the process rather made the closing more difficult. There was a phone screen and an in person interview that was really good. Overall the process was good.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: Technology Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Had a phone interview and then an in person interview. The phone interview was basically a conference call with 2 individuals (who were not even in the same state). Both people were late to the conference call. It probably was about 7 minutes into the scheduled time before we actually started the interview. The interviewers did not seemed prepared. They were talking over each other and even interrupting me while I was answering questions. It was definitely one of the worst interviews I have ever had, and I was surprised to get a call back. 

The in person interview was a very similar experience. All of the interviewers (5 people) were late. I was sitting in the room with the secretary for about 5-7 minutes before anyone showed up, and even then only 1 person showed. The rest of the panel eventually showed up, but took some time to set up as I sat there in silence. One of the individuals had to call 2 other people over a video conference so they can join in on the interview. 

As the interview started, the interviewers, again, were talking over each other. All of them tried to fire off their questions, as other people were asking their questions. It was difficult to figure out who to answer or how to answer questions. While answering one person's question, someone would interrupt me and ask me another question (sometimes not even related to the first question). I would have to then choose to either finish answering the first question or answer the new question. This really threw me off my game. 

Moreover, while answering questions, 2 of the interviewers were constantly on their phones. Scrolling through messages, answering emails or texts, and just simply not engaging with the interview. Those same individuals left the interview in the middle of the interview. 

In the end, I was never notified if I was selected for the position. It wasn't until I emailed the recruiter to inquire about my candidacy, that I was told they have already filled the position. 

Kaiser seems like a great company to work for, and I hope this is just an exception to what usually happens. I really enjoyed the facilities and the people that I met. This experience was just completely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Project Manager I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, several months later received a call to interview.  Several interviews were scheduled in a short timeframe.  During the interview process, I met with team and leadership in group and individual setting.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser Permanente?

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Get a phone call from HR and just general interview questions. A few questions about work experience. Questions about future plan and some tech questions about statistician. The HR is really nice to talk with.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose our company?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: First they start with a phone interview, then if they like you, they'll call you to schedule an in person interview. At the in person interview it could be panel, one on one, or a group interview--it's based on the position and dept you'd be working with. A lot of behavioral questions are asked.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser Permanente?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: one interview with human resources  was called in for a telephone assessment test.  keying information while listening to person over the phone.  Communication and listening was a plus for this position
Interview Questions: cdo I get along with others?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Hilo, HI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online at Kaiser website, received a call from there HR department asking me to fill out a "Snap shot" pre-screen interview form, which was emailed to me. Filled out the form and emailed it back, was told that if I passed the pre-screening then my application would be forwarded to the facility that I applied for. 3 weeks later I got a call from the HR office in the facility that I applied for, and was scheduled for an interview. Arrived at the interview a little early, waited for the hiring manager then had the interview. There was 4 people conducting the interview, 2 RNs in specialty fields, the hiring manager, and the nurse manager. They have more applicants to interview so now I'm playing the waiting game...
Interview Questions: The usual.... Tell us about yourself? Why do you want to work at Kaiser? How did you hear about the job?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Carmichael, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email to an online listen/type assessment about 3 weeks later. I received a phone call from a recruiter about two weeks after the assessment. The recruiter asked some qualifying questions over the phone and told me I would be contacted my a manager for a face to face interview. I received that phone call the following week on Thursday and was offered an interview for Friday morning that I could not take due to a prior commitment. They offered an interview on Monday morning which I took. Showed to the interview where I did a small written assessment before the interview. I was then pulled into the office where 3 people asked a series of questions about "what would you do". I received a phone call 4 hours later form the recruiter offering the position.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser? Why should we select you?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call for a phone interview a couple weeks later. The phone interview went well and I was called for an in-person panel interview shortly after. The staff was really polite and professional. I had my interview yesterday and should hear back within a week.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through their website. Took roughly 1-2 months to get back to you via email. Then scheduled an on-site interview. They walk me around the campus and interviewed me for 30 mins. 2 managers interviewed me.
Interview Questions: Questions about myself and where I want to be. Gave a problem what the company is trying to solve and implement, then they asked for suggestions to solve that problem.

title: Service Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and took an assessment based on behavioral situations. About 2 weeks later I received a call for an interview, before being asked to come in for an interview I was asked a few basic interview questions. At the interview I was interviewed by two people, very easy to talk to not intimidating. They asked situational questions and wanted details on how I dealt with them.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you failed.

title: PM Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Group of staff and Manager interviewing me at the same time. The format was round table questions; open forum; back and forth interview; I interview them as well as them interviewing me. Interview was comfortsble and somewhat formal. Atmosphere was congenial. Everyone seemed nice. Timeline to start was desired to be within next the following month.
Interview Questions: Experience and examples of work

title: Cashier Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview with both the manager and director. Both asking question about past experience. Such as customer service. Some tricky questions asked to see your response while under pressure. How quick your able to think with a proper response.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you’ve dealt with a patient or customer that was angry

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by Med/Surg manager, interviewed following week. Was kept waiting for one panel member to arrive. A panel member was obviously indicating with body language that the interview was a waste of his time. While other members took notes on my replies, he simply doodled on the question sheet he had in front of him. It was quite distracting and disrespectful.
Interview Questions: What I wanted them to remember about me.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group panel interview with 30 candidates, 3 parts: introduce yourself, introduce a partner, and answer a random question on the spot. Took about 3 hours from start to finish. Offered job by phone.
Interview Questions: How do you define compassion?

title: Psychosocial Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with basic questions about therapy process. Asked how you look at cases and what diagnosis you may use in treatment. Asked about ability to work with different populations and confidentiality. Had vignettes and was asked to describe diagnosis and how a treatment plan would be developed- what things would need to be considered.
Interview Questions: How would you determine if someone is psychologically healthy enough to end treatment?

title: Pricing Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was behavioral. Generally want to know why you are interested and why you are a good candidate. Just be yourself and act natural. They want to see you succeed. They care about personality a lot and want team-oriented individuals. In addition, they are interested in knowing your future career goals and aspirations. They also are interested in hearing about your experience with Excel and other financial metrics. At the end they ask you if you have any questions for them. You should definitely prepare a few questions beforehand--Why did you choose KP? or details about the position etc...
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time your work was criticized?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received a call on a Friday before a 3-day weekend to interview on Tuesday. Then received an email with a questionnaire to complete and return within 1 business day. Interviewed on Tuesday via video conference with 3 people -- 3 people who seemed inexperienced at interviewing and not at all happy to be there. None of them told me what their positions were, explained how their positions related to the open position, or elaborated on the position they were looking to fill. I waited at the reception desk for 15 minutes before leaving, being ignored by no fewer than 6 people in the office, because I wanted to get email addresses of the people I'd interviewed with to send thank-you emails. I finally gave up and left. The next day, I received an email thanking me for completing the questionnaire and telling me they would call me in for an interview if they felt I fit the position. Not sure anyone really knew what was going on. After a month, I finally emailed the person who sent me the questionnaire and asked if she knew what the status of the position was. She said she would forward to the hiring manager and get back to me. I did get a "no thank you" email within a couple of days.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were typical and appropriate to the position: why Kaiser? Questions about management style, what kind of work environment you prefer, etc.

title: New Graduate, RN MedSurge Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews total. The first interview was a panel interview of approximately six people interviewing a large group of about 30 interviewees. They asked everyone to introduce themselves, their certifications and their nursing motto. After introductions, we had to introduce the person sitting next to us and describe one achievement of theirs. Lastly, they had each person draw a question out of a basket that contained behavioral type questions. Then they sent us all home. 

I heard six candidates were called for a second interview, and I was one of them but did not get an offer. 

The second interview included two of the hiring managers and myself. It was only 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe a specific challenging task that you experienced at your last job, and how you handled it.

title: Administrative Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was two rounds and both were in-person interviews. I met several team members and they asked me various behavior-based questions. Some were typical questions that I get asked in almost all interviews and then some were also based on my future goals and how well I plan to stay with this team.
Interview Questions: What are you weaknesses?

title: Senior Supplier Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Hillsboro, OR) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Internal referral led to an initial phone screen with the recruiter followed by 6 panel and one face to face interview. The interview process started in earnest (05/24) and stretched over a period of two months, with multiple phone panel  interviews and just one tace-to-face interview with the thing manager. A verbal offer was eventually made on the 26th of July ( after a 8 week process laced with uncertainty) with a written one 4 days later.  Coincidentally I also had an offer from another company  and I had informed Kaiser that the other offer was offering more money  so needed a day or two to confirm my acceptance; the other offer was from a state income tax-free state too! The hiring manager showed no objection to that. However, the next morning the recruiter called me and accused me of stringing them along and said that people with multiple offers were unreliable as they were not likely to stay... in a follow up call proceeded to rescind the offer;  his tone and phone demeanor were extremely unprofessional. This after me telling the hiring manger that I was leaning towards Kaiser and that I needed a few hours to understand the implications of  acceptance of an offer that meant leaving quite bit of money on the table. 
I guess Kaiser's mentality was "beggars can't be choosers" !! Strangely enough I was contacted the next day by a recruiting company for a contact position at Kaiser for the same job with the same boss!!
Interview Questions: Accomplishments and the process involved in getting to these accomplishments. Cordial panel interviews and no trick questions.

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, followed by in person interview.  Phone Interview with hiring Director, it really turned into a great conversion about Kaiser and its history (you may want to read up on it prior to interview).   Second interview was with program manager I would be directly working under and her questions were more in line with my skills and what I would bring to the team.
Interview Questions: Went through my resume of work experience and asked situational questions for handling Problems on the network and experience with ITIL methodology

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: one on one interview, asked about reasons for wanting to volunteer. What will i be contributing to kaiser? do i know any other languages than english and how can i help their patients.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for kaiser?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, waited to see if I would hear back, and I did 2 weeks later. First was a phone interview then the recruiter offered an in person interview. Went in at my appointed time, 4 other girls were there, but we interviewed with different people, not a panel interview. I haven't had an interview like this before, so it was a little difficult to concentrate when you can hear others having their interview. Interviewed 4/12/2016, they said we should hear back by mid May.
Interview Questions: Tell a time that you failed, and how did you fix it?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview for question and answer portion, then a mock evaluation is performed on one of the interviewers.  30 minutes given to perform the subjective and objective portion of the evaluation.
Interview Questions: General interview question with interviewee asking most of the questions.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Telephone screening done by recruiter and then hiring manager. In person multiple panel interview, scenario presentation on employee management and improving processes. How do you deal with difficult employees, and performance management experience and what was your role and how you supported direct report.
Interview Questions: Questions included: Your weakness and strengths, Difficult situation at work and how you death with it, behavioral questions

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Woodland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. The interview took only 10 minutes. I actually knew the supervisor who interviewed me from the previous company we worked for in the past. I believe they may be doing group interviews now.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Kennesaw, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
About a week after applying online I received an email to take an assessment. I then received a call for an interview about a week after I took the assessment and the interview was scheduled for 2 weeks later. 

The interview took about 45min and there was two interviewers. The interviewers first introduced themselves then asked about maybe 6 scenarios that related to business and how I  handled them; you had to be specific. I was told they had more interviews for the positions and would be in contact with me within about two weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to use your expertise to help a co-worker. (Be specific)

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job through kaiser employment website. Within in a month later, received a call to schedule an in person interview. During the interview, the questions were dictated from the paper guideline. I was interviewed by the pharmacy manager and pharmacy technician super visor.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness.

title: DBS Compliance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to the on campus recruiter. I sent in my resume. They emailed me asking me to come in to the office. There was no phone interview. The interview was with a panel of 6 people. They were all very nice and the offer was extended about a week later.
Interview Questions: They ask you to be able to explain in detail your project experience.

title: INROADS Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Completed a screening interview with the INROADS regional director. After they decided I would be a good fit, was submitted to departments within Kaiser by recruiter. Did a phone interview with a department manager. The interviewer asked basic behavioral questions and questions specific to position and compatibility. Interviewer was very supportive and was interested in me as a person (interests, hobbies, etc.). 

Once you get a manager interview, you hear rather quickly. Make sure you practice responses and become an expert on the position and how your skills and knowledge contribute to the position. There are a good number of applicants, so being confident in your potential in the specific position is key.
Interview Questions: Q: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Service Associate (Scheduling Appointments) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Buckhead, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Service Associate- Appointment Scheduler.  I applied on 4/8/16, they called 4/22 to schedule an interview for 4/30.  When I  entered the lobby there were 7 people waiting & I was 40 mins early.  Each person was called in individually to interview with 2 interviewers in different areas of the building (I interviewed with 2 women).  The interview was relaxing & lasted about 30 mins.  They were both pleasant.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself?
2. What error have you made & how did you fix it?
3. Tell me about when you turned  a situation around & made the customer happy?
4. What would your employer say about you?
5. What are your Strengths?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked by the physician over phone to come and interview with them. Following the interview, there was no follow up or any response to the email or phone. Left messages for the recruiter and the physician with no response. This is unprofessional. 

For another interview at Kaiser again, the physician asked if I wanted to join them after full panel interview. There was no meeting with HR on benefits. How could anyone accept offer without knowing? When I did ask questions about benefits and had them answered and then expressed interest in joining, the interviewing physician said that they offered the position to another doctor!!!
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult case you have had to deal with.

title: Radiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly group.   Radiologists are likable , creating very encouraging environment to work at.  I was also able to meet with the Physician in Chief of the hospital as well as the chiefs from other departments.  I was also able to meet with the staff , including the managers and many of the technologists.  I was given the tour of the facility and shown the imaging devices they have.  Overall I was able to assess the group and I believe they were able to assess me if I would be the right fit for the position.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to move to California?  Why do you want to work for this hospital?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was an intern the summer prior to getting hired on full time. So I had already gone through the internship interview with my current manager. When she interviewed me for the full-time position, we just touched base and asked me a few more questions about how I work with others and balance multiple projects / deadlines.
Interview Questions: How do I manage multiple deadlines and projects?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was on point short and sweet. They had a detailed job description and knew what they were looking for to ensure the right fit. The Hiring Coordinator was great she knew the right questions to ask to gain the information the hiring manager needed from my history.
Interview Questions: It was a panel interview so it was mainly a discussion of each of our history and how well we could/would work together.

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fairfax, VA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth they made me feel extremely comfortable. They asked five very simple questions and she was super nice. And I like how they let you know on the spot if you got the job or not.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Operations Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview with hiring manager followed by and in-person panel with 3 managers. Final interview with senior manager in person. The panel interview was the longest (about 1.5 hours) and I was asked a lot of different scenario questions. I was also asked to complete a skills assessment online. All my references were called.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you encountered an ethical dilemma at work and how you responded.

title: New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first step after the application was a phone interview with the nurse recruiter (behavioral and company based questions). Once you moved on from there the 2nd step was a 5 person panel interview (behavioral and clinical based questions).
Interview Questions: What would you do if your patient was bleeding?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: i applied online.  i received a call from the nurse manager regarding an opening approximately one month later.   in person interview with manager and assisted manager.  received offer within one week.
Interview Questions: what are your goals? any further educational goals?

title: Survey Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Responded to a posting on Facebook by an alumnus of my school and was leaving the position. She asked for my resume and a cover letter, 2 weeks later contacted me about an on-site interview. First interviewed with the manager; very casual and friendly. Then took an assessment, ~1 hour, then had a panel interview, about 1 hour. One member on the panel in particular was very unprofessional, made a lot of unnecessary comments, and overall seemed suspicious of me, for some reason. One of my worst interview experiences ever.
Interview Questions: Describe what a P-value is in layperson's terms.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with a panel of four social workers and the assistant department administrator. I was asked questions about my previous work experience and about my current interest in medical social work.
Interview Questions: Have you ever made a mandated report to CPS?

title: Financial Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds: 1st there was a phone interview, 2nd was a 2 hr test which encompass a few excel and accounting questions then went into a case study you had to answer. The final interview was a panel interview with three team members
Interview Questions: Pretty standard interview questions, but there was one trick question, "How would you weigh a plane with a scale?"

title: Data Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 3 phone interviews, including one panel interview (like a conference call), and one in person interview. I felt the interviewers asked good questions, and were kind and respectful. They answered my questions completely.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself...

title: /Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for an internship but was offered an Analyst position. I interview with a recruiter over the phone and Submitted short answer questions via word ducument. Then I drove 65 miles for a panel interview. A week later I did another interview with managers over the phone from Oakland. I accepted the position but then a week later, the position was reascended. The explanation was that, HR did not approve.
Interview Questions: Behavioral and critical thinking questions to measure how one will handle situations.

title: Senior Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was a panel process broken into three parts. The first, a questionnaire on personal demographics and past experiences. The second, the actual interview with two team managers, and the last portion, a writing proficiency assessment. Each segment was allotted thirty minutes. For the first interview, I was asked to share my career experience and background. Most, if not all, questions were behavioral in nature. Both interviewers were very friendly, thorough, and professional. It was also very easy to communicate with them. They replied to my emails and received all my calls. 

Two and half weeks later, I was asked to return for a second interview with another team manager. She was very professional and further explained the details of the job requirements (i.e., telecommuting, best hours to start commute, even which route to take as we lived just a few towns away from one another). The interview was about thirty minutes. The bulk of the questions were more about my work style and ethics. By the time it was done I was confident I was going to be offered the position -- which came two days later from the director of the department!
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you had to deliver difficult news while maintaining control of the situation.

Describe a situation that required a number of things to be done at the same time. How did you handle it? What was the result?

What are some of the problems that you frequently encountered in trying to get your work done? What did you do to anticipate and prevent those problems?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Well it was one on one interview. First, I applied online, then I received an email asking about me and my personality. Then it took awhile before I received a phone call from a recruiter. I followed up 3 weeks later. Then I got a call from the DA for an interview. I was interviewed by 2 Supervisors and the DA. They ask a lot of questions then i wait for their call. Overall it took almost 6 months to get hired. So for any applicants out there... Don't loose hope. You will get a call soon and If not just keep applying trust me I applied so many times.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went for an interview on march 28th, i was offered the position on the 29th. It went good. There were two managers and the head nurse. They were very friendly and it was a very comfortable interviews they didn't read off a packet of questions.
Interview Questions: what does kaiser believe/motto?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser Permanente first focused on a phone interview try the HR department to begin the screening process. This interview was completely behavioral (strengths, weaknesses, etc.). Following this, there was a second round interview conducted with my manager. He asked for more specific questions about me, my prior experience, and why I would be a good fit at this company.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you failed at something and what you did to fix it...

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick but organized. First, the recruiter sent me an email regarding the skills test. After I passed and submitted the results, the recruiter contacted me the following day to set up an interview. The interview was quick and straight to the point. Two pharmacists and at least 20 minutes. After the interview, they pulled me aside and congratulated me because I got the position.
Interview Questions:
What is your weakness? 
Why do you want to leave your current job?
Describe a difficult coworker and how did you handle it

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I was contacted via email to coordinate scheduling the following interviews - STEP 1: brief phone interview with a recruiter STEP 2: face-to-face interview with the hiring manager STEP 3: Two additional panel interviews and an interview with the department lead.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser Permanente? What do you know about the organization?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: They're just questions but make sure you practice real hard on those and give them what you've learned cause you can be what they're looking for but end up choosing someone else.
Interview Questions: Make sure you know what your doing

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were two phone call interviews. The first was with my manager and another intern and the second with my manager, the intern and a few other directors who I would work with throughout the summer internship. The organization is very relational and I could tell that from they way the individuals who interviewed me responded to my answers. I was very pleased with the entire process!
Interview Questions: Pretty standard interview questions. Asked me about my background, why I was interested in Kaiser Permanente and some questions about making hard decisions and leadership.

title: Departmental Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a longer process than normal. I applied online and it was a couple weeks until I got the call from a recruiter about this position asking a couple of basic questions about why I want to work for Kaiser, etc. She really liked my answers and told me I should be expecting a call from the hiring manager in about a week and even gave me her direct line if I didn't hear back. In exactly a week I didn't hear anything so I called her back and left a message. That same day she called me back and advised me that she did forward my information and it was up to the hiring manager to make the decision to call me. About exactly 4 total weeks later, the hiring manager ended up calling me and described the position for me as well as asked me to come in for an interview. She wanted me to come in the next day but we agreed to 2 days later. I went to the interview and it was quick, maybe 20 mins. She really liked me and, with the experience I have, I was perfect for the position. She basically hired me on the spot and said she would forward my info to the recruiter as soon as the interview ended. Two days later, I received a call from the same recruiter offering me the position. I accepted and the same day received my offer letter as well as drug test info. I did my drug test the very next day. Once that was done, my background check was still processing and they even asked for my old W2 or check stubs for my very first job that was 8 years ago. The background check was the most lengthy, about 2 weeks and a few days just to complete. FYI: Expect this and make sure u have either a W2 or pay stubs for all your old jobs up until 10 years ago. Once that was done I received a call to do a health screening and physical exam. All your immunizations have to be up to date so be sure to have that. But once u reach that point, you're pretty much hired and u will receive info from HR to do the other PW and orientation info. Overall it took about a 3 weeks from the offer to officially hired
Interview Questions: How do you feel about gossip in the work place?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: After a phone screen with the in-house recruiter, I met with the hiring manager and someone deeply familiar with the role. Within a couple of days I met with another key executive. Then a few business partners in a series of 1-on-1 interviews. The first few interviews were a mix of behavior-based and ''how would you..." questions. Later interviews were conversational, seemed more like vetting me, influencing me with their interests and helping me get a sense of key stakeholders, which was welcome and helpful.
Interview Questions: How would you approach the areas where you had less/no expertise?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Bakersfield, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Treated like a back door swinging in and out and the process was very stressful and humiliating. Thats all I would like to add because I do not want to be on their hit list for anything negative.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: OR Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I have always wanted to work for Kaiser. I finally was called to interview. I was interviewed by six people. They made me feel extremely uncomfortable. They were not welcoming at all. I have been a nurse in the operating room for eighteen years and have specialized in open heart surgery. They never even asked me a question about surgery. After that interview, I realized that Kaiser isn't somewhere I want to work.
Interview Questions: What is the most important thing to you in your home life?

title: TechnologyProgram Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a fairly simple phone interview with the team that I would be working with. They asked basic questions about my resume and leadership experience. The difficulty level of the questions was about average, just make sure that you know Kaiser Permanente's mission and goals. After the phone interview, the main recruiter contacted me with an offer and steps to move forward.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to be a leader.

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Leandro, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: They called me by phone to set up an interview. When I went in there were 2 managers interviewing me and asking me very basic clinical questions and personal questions.
Interview Questions: Name your greatest weakness

title: Residency Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews, 1 with HR recruiter over the phone, 2nd with the GME office manager and director, 3rd with the program director. Had to complete an application online, then submit a snapshot answering additional questions not asked in the general application. Overall process took 4 months from applying to job offer. Onboarding took 6 weeks.
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from other candidates applying for this job.

title: Innovative Stratrgy Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy going.They made sure I was comfortable. It was a phone interview. It was an hour long phone conversation and I was allowed to ask questions at the end. The interview went well, but I was not given an offer.
Interview Questions: What was would your least favorite professor say about you and what would your favorite professor say to you? How do you manage time? Why Kaiser Permanente? What are your future goals?

title: Video Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted by phone to set up interview appointment. Asked some screening questions about basic qualifications. Used the opportunity to ask a bit more about history of the department. At the interview, after initial small talk, was asked to outline skills. Answered by providing specific examples that illustrated skills and successful completion of task. At the end of the interview, asked about next steps in process.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge of conveying medical content in a video?

title: Senior Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with with a sr manager, who was very nice and warm. He went over the organization grid and the goals of the company.  He asked me my go though my resume with him, and after about 30min I left and than received an email asking me to come back and meet with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations, how do you prioritize your work.

title: Health Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: On phone interview with department lead. A few days later I heard back in an email with a letter of acceptance . Pretty straightforward interview process. He asked about my experiences, interests, and more specific questions about time management and coursework
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, and how your experiences are relevant to this role

title: RN Employee Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
called to set up interview
Interview conducted in managers office
Was asked a series of questions related to job
Manager and department leader both were there.
It felt ok during interview but later learned they had already contacted a former employee to interview for the same job so I should NOT have waisted my time. I will not again.
Interview Questions: what  do employees do with a positive tb test

title: Hospice Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was wonderful with 2 managers in the department with questions and answers from both managers and from me. It was scheduled at a time that was convenient for me which I appreciated. It turned out to be an great experience and I have nothing but good things to say about it.
Interview Questions: What is you experience in Hospice?

title: Human Capital Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a role with Colorado Permanente Medical Group. Had a phone interview with a talent selection specialist. Was asked to complete the Hogan Assessment online. Following those results, I was asked to set-up a "fit interview" with the same person who did the initial phone interview. This interview had mostly behavioral-based questions. I was told that a successful "fit interview" would lead to them flying me out for an in-person interview. They contacted me afterwards and asked me about my availability for an in-person interview and I provided the information. There was a delay in hearing from them. I reached out. The talent selection specialist said the Director wanted to speak with me before booking the travel and that I should expect a phone call from him. After two days, I had not received a phone call. The talent selection specialist reached out to inform me that they had decided to make an offer to someone else and that they would be in touch if this person declined. The person ended up declining a few days after and they asked me if I was still interested, but I had already accepted another job offer. I thought this job might have been a good fit. I would have appreciated the Director actually reaching out like I was told he would. Overall, the process was fairly simple and the communication with the talent selection specialist was transparent. Would advise them to be more decisive in the process instead of leading candidates to believe they are going to get an in-person interview and then changing their minds.
Interview Questions: Your typical "tell me about a time..." questions.

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got called in for an interview for the Oakland location it was with the pharmacy manager and a hiring manager. Overall the questions were as expected (scenerio questions) and also after the verbal was a hands on counting cash in a cash register. You had to make the register balance out to an exact $200 I was not expecting that at all. Other then that it was ok. I got a call back the same day and got offered the job!
Interview Questions:
1)If you had an irate customer upset how would you deal with him?
2) how would you describe your former manager?
3) if your manager could improve you on something what would that be?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with 3 other nurses. It was not competitive, as we were not all vying for the same position. I found it odd, but not intimidating. I felt sometimes that others were forced to speak about more personal matters in front of the group. For example, about why the nurse was leaving her current situation. I wasn't entirely comfortable listening in.
Interview Questions: What could we bring uniquely to the job?

title: Inventory Control Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was set up nicely with panel type interview. After the interview was over I was told that I did GREAT! And that I would also Definitely be hearing from them on Monday. Two weeks went by and I never got a call, only an email telling me someone else had got the job. Lesson learned-never get your hopes up when someone says they will call you.
Interview Questions: How to handle a business situation

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was good.  Took a long time to get a interview, but the group was nice.  I faxed my resume directly to human resources and tested in person as well as applied in person.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a aggressive person over the phone

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went through the first interview by phone, the next day I received a call from the office Director to schedule an in-person interview. 5 days later, I was in room with director and administrator. Very relaxed atmosphere, questions were asked from a bullet list and they wrote down my answers word for word. Not as bad as I would have imagined.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview, the interviewer came off a little cold and condescending. Surprisingly, he wanted to move forward with the next steps of the interview process which is the in-person panel interview. Unfortunately, he never called back nor did he respond to my follow-up email. I thought it was very unprofessional and rude.Kind of shows what type of people you would be working with.  Wasted my time and efforts when I could have spent it elsewhere.
Interview Questions: questions on statistics, pretty basic knowledge if you know it.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fairfield, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first got a call from a recruiter who asked me some questions based on education and experience. I then had to wait for my info to be sent to the local manager. She called me about 2 weeks later to come in for a formal interview. The Interview took about 30 minutes. It was with 2 managers but they were very welcoming. They didn't ask any hard questions, usually the basics- why should we hire you, what are your strengths, what are your weaknesses.
Interview Questions: Is the commute to work going to be an issue for you?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Mountain View, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Process was a little funny. I applied to the job late January. Was called and talked to the week of Feb 8th. Was asked to come in later that week. Had a panel interview wth four managers for a full time float position. Thought it was going horrible but didn't think anything good when it lasted 45 minutes. Was told they needed to finish interviewing so like my past couple interview I thought I was the first person. Had the interview at 815 and was called at 315 telling me they finished interviews and wanted to offer me the position. This was a Friday. Was called on Tuesday letting me know two departments offered me a position. Chose the float position and got my offer letter Wednesday morning. Finished everything that morning and my background check started today. Estimated start date is March 21st.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: was pretty basic generic questions. Nothing over the top. The on boarding process however takes a long time as well as waiting for a call back after applying for jobs. First I got a phone call and completed the phone interview, then an in person interview, then a panel style and got to meet the team and slight tour of the clinic.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to be a medical assistant?
How would you handle conflict?
How do you feel about working with xyz?

title: Project Manager I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. First contact: Was sent an assessment test through an email. Called maybe 3 weeks later to come in for an interview. Met with a 3 person panel. The interview was about an hour. The facility was really nice, free parking. I sensed the job was entry level by hearing the responses to my questions on the job description (even though it had Masters required), so I asked a salary range. They didn't give me an answer. I thought the interview went well, but I could have come across as too experienced. I am trying to change from Consultant/Contract to full time in my field.
Interview Questions: Tell about yourself. Give examples on PM work.

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty lay back. I have interviewed with the pharmacy managers as well as some of the clinical pharmacists. They didn't even ask me any clinical questions. Basically, they just asked me about my past pharmacy experiences and some of the standard questions
Interview Questions: Tell them about myself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Clackamas, OR) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online and did not get a confirmation email back. I attempted to call HR to follow up and was told that I wasn't permitted to "cold call" unless I had a contact name. Two silent weeks went by and I was  surprised, yet excited when I received a phone call to set up an interview. I was told it would be a panel interview made up of three nurse managers asking interpersonal type of questions. The interview was without a doubt difficult. Four nurse managers were present and I was told they perform behavioral based interviews. They handed me the outline of the interview so I could follow along. There were several questions with multiple parts, I felt nervous but confident with my answers. Toward the end of the interview they gave me a two part case study with a handful of written questions to be answered as well as verbal questions from the panel on what my nursing judgement would include. After the interview, I received a tour of the unit. I followed up with thank you email, but recieved a rejection phone call one week later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you questioned the current practice and brought about a change to improve your team/workplace?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a panel of 4 people, 3 from the internship team and 1 from HR. They all took turns and switched off asking me their own questions while all taking notes as I answered the questions. The interview lasted about 30 minutes. While they asked a lot of questions, they also told me a lot about the company and answered my own questions.
Interview Questions: What was one of the most challenging things you have faced and how did you overcome it?

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the company website. No HR screening phone call. Received a request for a 30-min phone interview with the hiring managers via email 2 weeks after applying. I heard back from them after 1 week and had a follow-up in-person interview at the regional office. The in-person interview lasted about 3 hours and it consisted of: 30-min with hiring managers, 30-min with other team members, 30-min with the executive director, and a 30-min case presentation following a 1-hr case preparation time. Both technical and behavioral questions were asked.
Interview Questions: "How would you rate your excel skills?"

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview process at a local office, met several employees while there. Casual environment. Completed online typing assessment before sitting down with a supervisor for formal interview. Whole process was less than an hour.
Interview Questions: A time when you did not agree with a supervisor or company policy and how you overcame that

title: Finance Strategy & Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
2 Part Interview Process

1st Part: Phone Screening
This was an unscheduled phone screening and was with the hiring manager. Purely behavioral and lasted around 30 minutes.

2nd part: Skype interview with 3 directors.
This was also mainly behavioral. Many of the questions are more geared towards situations such as "How do you typically prioritize your daily tasks?".
Interview Questions: How do you typically prioritize your tasks?

title: Case Coordination Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an email and submitted my resume and was called right away by the agency and was told about the position available with Kaiser Permanente and that I would be called shortly for a phone interview. It was relatively quick. They asked about my previous positions, what I did there and for how long and what were my reasons for leaving. They were more interested in the kind of personality I had to see if I would be a good match for the company. As soon I hung up I was called by the temp agency and was told the job was mine.
Interview Questions: I disclosed to the person interviewing me who would later be my supervisor that I left one position because I did not like the work environment. He asked me to elaborate on that and describe the specific work environment that I did not like and why I felt that way.

title: Senior E-Learning Instructional Designer With SCPMG Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first part of this process was an interview with two individuals, being called back for a 2nd interview with one of the individuals from the first interview and Kaine Kerkhoff, head of the unit. Finally, there was a 3rd interview by phone with several participants from various Kaiser Locations.
Interview Questions: I'm concerned that being you come from West Virginia, you won't be open-minded enough for this position. Convince me that you will be open-minded enough.

title: Finance Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
2 - Interview Process

First Interview was a phone call without any notice. She asked basic behavioral questions.
Second Interview was a panel interview with three different directors that work in the Finance department. This interview had both behavioral and technical questions broken down into small case situations.
Interview Questions: When looking at risks associated with a major transaction, what are your steps in prioritizing the basic structure to mitigating the risk?

title: Area Practice Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Panel Interview with five members.
The panel interview consisted of five members consisting of the direct boss, finance director, nursing director, past perioperative operating room director and another finance director.
Interviewer each as about three questions each ranging from leadership situational questions, examples of best practice, use of analytics, goals and movement from supply chain operations to other positions.
Interview Questions: Tell about a tough time convincing someone or group to change their minds? What did you do?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Washington, DC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty intimidating. It is not one on one at all. You are interviewed in front of a panel that consists of nurses, doctors, clinical assistants and anyone else they feel like bringing in.
Interview Questions: What would make you a good fit?

title: Senior Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Mountain View, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone screening, which lasted about 20 minutes. I was told that I would get a phone call back in a week or so if they wanted to proceed further. I received a call after 1 week and it was a Panel Interview of 3 interviewers. The interview lasted about 2 hours. I received the offer after I left.
Interview Questions: This role demands you to handle multiple projects and tasks. How do you plan on completing them?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a group, 4 Sup/Managers that take turns asking questions from packet, 1 Hiring manager in the back, was never introduced. Given a 4 to 5 page packet, 1st page,state your name, and everyone  answers 2 typical interview questions, second page you team up with someone by alphabet order in pairs, you have 4 questions, you pick two, you interview your partner & stand up and recite their answer. next few pages, go around the room answer typical interview questions, the last step, was one of the managers read a quick brief story, and on the last page of packet, you had four questions you had to answer, from the quick short story. Pretty much went as others have stated, managers write down everything you say, may ask additional question, depending on your response. Waited in the lobby, told us half were free to go, other half went back for another one on one with managers.  All the  questions on glassdoor about Kaiser Cust Serv postion was asked in interview.
Interview Questions: Pay attention to short story & take notes as fast as you can

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online.

First step was a phone interview with the hiring manager - was told about the position, asked why I was interested.

Second step was an in-person panel interview with the hiring manager and the team - introductions of everyone there, introduced myself, asked the usual interview questions. It was more conversational than a back-and-forth questioning. 

Third step was an one-on-one interview with the direct report of the hiring manager - very casual, very laid-back. Spoke about my interests again and the layout of the department/team and what type of projects the team worked on.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in the position?
Describe a situation in which you ran into a problem and solved it creatively.
What are your strengths?
What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: No organization. A total of two interviewers and four candidates. The last candidates to answer would repeat a lot of what the previous ones said. Lots of bouncing around, bouncing off answers.
Interview Questions: If we called your current or past employer, how would they describe you?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then got a call 12 days after the application date. We scheduled the interview process with two interviewers. Pretty easy and laid back. Overall experience is positive.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions only, and discussed the position and hours.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: received initial phone screen few days after applying online, Interviewed with hiring manager and other pharmacists, mostly behavioral questions and how my experience qualifies me for the job. received offer within a few weeks.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time you had to work with a difficult person

title: Financial Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Referred by 3 internal employees. Contacted by hiring manager to apply. Then contacted by HR. HR phone interview included behavioral questions (skills, working with others, why I wanted to join KP, etc.). Next in person interview with hiring manager that included analytical questions tied to background/ work experience. Second in person with CFO for final approval. Offer emailed one week later by HR. Total process took 2 months from first contact to offer letter.
Interview Questions:
Q: What are your top skills that you bring to this position
Q: Tell me a time you worked in a team and things did not go as planned
Q: Tell me a time you failed
Q: Why do you want to work here?
Q: Short case question (explain your logic and thinking process)

title: Customer Service Call Center Corona Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online applied 12/9 and assessment completed that Saturday. Received two calls and then scheduled for group interview with 8 other people at call center in Corona for 1/7/16. Arrived on time and was kept waiting with other candidates over 30 minutes past scheduled interview time with no information or updates while waiting. Then we are all summoned past front door and into small conference room and we are greeted by 3 people (a blond African American woman) a bald older caucasian thin man and another Caucasian man with a chin beard that only provide first names. We are seater and they ask us to read the first pageof a printed handout with about 6 pages. One of the center seated people describe the position, pay, and amount of calls center answers. Questions are not to be asked until end of sections are completed or time has been alloted per panel of screeners. Print and sign name on page one. Then turn to page two. Then one by one stand up and introduce by providing name. Read first question and answer:  provide a quality in your current or past position that would help in the Role you are applying for? Second part of question. When or how often are given feedback in a current or past position how do you feel about it? Then completed by everyone: turn to page two. Please rearrange yours lives by last name in alphabetical order and team up with person next to you. Then take the time to ask them 2 of 4 selected questions. Then starting from first to last present the question and answer me to group.  A. When would you think it an acceptable reason to miss work? And 3 other vague questions. Then you finish the rest of the pages which are behavioral questions. At some point the hiring manager slipped into the room and was not introduced until 30 minutes after sitting in the corner to observe. The panel was impersonal very unfriendly and felt like a parole hearing. Kaiser expectations are big on attendance and punctuality in this role and call center but they seem to not display that same courtesy to canidates.
Interview Questions: See above but the final one was why should Kaiser pick you to work for them.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was technical and professional. You should have the analytical skills as a data analyst. Also, you should be a quick learner and can deal with really large database. The interviewers were very nice and patient. They would ask your background and questions like why you left your former company.Quick turn around.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience in XX company
