title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. Typing test caught me off guard (tests for grammar, spelling, and words per minute). Human Resources department were super nice. The whole process was about one month long.
Interview Questions: Q: What is something about yourself that you feel needs improvement?

title: Psychology Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very slow.  3-6 weeks between interviews. Started with a phone interview out of the blue.  Then contacted again 6 weeks later for initial in-person interview.  Then second interview.  Then it took months till I heard anything.  The process was pleasant other than the awkwardness of having to wait so long.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?  Give an example.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very long process with a lot of hurdles to jump over.  Almost overkill. A drug, personality and skills test for a non-operational role (i.e. backoffice Finance) does not apply for this role, but understand that this is a healthcare company.
Interview Questions: Questions were basic and expected for the position

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview began on-time. My interview was a group panel interview. Experienced several glitches initially, the panel asked a variation of questions, panel otherwise uneventful. I enjoyed the interview and the interview panel.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
This was a phone interview (I was not invited back for an in-person interview).  

Scheduling the phone interview was more difficult than it should have been.  The recruiter must have been extremely busy, as it took him a week to get back to me after our initial introductory emails.  Once we settled on a date and time for the phone interview, I waited anxiously by the phone, but he never called.  It took another two weeks for us to finally connect on the phone.

The interview itself was fine; the questions were as one would expect, and lasted maybe half an hour.
Interview Questions: Generic questions: Why are you looking to leave your current position?  What type of computer programs do you currently use?

title: Obstetrics Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, 2 supervisors, 2 charge nurses, 2 OB Techs. Each asked a question and wrote down my answers. It was a bit strange, no one offered to shake my hand before or after the interview. Interview only lasted about 10 minutes. Was told HR is taking a long time to process new hires & not to expect to hear anything for a while. They ended up giving the position to a former employee.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very interactive panel interview.  Met with the unit supervisor, charge nurse, nursing manager, nurse educator, and assistant nursing director.  The experience was intense but gratifying.  After the interview I was contacted by an HR representative and given a job offer.  I quickly accepted and was promptly told as to when training would start.  The process was relatively hassle free, professional and easy.
Interview Questions: Cannot disclose

title: Senior Database Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First the recruiter calls you for a Phone interview then schedules you to come for a panel interview.

The hiring manager said that there are other applicants and he will let me know their decision within 3 weeks. 

After 3 weeks I got the offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had conflict with your co-worker and how did you handle it and what was the outcome?

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online.  Phone call for in-person interview.  Friendly.  Basic questions about why Kaiser, customer service experience, high volume experience, hours available to work, etc.  Easy interview process.  I've heard some people have been in group settings for the interviews.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Kaiser pharmacy?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Milpitas, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple interviews and each included a panel of people in which you answered questions to. All interviewers were professional and it was very organized.  The questions were typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: What sorts of skills do you have that could use improvement?

title: Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Antioch, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied in July, contacted in November, phone interview in December, face to face interview in January, told they'd get back to me in 3 days, 3 weeks later I'd still heard nothing, called them, was told they were still interviewing and it would be another 3 weeks, called 2 weeks after that, was told that the position was filled. By then it was February.
Interview Questions: Standard questions-- what's your background, tell us a little about yourself, how would you handle a situation involving conflict, what's your greatest strength, in what area(s) do you need to improve, what would your friends/colleagues say about you, what is your experience working with ___ types of materials/programs/tasks, etc.

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Kind of intimidating both managers definitely had there poker face on ...other then that was fairly easy had to take a medical terminology test before hand in order to land an interview with the managers
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Filled out an application online, and was sent a test via email 2 days later. Immediately got a call back from a recruiter after submitting the test and was scheduled for an interview a week later.

Day of interview, was interviewed by 2 managers. It was more laid back then I thought. Was offered the position the same day.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a customer was upset by the care they received before you? How would you handle the situation?

title: Web Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Spoke w/ team via phone and in person. The team was just coming together so they didn't really know what they Had to take drug test and pass background check.
Interview Questions: typical lame interview questions... where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. Asked behavioral questions no patho or clinical questions. Was a little stressful because I really wanted to shine but I just answered each question as honestly as possible
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you handled a difficult family.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: There are 30 candidates. The interview is 4 hours long. There are 2 parts. It is a group interview in front of a panel of clinical managers.  First part they ask you basics like why you chose nursing and what unit you wanna work in. Second part, you choose a question out of a basket.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing? What's your nursing motto?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with HR, 3 in-person 1:1 interviews with Hiring Mgr and/or Executive level supervisors, also a panel interview with various stakeholders. The interviews were mostly conversational and not too many "gotcha" questions were asked. The process was overall pleasant though on the lengthy side - 6 weeks after submitting my resume before I got a call, and then 3 more months after that first call until the offer. Everyone involved was very professional and accommodating.
Interview Questions: What specific reports do you usually run to determine profitability and productivity in your current department?

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied it through recruiting agency (This is a temp to permanent position). The whole process was really fast. I applied on Tuesday (The beginning of  December 2015). Then, the next day, my recruiter called me to set up a phone interview with the hiring manager on Wednesday. At the end of phone interview, the hiring manager invited me for an on-site interview for the following Wednesday. In addition, I am also required to bring a writing sample to my interview. After two weeks of the interview (due to Christmas and New Year's holidays). I got an offer from the hiring manager.
Interview Questions:
Q: What is your strength and weakness?
Q: Why are you interested in this job ?
Q: Have you experienced any challenging situation? How did you deal with it?
Q: how is your organizational skills?

title: Accounting Administrative Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: This position received 750 applicants. They called me about 1 wk after applying and had me take a test online. After that, I was scheduled for my interview about 4 days later. It was a panel style interview with Managers from Nationals, Large, Phone Team & Membership Accounts. There was 4 managers and they had a 2 page sheet with about 6 questions. As soon as you answer, they start writing down everything you say, even if you ask a question like "When can I expect to hear a result", they will answer you, but not until they wrote it down first. I heard 2 days later from the recruiter that I was offered the position & I accepted. Background check took about a month, and since they have new hire training only once monthly, my start date was pushed back 2 months.
Interview Questions:
How do you feel about working in a Team Environment?
What is a flaw that you are aware about?

title: Registered Nurse New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, the next week received a pre-screen questionaire. A few days later invited to a group interview. The interview was 25 candidates, stood up to answer questions 3 times.. 1.) introduce yourself & why nursing 2.) interview person sitting next to you and present  thier information. 3.) Draw a question out of a basket and answer (behavioral type questions). The whole process took 4 hours. Waited 2 weeks to hear about position.
Interview Questions: When was a time you used patience and deligence in a situation with a patient and how did it pay off.

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser Permanente does telephone screening interview first with boss and another person working position you are interviewing for. They describe job position to you and answer your questions. If they like you enough, can either proceed to skype interview or physically have you come to their onsite location where you see the boss, the person with the same position and responsibilities as you, another physician usually parallel your job, and the chief of section boss. They feed you lunch and interview lasts half a day starting in the morning.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Cashier/Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took a while for them to call me but after everything i got the job. The position is oncall so dont know if I should give up my 40 hrs a week for something that is not consistent.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals?

title: TSR Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was relatively easy. They ask you the normal questions regarding how you handle certain situations. Pros and cons of past jobs. It's usually between 1-3 managers interviewing at one time. They want to get a feel for who will be joining their management team.
Interview Questions: What's a bad experience you turned into a positive?

title: Lead Project Manager IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Referred by a friend already on the team.  Completed a phone screen, then put together a business case.  Wasn't a strong fit for the first role and was 'on hold' for 5 months before receiving a call back to interview for a more aligned role.  Was a stronger fit there, and after two conversational interviews with two VPs, received an offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be part of Kaiser Permanente?

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for position three weeks ago, received a email to take pc skills test and typing test. Once test were completed received a call a week after for phone interview. Interview went well, was told I would be contacted for a face to face interview in the month or so. Still waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a customer?

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 2 sets of phone interviews with current or former fellows, then final on-site interview with senior leadership.  Each phone interview lasted about an hour, including behavioral questions and one case study.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in a fellowship, and why Kaiser Permanente's?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took several months and involved phone calls and panel interviews.  There were large periods of silence from the recruiter, and each time I began to assume they had moved me to the no longer interested pile, the recruiter would contact me and tell me they were really high on me but were bogged down with business issues.  The recruiter continually gave me the impression I was their top candidate and it was only a matter of time before I heard the good news of an offer.  In the end I went through a lot of effort when I believe they already knew who they were going to hire and just needed to have a complete pool of candidates for legal reasons.  I had every required and preferred bullet on the position summary covered with many years of experience, but got absolutely no feedback on why I wasn't selected when I asked.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Upon successful completion of the online application, selected candidates will receive an email to complete a "Career Snapshot."  Then KP will schedule a 1st round interview with a panel.  The 2nd (usually final round of interviews) is with hiring manager and usually one other leader from the department.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this job?  Tell us why you would be the best candidate?

title: Ambulatory Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview of about 16 people and 3 managers. There was the get to know you stage where you had to introduce your Partner and then answering a random customer service question.  Then there was the second interviews. It's pretty much just letting them know where you've worked and qualifications.
Interview Questions: what would you do if a member came up to you and seemed bothersome.

title: Registration Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview was pretty easy & everyone was very nice. They made me feel comfortable and let it be known that they we were just having a 'get to know you' conversation
Interview Questions: Describe an experience at your previous position with a difficult client/customer. How did you handle it?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Online application, was contacted by the recruiter to participate in a group interview. 27 people. Shared our qualifications and then answered from a list of questions to the entire group. Very different type of process. They also explained the process before we began. Questions and answers after the interview. Bring a pen and piece of paper.
Interview Questions: How do you motivate a co-worker?

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Richmond, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went in for another interview this morning as this is my fourth time interviewing with Kaiser. The manager greeted me on time and was very forthcoming, it was. 1:1 interview and she asked me questions about my current job responsibilities, plus some situational questions. The manager and I connected right away and I knew instantly that this was the right position for me, despite me going on three other interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your current responsibilities, Strengths and Weaknesses? How do your prioritize your work? What does customer service mean to you?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brought in as a contractor.  Had to adapt to the environment.  Had to be Kaisertized.  Lots of meetings and slow moving methodical environment.  Once you get an NUID and into the identity access management systems.  You have a better chance to for contract and perm positions
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Columbia, MD) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
A phone interview was required first to make sure I understood the job opportunity an what was required.

A in person interview was required next with the Talent coordinator to ask basic questions about my background and qualifications and discuss the job in more detail of was is expected and the next steps in the interview process. 

Was set up for a pane interview
Interview Questions: Why did I become a nurse

title: Communications Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fresno, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online
Tests required for position
Got a call from the hiring Manager
Met with one wonderful manager, she made the interview so easy and comfortable. 
Dude to changes with position, it was placed on hold.
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you over other candidates?

title: Staff Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was set up through The Goodwill pre screening event. I received an email 4 days before the interview from the Goodwill rep stating where and when to report for a group interview in Pasadena. When I arrived and checked in, there were several people waiting in the lobby. We were all given name tags. Some of the people were interviewing for another position. We were led to a room and placed in a certain seating order. The staff introduced themselves. We were asked to do 2 exercises. After we completed the exercises, we were excused. We were given the opportunity to ask questions at the end. We were told that they were developing a talent pool for current and future positions.
Interview Questions: Talk about what you have learned from interviewing your neighbor.

title: Intake Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in September. Received a call in beginning of November for interview. Interview involved 4 people (lead, clerk lead, supervisor and manager) They all asked questions from a paper. Not really hard questions. Interview lasted about 20 minutes. Interview at 10. Back in car at 1023 then call at 118 that I got the job. Yep. .. hired in same day ! Drug test and background is very important. Make sure to stay on top of the background and complete everything their asking. Overall, HUGE blessing and not that hard of a time to get it.
Interview Questions: WHY KAISER?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Positive interview experience, three administrators and one nursing student sat in and interviewed me for about half an hour. They made me feel very comfortable, and we're welcoming. I was lucky enough to be referred over by an employee, and I was one of 7 candidates for the job.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a conflict? And how did you resolve it?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with 2 managers who are experienced in the position.  Questions were relevant to the job rather than just random behavioral questions. The job description was outlined clearly
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where I dealt with an unreasonable customer.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my application online. It took them about 4 months to get back to me and another 2 months to interview and then hire me. I had a phone screen with a recruiter, a second phone screen with the hiring manager, then an in-person panel interview with the team and a final in-person 1:1 interview the hiring manager.  Dealing with HR and the KP recruiter was not an encouraging experience. They were not responsive and their online systems were very old and crufty. 

For the interview itself, I was expecting more technical questions, given that it was for a research position. Instead, most of the questions were the typical "soft" questions about work preferences. I asked the team and the hiring manager a number of questions to better understand the work environment, but I was given an overly rosy picture that did not match reality.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for KP? What are your strengths and weaknesses? Can you juggle multiple projects at one time?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a call from hr to set up a phone interview with recruiter originally it usually took like 30-45 mins. Recruiter called and the whole interview only took like 6 mins just basic questions and receive an e-mail for scheduling group panel interview.
Interview Questions: Why you wanna work here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Telephone Interview by Senior Recruiter to find out if position is a good fit. Senior Recruiter contacted Hiring Manager. Hiring Manager did a telephone interview followed by a face to face job interview. Face to face interview with Hiring Manager and Medical Director. Hiring Manager and Medical Director had cue sheets to ask questions from.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult situation you experienced in dealing with a patient, and how did you handle it, and what was the outcome?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application online for an intern position in their finance department. I received an email about a month later saying they wanted to conduct a phone interview. It was a conference call with two others, and it lasted about 30 minutes. Overall, the interview was very general, nothing out of the ordinary. They did ask for specific examples about taking initiative and leadership skills. All in all, not too bad as long as you prepare like you would for any normal interview.
Interview Questions: What are two characteristics that make you stand out?

title: Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (West Covina, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called me with opportunities. I found out it's their way of getting agents. They reviewed my 37 years of experience. Discussed the training needed. They are looking for licensed people in " home and property" " health and casualty".  They have the training. This takes months and years for the stRt up process.
Interview Questions: Do you wish to stay in the same industry ?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Was a group interview with a panel of 3. Made it easier and calmed the nerves. We were pared with a partner and had to interview them and then present to managers why they would be a good candidate for company.
Interview Questions:
How would you handle a conflict with a coworker? 
Why do you want to work for this department?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received an email for an interview. 5 days later went to the interview where I took a typing test first and after I passed I met with a recruiter who explained the position and asked 3 questions. He told me that he felt I'd be perfect for the position and that HR would call me within a week. She called 2 days later and offered me the job. Now I am waiting on the background check.
Interview Questions: Why KP?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Leandro, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: board of 3 people. asked what you would do in different scenarios. asked about any experience and specify your duties at each job. asked why i believe i should be offered the job at kaiser permanente.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone called reporting chest pains?

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online & received a phone call about two months after! Scheduled an interview for the following Tuesday & got the job offer on Wednesday! Panel interview- basic interview questions!
Interview Questions: Scenario questions- if a fellow associate saw you working faster than you & was angry- what would you tell them?!? etc...

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a call the same day after I filled out an application online. Set a phone interview after 4 days. Was about to attend a group interview but was asked to meet and get interviewed by a manager 2 days prior to the panel interview. Had a one on one informal interview with the assistant manager. She was very nice and relaxed set up. She introduced to me the functions and set up of the unit and answered all the questions I had in mind. She was also very welcoming. Following day was offered the position!!!!
Interview Questions: Why choose Kaiser?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. The questions were not your typical interview questions. What is your favorite color? What animal would you be and why? Describe an experience where you went above and beyond. The rest were typical interview questions. It was fun.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite color

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel like interview. Asked you questions from left to right. They would ask you situational questions based on your work history. Overall it was a good interview, just a bit nerve racking specially if your not good at interviews period.
Interview Questions:
-tell me about yourself? 
-where do you see yourself in 5 years?
-why kaiser?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Questions/scenarios asked by 3 managers present.  Scenarios presented as if you were taking a live call. Depending on your response - would escalate the scenario.  Reviewed the work ethic and expectations..
Interview Questions: How would you manage an upset mother who won't let you talk to gather information?

title: UAT Tester Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: A relatively short meeting (30 minutes) with a Supervisor and Department Head with several succinct questions regarding ability to perform potential job duties. As the job was not very technically challenging, most of the questions had more to do with personal efficacy and ability to stay on-board for the duration.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to execute these types of tests, would tedium bother you, etc.

title: Solutions Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straight forward process that moves fairly slow. First a brief conversation with staffing agency followed by a detailed phone conversation and culminating with a final interview. Started out as a critical immediate requirement, however the start date kept getting pushed for one reason or another. I started nine weeks later than the original proposed start date.
Interview Questions: Mostly Q&A on background and project experience. Hiring manager very tactical in focus.

title: PFT Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Honolulu, HI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: They made me feel comfortable under a stressful situation. I interviewed with 3 people and all 3 were kind and made me feel relaxed.  They did not drill me with odd interview questions.  They focused more on my previous experiences.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 interviews, 1 over the phone and the second is a group interview. The group interview was definitely the more important of the two and you will want to impress the interviewees to get the position. There were 6 interviewees in the group and we all had to draw questions out of a jar and answer them. One of the questions I received was what are the important components of a consultation. Make sure you stand out and you will get the position.
Interview Questions:
What are the important aspects of consultations?
Who is someone you look up to?
Why Kaiser Pharmacy?

title: Clinical Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Washington, DC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
3-4 other COMs present and it was a round-robin experience for questions
Valuable insights and was able to ask questions at the end of the interview
Very transparent in their responses
Good interview overall and happily content with the way it was run
Interview Questions: Describe a time in which you had to provide negative feedback to a colleague.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The response was quick. All tests and processing of information was online or on the phone. The personality test was awkward. The drug screen information was sent via email and was straight forward. The backround check was quicker than expected.  All credentials were sent via email also. Everythingwas straight forward except when I was told the position was given to someone internal and that I had to wait for that persons position to be posted with different hours.
Interview Questions: How would i be able to transition from clinical nurse to advice nurse on the phone?

title: Senior Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview took more two hours. The lady who did my interview was all about Ethical Issue and how to protect the code of conduct. The recruiter asked many questions about my skills.
Interview Questions: What milestone did you accomplish in your last job that was remarkable and would love to share story. Where do you see yourself in this company? Why should I hire you?

title: Ward Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online 
RN called to set up interview
Met at hospital
Usual interview questions 
Personality and what would you do questions 
Start dates and orientation 
Previous job experiences
If hired hr will call you
Drug test background check
Interview Questions:
Why kaiser what do you look for in a manager
What would you do if...why should I pick you over someone else just as qualified what are your strengths

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Why should we hire you? You must have a solid work history, no work gaps. Include all schooling and times attended in work history.Group interview was different and easier than one on one. Recruiters explain process to you step by step
Interview Questions: What is you reason for wanting to work at kaiser?

title: ERA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: 4-5 panel interviewers: 1 ERA, 1 ERA manager, 1 nurse, nurse educator, and director of nursing.  There were situational questions, mostly looking at technical things like "what would you do if patient looked like _______."  Then questions about working in a team environment.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation that was stressful for you and how you handled the situation.

title: Administrative Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just like any other Kaiser job interview the most difficult questions are the only thing that'll make me nervous but overall yeah depends on who you get to interview if their laid back then it should be cooJust like any other Kaiser job interview the most difficult questions are the only thing that'll make me nervous but overall yeah depends on who you get to interview if their laid back then it should be coo
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Administrative Assistant IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter after submitting online application and I was called in to a group interview session. It consisted of around 17 candidates. not fair, because everyone had different questions and some were way easier than others.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to deal with a difficult client? how did you handle it?

title: PC Deployment Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Petaluma, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the project manager from the temp agency and was hired after discussing my interest of the role that day. I had to go through a background check and finish specific paper pertaining to healthcare and Kaisers values.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous work experience.

title: Staff Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy process. They look for someone who has great communication skills and is able to learn quickly. From start to finish the interview process took two weeks.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser Permanente?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was about 3 weeks. First there was a phone interview where they asked basic questions. Then there was a panel interview with the charge nurse and the hiring manager. They took turns asking questions and they were very positive. They said I did great and that they didn't see a reason as to why I wouldn't get hired. A week later they sent me an email stating I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Why should we chose you?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was two hiring managers.  They took turns asking questions.   Interview lasted about 20 minutes.   They want detailed answers and and spend most of there time writing what you are saying and are not making eye contact.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you received excellent customer service

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied in august, got en email 2 weeks later about an interview. Recruiter called me and explained how the process will be, they will ask a lot of scenario questions so be sure to elaborate on each and every question. Had the interview that week on a Friday, met with two managers they write down every single thing you say. So details are key ! That following Thursday I received a call offering me the position ! =) I am currently in training
Interview Questions: name a time you went over and beyond for a customer?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Washington, DC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very formal interview. Was interviewed by two people, one being the pharmacy supervisor, asked about previous work experience and my overall flexibility. Came early and was able to start the interview early and make sure to show charisma when speaking. No one likes a dull interview.
Interview Questions: As a lead tech what role did you play in your pharmacy?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baldwin Park, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied in August, received invite for group panel interview in September. Offered job the week after interview. Whole interview process took 6 hours. All applicants sat in the room with managers. Everyone pulled 2 questions out of a basket and answered. After the questions, we were asked to leave the room so the managers could deliberate. They sent some applicants home. There was a 2nd round of interviews that asked more personal questions to get to know you. The 2nd round is not as a group.
Interview Questions: What specialty do you absolutely not want to work on?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fairfax, VA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: When I arrived they test your typing skills and then one of the supervisors takes you to the back room to give you an interview. You'll know right away if you got the job or not. It was fairly easy. I was asked maybe 6 questions and all were pertaining to my customer service skills.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had the best customer service?

title: RESPIRATORY Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was simple but the hiring process takes at least a month, maybe more.  I was interviewed by the supervisor and assistant supervisor.  They were very polite and not intimidating!  It made the interview very welcoming.
Interview Questions: Explain the flow of blood through the heart

title: Cashier/Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Really easy interview. Didn't ask a lot of questions and I was out within 15 minutes. Depends on the department though. It's not easy to get in unless you know someone.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a difficult challenge and how did you overcome it?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen was with a recruiter. Received an invitation for face to face interview after 3 weeks. The face to face interview was pretty standard with the usual questions such as tell me about yourself, why do you want to work here, what are your strengths and weaknesses, lots of situational questions
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a conflict with a coworker and how did you resolve it?

title: Unit Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Since I was an internal candidate, the position was for on-call. I was already a short-hour employee but due to commute, I was willing to downgrade. My manager called and asked if I was interested in the position and I said Yes.
Interview Questions: How do you handle tough patients?

title: Pediatric Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I completed the application and was emailed by a few positions I applied for to complete their assessment and medication testing. Once completed I got called for an interview for the Oncology Dept. I totally was not prepared for a behavioral type interview. It had been years for me. So needless to say, I bombed it! Got called a week later for another position but as a pediatric nurse which I have experience in. Talked to the recruiter for a food half hour on phone. She gave me many interview tips and made me feel a lot more confident. The following day I had an interview, it was only 3 ladies in the panel this time and they all were very pleasant. The feedback I received back from them was totally positive. The interview was almost hour long. I left feeling great!!
Interview Questions: Make sure you definitely have an understanding of Kaiser's Nursing Mission in your own words.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Oral interview with department manager, assistant department manager and a senior Medical assistant. I completed my internship with the department 2 months prior to getting the call about the open position.  I applied online and was called for the interview within 1 week.
Interview Questions: How would your former employer describe you?

title: Lead Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty Standard. Initial interview with the hiring manager. In person interview with hiring manager and several members of the recruiting team. Final interview with head of group you will support.
Interview Questions: Nothing special. Just the usual resume review, skill assessment and some questions about future direction.

title: Receptionist II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was applying online, got a call back from hiring manager. The interview was very easy,  he explained the job description. Asked me a couple of generic interview questions. Overall felt confident how the interview ended. He took me on a tour of the Hospital and where i would be working. Got a call from HR a week later to take a typing  assessment and passed. Got an offer a week later. In the process of the background check.
Interview Questions: How would you handle challenging co-workers?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Modesto, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy. I spoke with the recruiter twice and was invited for a web questionnaire and phone recording. After review, I was invited for a phone interview screening. I went through two in person interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your typical day

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: to interview they ask a lot of situational questions and they score and rank you based on your answers. Afterwards those scores get put on a list based on the rank and the top people go to the next level.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you feel you failed.

title: Nursing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a face to face review with the manager and it went extremely well. Questions were simple to answer and I was able to learn a lot about the job I'd be performing while there.
Interview Questions: What do I bring to organization

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: KP was very accommodating and offered a telephone interview because I was out of state.  The interview lasted about 45 minutes and consisted of a panel, 1 person was the individual I would be working for and the other was an individual I would be over.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know if I had experience in working with bargaining units.

title: HR Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with managers throughout region and one from West coast. The admin staff was nice and helpful but the HR in charge was vague and impersonable.  They were preparing and hiring for change and asked questions that implied I knew where they were  trying to go.  My research did not reveal any of this information regarding their new direction.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: interviewed by 5-7 doctors. All of the doctors are very nice and questions are straight forward. No questions related medicine. Basically try to understand your living situation to help out the transition from residency program, previous working place or other states etc.
Interview Questions: Where are you living currently ( due to estimate commuting time)?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was automated, which felt very impersonal to me. I calledtuenprovdd number, listened to each question and gave my response, and then pressed # to go to the next question
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult patient and how you handled the situation

title: Marriage and Family Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Stockton, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone/email behavioral interview: basic questions, had to call in to a voicemail recorded portion to answer vignette type questions.  Why do you want to work for us?  Asked about specific scenarios you have experienced with clients.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Novato, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was very nervous for my interview, kaiser is, of course, a dream company to work for if you are looking for good retirement benefits and job security. I wasn't coming in with a lot of experience and was concerned about how this would be perceived. The interview was similar to others I have been through, a lot of team and management and troubleshooting questions. It definitely felt like there was a specific template, but was rather routine. The nurse manager made me feel surprisingly comfortable, but I'm sure this is not always the case. My best advice would be to over prepare and know as much about the company that you can... And be able to throw that out during the interview. Good luck!
Interview Questions: How would you describe your management style?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received an email asking me to complete two online typing tests.  After a week and a half they called and we set up an interview.  I interviewed with two office managers.  The questions were pretty typical.  Make sure you know the company and the meaning behind "Thrive". They asked some situational questions, but not many.

Make sure to ask what you are interviewing for.  I applied and was interviewed for what I thought was a full-time position. They had actually hired the full-time position from within and hired me for the part-time position.  This should have been clearer, but I am happy with the outcome and am excited to be working with this company. Hopefully I can be transitioned into full-time!
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Large group interview where a box of questions was passed around. You had to select from the box and answer the question that you selected. There were three interviewers and about 20 candidates in the room being interviewed.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult situation you had to face and how did you handle it?

title: Inpatient Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Daly City, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel or group interview with a number of pharmacists and/or which includes the director of inpatient pharmacy, and lead technician. The interview is a gamut of questions that may be of subjective to objective in nature and usually lasts an hour.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Hard to get to the interview.  I knew someone via a recommendation, but before an interview process occurs, one must pass the personality test. The personality test is by far one of the most pre-hiring tests that I have encountered. I am unsure whether or not I had to take one when I worked as a traveler with another KP, but it was stressful given that I really wanted the job.
Interview Questions: No specific interview questions, it was more so experience and what would you do. I will say be able to recall a time that you made a mistake and had to own up to it by having to notify the physician and charge nurse etc.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Corporate interview was a waste of time, poor questions that were not relevant to the role, panel had arrogance to them, the panel was over a half hour late and cut the interview short by the time they were late, they did not value my time at all. Panel went around the room asking questions specific to their role in the organization and not centered around the actual role I was applying for with one panel member not asking any questions at all. They did good an over all background on their company, but I already had this knowledge based on my due diligence.
Interview Questions: Was asked about current company with probing questions, seemed to want to know what current insurance company was doing more than an interview for a role. There were no questions on my fit into the role and the most interesting reason for the declination of an offer was due to an item not in the job role and never asked or discussed with me. It appeared their decision was made up prior to the interview and I was one of the required applicants needed to interview.

title: Data Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with them a year prior for a different position.  The hiring manager contacted me a year later asking if I would be interested in interviewing for a different position.  I interviewed for the data consultant position and was offered the job after about 3 days.  The hiring process, including background checks, physical, etc. took about 3 weeks.  I started around a month after my interview.
Interview Questions: They asked how I thought data sharing would look like in the future.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Staff was congenial and honest.  Staff was highly qualified and knowledgeable about the vacant position.  They were concerned about the fit as much or more than qualifications. The job description was typical adding some irrelevant tasks and responsibilities.  While they said I was qualified, some expressed concern about my lack of direct experience in health care.  Age was probably a factor too.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are qualified?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with the HR personnel, radiology supervisor and another technologist. First they asked about my background, skills and my schedule. Then they gave me case scenarios to know how i would handle certain situations. Over all it was a quick and simple interview. No knowledge tests or personality tests.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself.

title: Cashier Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I have applied often for jobs at Kaiser and was happy to have the opportunity to interview. I was called on a Friday and interviewed on Tuesday and decision was made on Wednesday. The interview was great and I felt comfortable with the interviewer.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: First selected by Recruiter then will be submitted to the hiring manager.  Then recruiter will contact you and do a prescreen of questions if you pass that then the hiring manager will have a phone interview with you.  If they like you then you then come in for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your department or what you do in your position or company.

title: Cashier/Registration Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Honolulu, HI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview. Questions were basic, but Im sure they enjoyed the fact that I engaged with them in other topics. I offered my opinions on what I thought could further this specialty clinic, and I asked alot of questions as well. I really wanted to work with this particular clinic because I've always been fascinated with these certain procedures my entire life.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you accidentally cancelled a patients appointment, and the patient showed up and was really upset?

title: Director, Market Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral and Panel Interviews - standard boiler plat questions. Met 1 on 1 with Vice President and then with 4 of the area Directors in a panel interview. They asked the same basic questions that we ask for all out interviews so the answers were easy to develop,
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you had to make a tough decision how did you go about it and what was the outcome

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Main communication/notification is by email. First Level interview is an Ice Breaker and review of resume, qualifications, goals, and personality.  Second Level interview was with large group interview against a large panel of nursing supervisors.  Third Level interview was and individual panel interview.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to become a nurse? What is my work/nursing motto? What is the most valuable skill an RN should have?

title: Marketing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: horrible experience; recruiter didn't know what they were doing and wasted my time with their canned questions.  Very clear that they don't know what they're doing!  I was embarrassed for their recruiting department on how poorly they train their recruiters.
Interview Questions: Do you consider yourself to be a team player? (ridiculous question)

title: Medicare Enroller III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called on a Monday. She conducted a phone interview first, and told me more about the position. She asked me about my current position and why I wanted to leave. She also asked me what I knew about Kaiser Permanente and why I wanted to work for that company. By Friday I had my in person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me of a time you had to multitask

title: Cls Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was quick and easy. and they didn't stress too much on technical questions. The supervisor is friendly and quicky offer the job afterward. the over all experience was good
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Care Coordinator Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 2 person interview, at that time the manager read question from a script I felt like! The manager read one question then my co-worker whom I was going to work with read one.
Interview Questions: Will you feel comfortable calling HBS doctors time to time?

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call within a week. I had a phone screening with a recruiter first, then received call from a manager for an interview. I had a panel interview, set questions were asked (standard interview questions), and a lot of scenarios were given. It was a good opportunity to meet other staff and get a sense of the working culture. I was asked to provide references after the interview and reference were called within a week. There is an extensive background check after receiving and accepting a job offer. I was advised to double check my employment dates and salary, applicants will be automatically disqualified if employment dates are incorrect.  Background check agency may ask for copies of W-2s. I assume they ask when they are unable to reach former employers. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I'm excited to be joining the agency.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions asked with a lot of scnearios

title: CPT1 Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA)
Interview Descriptions: one on one with lab supervisor asked about my experience and how I would handle a difficult child. The skills I held and if I had did any bone marrow procedures which I have done.
Interview Questions: How would you draw blood from a child that has had a bad experience.?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Hillsboro, OR) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online for one of the 100 positions to come available for the new call center.  2 days later, I received a request for an online skills test/call practice session.  After passing this portion, I received a follow up email asking me to answer 5 situational questions.  Another week goes by and I receive a phone call to set up an interview.  

I arrive at the local interview and of one of several people there for the interview that day (I probably saw about 10-15 people in my hour's time) I meet first with a current employee of Kaiser who is also a union steward.  He tells me about the Kaiser position and the role that the union has with Kaiser.  We talk about some general information.  I am then called for my actual interview.

I meet with two women in a large room where other interviews are going on.  I am asked 6-8 questions, each interviewer taking turns asking me questions.  Lastly, I am asked if I have any questions of them.  I am asked to sit in the lobby and told I will meet someone from HR.  The representative comes by and says she wants to make sure that she has the correct email and phone number for me so that they can be sure to contact me.  She tells me that I will hear back on my status within 48 hours.  

I thought that the interview went really well and that I had a good rapport with the interviewers (interviewing is usually my strong area), but it has now been 2 weeks since I've had my interview and I've heard nothing.  I left 2 messages for the new hire coordinator last week and neither has been returned.  Information on the job posting said that a drug test and background check would be required before beginning employment, but I never reached that point.
Interview Questions: Tell me 2 times where you went above and beyond a customer's expectations.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Can take time to go through process. Be aware of who you are speaking to. Ask job questions of peers to get clear understanding of role. Ask about turnover and why role is available - know what you are walking into. Ask to meet team you will work with.
Interview Questions: May be asked to answer in writing a series of questions. Not likely to be read so keep answers simple.

title: Patient Account Specialist - Hillsboro, OR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, 24 hours later completed assessments, 48 hours after assessments email for interview. Went in for the interview(panel) and offered a contingent offer upon background and drug screen.  Completed all this within the 48 hours I was required, and the next day I received a voicemail advising that the job offer had been rescinded due to my references.  I have used the same references for my last 3 positions- and never a problem.  I contacted all references and they stated that they never received a call from the screening group (First Advantage)?  All previous references/managers and I are still in "good standing" and I have never left an employer other than resignation or lay off.  CONFUSED!!!???!!!
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Name a time when you have dealt with a difficult customer and what did you do to diffuse?
What are your strengths?
Why should we hire you?

title: Analyst, Commercial Segment Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Started with an initial contact by a recruiter asking me to take an online diagnostic.  The online diagnostic took approximately two hours to complete and consists of a logic section, personality section, and a multitasking test.  

The second step was a thirty minute behavioral phone interview with a recruiter.

The third step was a take home case study which you are given 48 hours to complete which tests your ability to handle / manipulate data and draw conclusions through analysis.  

The fourth step was an on site interview consisting of two rounds; the first round was a discussion of the conclusions drawn from the take home case study, the second round was a behavioral interview with an analyst and the manager.  

They informed me the next step would be an additional interview, but I was cut at this point.
Interview Questions: Many questions from the logic section are very much like LSAT questions.  Behavioral questions were very generic and included things like "where do you see yourself in five years?"  "why healthcare?" etc.

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the hiring manager. The interview lasted about 30 minutes. The manager was very warm and engaging, so that helped take the nervousness off a little bit. The questions were very easy and straight forward.
Interview Questions:
What attracted you to this position?
How do you approach a difficult task?

title: Claims Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview and questions about past experiences. How to prioritize and manage work. Are you a team player, How to handle difficult customers, How do you work to resolve conflict within the department, Where do you see yourself in 5 years.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by an employee, applied online, received a call , met with a panel of about 10 , normal interview questions. Called in for a panel interview of about 10, was somewhat intimidating. They asked me some general questions.
Interview Questions: How would I handle upset and angry patients.

title: Customer Service Ambulatory Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Reseda, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview with Hiring Manager, Office Administration , Counselor and one other person.
Casual but to the point.
Reviewed my resume and asked what software programs I had experience with.
What office experience I had.
How do I get along with others?
Each member of the panel asked me questions in turn.
Did not ask me about Kaiser whatsoever.
Explained importance of attendance and being on time.
Interview Questions:
What would you do during down time ?
How would you handle difficult clients/patients ?

title: Help Desk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Marketing & Sales Manager Tony Bedoy.  He was very professional and also very knowledgeable about the many facets of his department.  In addition, he also asked me if I had any questions for him as it pertained to the position.
Interview Questions: Would I be willing to change the course of my career path to accept the position being offered.

title: Business Process Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Granite Bay, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: People were generally nice during interview. I was contacted about a month after applying by a recruiter to email responses to general questions.  Two weeks later the hiring managers admin scheduled a call for an hour. Two weeks later I went for an in person interview with the hiring manager. Haven't heard anything back after tseveral emails  to inquire after three more weeks.
Interview Questions: General questions about background and experience. Also asked about management style.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took a year or more. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fresno, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: recruitment gave me a l horrible experience. It took 2 years and half to transfer to freno/clovis, from full time to on call positon at  Kaiser. I am a 10 years employee with Kaiser permanente.
Interview Questions: horrible experience

title: Creative and Production Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward and simple interview. They told you about the company and the background information of the position. Then they asked you how you would fit into this position. Overall, just wanted to see your personality.
Interview Questions: Explained scope of the duties and how you think you can help?

title: Marketing Editor/Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the manager of marketing content. Seemed friendly and all went well. Then they sent out a writing test and said do this when you can. The test wasn't that hard--- writing a basic info sheet for a KP service based on the info they gave me. I had spent about 3 hours working on it, when they informed me they already selected a candidate. Early bird gets the worm apparently, but it was quite a shock and humiliation. Why make me work and jump hoops if you're not even going to take the time to consider my test? How much more poorly can a company treats applicants?
Interview Questions: Comfortable with teams?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sat in a room with my supervisor. I was already doing free labor so they knew me. It was a very uncomfortable and informal situation. Probably not the norm. Should have been foreshadowing. God I hate this place.
Interview Questions: What my hobbies were. How I worked in teams. What I did for my health.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group flannel interview. Had no idea it was a group interview from what I was told. Interview took one hour. They seemed nice and smiled a lot. Of course I was old I'm oversimplified and other manage said might need me for another job.
Interview Questions: Can you plan department activities?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The First process is you get an email inviting you to take 5 different test. From typing, personality test, math, grammar, and customer service. The test is long, it takes about an hour and a half to two hours depending on you. At the end of the test depending how well you do it will say your a match and that a recruiter should contact you.

Within one week the recruiter contacted me for an interview. Basically it's two managers interviewing you and they both take turns asking you questions. They right everything down. There is hardly any eye contact. This experience was different. They ask A LOT of behavioral questions.
Interview Questions:
1: What do u know about Kaiser & why do u want to work here.
2:What have you done over& beyond for a customer?
3:Have u ever experienced when someone went over and beyond to help you?
4: If someone comes back late from lunch how would you react?
5: If you can't find the answer what would you do?
6: Why makes you a good candidate for Kaiser ?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was not called for an interview until 3-4 months after I had applied. I believe they wait until they have many applicants to begin the process. Phone interview to screen. In-person interview with the supervisor, assistant supervisor, and a student on rotation.
Interview Questions: Basic questions: Why Kaiser? Why you? etc.

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1. 30minute phone screening with recruiter 
2. Panel Interview with 2 Managers: 
Informed about the job, the duties and what they are seeking in candidates. Was asked a series of 12 questions (situational, tell me about a time when etc ...)
3. Waiting Game now 
Aced 2 assessments prior to recruiter contacting me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were faced with a difficult situation, how did you handle it and what was the outcome ?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short interview process, had a phone screening with the recruiter and then a interview with the hiring manager. Two people were on the call one to interview and one to take notes. The interview was pretty straight forward, nothing new or crazy. I was told i'd know if i had gotten the offer by mid week, they waited till Friday afternoon to extend the offer, I gladly accepted. The long part was the on boarding process. In total took about 1.5 month to jump through all the hoops including a drug test, background check and a check of every place i had worked. This included submitting W-2's and other materials. Too much for an internship.
Interview Questions: How would you feel about a job where you are constantly switching priorities?

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
