Interview Descriptions: I applied and was interviewed for a Senior Business Analyst position with an executive director. I was interviewed again 2 months later for the same position by four people, one of which was an executive director. I received an offer shortly after that for a Business Analyst position, which I accepted. I was later told that the positions were restructured.
Interview Questions: How will you succeed in this position having no experience with health insurance administration?

title: Associate Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went in to the office twice, met the team. It was mostly laidback for the first interview, and formal for the second. The questions the team asked were not very technical, just behavioral and really emphasizing what Kaiser has to offer and if this role still seemed like a good fit to me.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing 5 years down the road?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by nurse recruiter via phone call. Recruiter asked me some questions about my availability, experience, and educational background. So I guess I passed and was asked to come in for a interview. I went to the interview a week later. I was interviewed by a panel.
Interview Questions: Tell about my patient care experiences

title: Staff Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called, did phone screen, then emailed computer medication assessment, then next was phone interview, then scheduled for 1:1 interview with a nurse manager. Was promised to hear back in 3 days- it's been 10 and nothing. I left message and email for recruiter, no response. So guess I didn't get it but really thought I had! Also regardless, would've great to at least receive response of no so I could process it and move on! Very disappointed at the lack of communication! It was a great experience until after the interview and now it's just like wow, really? So unprofessional! I don't want to apply for any other kaiser jobs it's just left such a bad taste in my mouth.
Interview Questions: Different clinical situations/experiences.

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Greenwood Village, Arapahoe, CO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Team managers phone screen about 30 minutes and 1-hour F2F onsite, both had multiple people in them. Typical background, technical, situational and behavioral types of questions. After they contacted me and going thru the interviews, fed & local background checks, drug screening, offer acceptance and HR policy agreement and the entire hiring process for 3-weeks, I was called by the recruiter after the 4th of July and told that the project had been cancelled because all funding had disappeared.
Interview Questions: Funding had been pulled back by their senior leadership and most non-essential hiring was going to slow or completely stop for awhile.  Apparently KP is having major financial and leadership issues this summer because of ongoing labor negotiations.  I do not have a favorable impression of them anymore, they just left me hanging with no path forward anymore except to say since they invested the time and effort into recruiting me, once the management approves new headcount and funds, I will be a top candidate. That was 4-weeks ago and not a word so nothing has changed. Many other people were impacted too here in the area.

title: Senior Applications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Initial interview was a panel of approx 9 people, including the hiring manager.  If approved by the panel, a second interview with the Sr. Director was required as she had to approve of me as well.
The panel interview included representation from several time, 2 of which were not related to the position for which I applied.  The 2nd interview was held at the tower office.  The director asked me several behavioral questions, and asked me why I wanted to work for Kaiser.  The rest of the time was left open to me to ask her questions.
Interview Questions:
Basic Epic terminology and questions related to the application for which I had applied:

What is a CDF?
What is an 835 & 837?
How to you set goals for your self?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
I received a phone interview where I was on a call with three individuals. I answered various questions regarding my previous positions and asked relevant questions to the position at the end of the interview. 

It was my first time doing a phone interview, but really looked through a series of behavioral questions and tough questions to prepare. This really helped and really recommend this to future applicants and the STAR method.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time when your work was criticized.

title: CCM Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: No real interview more like meet and greet since i was the most senior applicant so i got the job, i met with the 3 managers covering the CCM programs and went over the job duties to see if i would be interested in the position
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Takes forever, several interviews required.  Initial phone screen, panel interview with between 3 and 8 people. Sometimes requires second panel interview. Background check and drug screen. It takes no less than 14 days after offer to get background and drug testing back. 
Be patient
Interview Questions: Behavioral interview questions.

title: Production Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Standard questions. Nothing tricky. Didnt need to prepare ahead of time. Basically if you have a pulse and dont say something stupid you are in. It is a kong time from applying before you get called. Be patient.
Interview Questions: Ever supervised anyone?

title: QA Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Good. You can crack it if you can answer the basic questions. So best be prepared to answer the basic stuff. Good. You can crack it if you can answer the basic questions. So best be prepared to answer the basic stuff.Good. You can crack it if you can answer the basic questions. So best be prepared to answer the basic stuff.
Interview Questions: What do you want to become in 5 years ?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Couple interviews and they dont get back to you when your not selected.  Had to find recruiter and contact directly to get initial interview and fill out prescient questionnaire
Interview Questions: What level excel and analytic skills do you have and what are examples of detailed work?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Screened by recruiter first
Behavioral Interview
Panel Interview
Questions are challenging
Additional questions asked at end of interview by panel
Interviewed by potential peers as well as upper level management
Be sure to be specific in answers to situational/behavioral questions
Interview Questions: A situation where I had to challenge a co worker point of view.

title: Staffing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was a group interview with a panel of four.  Their were 7 candidates and they process began with a overview than introduction of each candidate.  Then we pair up with a candidates to share our work experience and accomplishment and the candidates reintroduce each other and describe the other experience and accomplishment.  The next process was to draw two question and then each candidate must answer.
Interview Questions: Describe a stressful situation on the job?

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very professional. It starts with a call, it's followed up by a meeting with the team. After the interview was finished, a few weeks later I got a call and we got the hiring process started.
Interview Questions: "What is your definition of health"

title: Level III RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, called for in person interview within 2 days. Panel interview. Some general interview questions such as Why do you want to work here? Describe a time you had a conflict with a manager? What do you expect from your co-workers? Lots of very specific clinical questions that were situation based to evaluate your critical thinking an assessment skills. Also questions about specific medications and medical procedures also asked to define some medical terms relevant to the position. Difficult questions overall.
Interview Questions: If a patient calls with c/o constipation what information would you review before calling back, what questions would you ask and what advice would you give?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with around 30 people. More than half were internal LVNs or working RNs with less than a year of experience. Panel of 3 nurse managers and the nurse recruiter. 3 rounds: 1 tell us about yourself, 2 tell us about your neighbor, 3 situational and behavioral questions drawn from a basket and answered on the spot.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience and why you are an asset to Kaiser

title: Syep Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Brought in for a group interview, probably like 10 in one room. Went around asking basic questions like how comfortable we are or familiar with computers, how would we solve certain problems. Super easy for any kid with a decent head on their shoulders. Main key was to try to be professional and serious as this is a corporate environment.
Interview Questions: Don't remember specifics

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They sent me an assessment with multiple math questions , after I passed the test , they  called me to come in for interview after 3/4 days . I came to the interview and I had another test that had clinical questions and telemetry strip and a 12 lead elf question, after that I finally went in to be interviewed they asked multiple behavioral questions . Now I'm waiting for a response , my interview was today .
Interview Questions: Name a situation when you were doing something for a patient and it was miss understood ?

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was directed to a hotel where I was told to sit in the hallway and wait. After entering the interview room I was directed to two people who ask me a multitude of different questions. It was a pretty comfortable situation and they were very nice. I didn't feel as though I was being interrogated being as though that Is how it feels when more than one person interviews you. The  interview was more like a conversation. Aftwe the interview I was told they would be doing call backs within the next couple weeks. It was like hell waiting on the phone call. I had given up as I had waited close to 2 1/2 weeks, even emailing the recruiter to ask if she had heard anything in which she replied no. I had given up hope when I received an email saying thanks but no thanks but I had applied for so many of the same position that I still had a glimmer of hope. I was pleasantly suprisee when I got the call saying I was chosen as a yes!I am just waiting for a call to let me know when I have to come in for the drug test and finalize everything !! Don't give up hope. I had applied for a number of years but more frequently because I got fed up with my current job. My whole family works for kaiser and they could not even get me in. Best advice is don't give up and apply fast as soon as they post the job because they are gone in leat than 5 minutes!
Interview Questions:
How would you handle conflict between you and another Co-worker?
How would you handle criticism from your manager?
How did u handle a difficult customer?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very process driven recruitment, I knew exactly what to expect. I was interviewed by the department head who immediately put me at my ease and mainly asked me questions about my prior experience. The interview was conversational and stress-free.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and questions directly related to experience as detailed in the CV.

title: Business Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very relaxed. More of a conversation than an interview. Nothing too difficult. Talked about culture, role, and different task that would be performed. Applied online and the process took less than a month and offer was given after a week. Overall, it was a very good interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background and 5 year goal.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser had a long interview process.  Three part interview.  I flew from another state, into to California for this interview.  The first part was a phone screen, then panel interview, then a final interview by the department head.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Applied on a Thursday, received a call Friday to take 4 tests (typing test/business writing/call center simulations/ attitude) practice because if you pass then you go to the interview process. Got first interview on Tuesday, the following week, that was one on one with recruiting lady. She said I would receive a call up to 15 days, but that same day I got a call to go in for a managers interview. Friday I had the interview one on one with the manager. At the end of the interview she said she would call me within the week to let me know if I got the job! 
Starting pay $18.22
$0.37 more for bilingual
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Performance Improvement-Quality Department Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a bit stressful, there were around 10-12 Kaiser Managers from different department that asked questions, one at the time. Managers introduced themselves, presented a brief information of what their daily tasks are, and asked me which department interests me the most.
Interview Questions: Where would like like to work? Which department interests me, and why? Where do I see myself in 5 years?

title: Laboratory Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1) passed the assessment
2) phone interview
3) group interview:
    - session 1: break into partners and present your partner to the managers, by introducing her or him to them. 
    - session 2: passed a basket of different questions to everyone in order one by one and the individual have to answer the question they pick in front of the managers. 
    - session 3: passed the 1st and 2nd interviews proceed to the last session, one on one with the managers.
4) Reference Check
5) when hire, background check, urine drug check, finish the application
6) Orientation
7) Training
You're officially hired after three months probation!
Interview Questions: Explain step by step of how you do blood culture?

title: Medicare Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with two women in the field and it was more informal than I was expecting. They asked questions back and forth and constantly made sure to see if I had any questions. It lasted only twenty minutes. It was very easy to talk to them as people, but it was challenging having three people on the line at one time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this internship at Kaiser?

title: Health Plan Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took almost 3 months. Transitioned from a Customer Service Rep position and applied through our internal postings. I received an invitation for a group/panel interview. Group interview had 4 managers interviewing and 7 applicants. The process of waiting to hear something from the interview is about 2-3 months. I received a call from Corona HR services and I was given an offer letter and my start date. It was very exciting because this was my first role into a management position
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses.
How would you protect health information and what would you do in a situation when health information is exposed.
Why should we choose you.

title: Chief Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: After you apply, you receive an email from HR to fill out a form about your qualifications. The next email will let you know a date and time on a phone interview HR will give you several dates to chose from, after the phone interview the representative will tell you that he is sending your application to the appropriate department for a formal interview.
Interview Questions: How do handle a conflict with a coworker.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Woodland Hills, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly casual. We spoke about past experience and education. About what I am trying to achieve and how we would go about doing it together. Overall a good interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about your interests in working at KP

title: Staff RN II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Group Panel
Some Professional
Others just seemed to be there going through the motions
Hospital Outdated 
Moderate structured interview.....................................................
Workers were nice'''''''''''''''
No expectations
Great place to use as a practice run for job you are truly interested in 
Nurses appeared overworked and tired
Nursing management does support the nurses
Interview Questions: Questions about how to treat hypoglycemic Junkie

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Richmond, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: A panel of 4 who asked questions that I was able to answer then requires time to draw pictures to illustrate my points. This was not good as I can only do stick figures.
Interview Questions: Draw an illustration of a problem that I needed to resolve with the patient.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied  for the position online, and a couple of days later I got an email for an assessment test to take online. The test is timed.  After that, I got a call the same day for an interview that would be scheduled for a week later. The interview lasted about one hour, I had a panel of five people (some are nurses and others professions) ask me questions about past job experiences. The basic interview questions that many jobs ask. KNOW SOMETHING ABOUT THE COMPANY PAST AND PRESENT! THEY LOVE THAT. I believe that set me above all the rest of the candidates and sealed the deal for me! They also asked me clinical situational questions. Also make sure you have basic knowledge of how to do the procedures that match the job description. Make the interview not to be an “interview”. Act like you interviewing them. Be confident going in, and don’t let them know you are shaking in your boots. Just think, it’s now or never. Relax, laugh, smile, and have FUN, and act INTERESTED in the panel and the company as if you known them for years. I knew that same day I had the job but needed confirmation first. Less than a week later I got the call that I got the job, and an offer was made to me, but I needed to pass the background check first. The background check took about a week and a half to complete. The whole process took about one month. Your salary is based upon your years of experience as a LPN in general.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a disagreement with someone from another discipline?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by dept manager for initial phone interview and brought in for face to face meeting the following week. Interviewed with 2 team members, the manager and director. They had a set of questions to ask from and went down the list. Involved scenario questions, strength/weakness questions, and a few technical questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do in this scenario?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Many people interviewing for one job but it was just one on one. Very easy interview was expecting more technical questions like drug names and other pharmacy related questions but was nothing like that. All the questions were just situational questions like how you react to this or that. Really nice people.
Interview Questions: What was one time you made a mistake and what did you do to fix it

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Starts off as a group interview, which you would partner up and learn work history about your partner. Then you would present your partners work history in front of the group. Next exercise you will grab a question out of a bucket and answer in front of the group. If you did well in the group interview, you will then proceed to a one-on-one interview.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I went for an interview first. There are two people interview me. Each of them had an interview list. They take turn to ask me question following the lists. I'm really excited to work for Kaiser, but when I told the agency that i'm done with the interview. She told me to take the Assessment Test before the process done. Next day, she called me and said I didn't pass the assessment test that mean I didn't get the job. Working for kaiser is my dream job, but it is so hard for me to get in. Hope one day, I can get the job in Kaiser.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time that you felt you went above and beyond the call of duty at work.

title: Pharmacy Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is rather unusual. It consisted of 4 different interviewing groups, and only 2 of them were considered as the the traditional interview sessions. A spontaneous presentation was required as well for the interview session.
Interview Questions: How did you achieve a personal (non professional ) goal of yours

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a very brief phone interview that lasted about 5-10 minutes. It was pretty casual and asked the generic interview questions, such as about projects I've worked on and what I want to do in the future. After the interview, they emailed me back a couple days later with an offer, but I had to decline for other reasons.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Kaiser Permanente?

title: Staff Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview process.  i had 3 phone interviews and 1 in person interview.  The initial phone interview was with the HR Recruiter followed by 2 other phone interview with the interview panel.  The final interview was an in person interview with the hiring manager about 3 weeks after my initial interview.
Interview Questions: why audit?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It's a lengthy process, got first call to set up phone interview, you must pass phone interview in order for your information to get sent to the hiring supervisor. Then it's up to them if they want to interview you face to face. I passed the phone interview, They ask generic interview questions, tell me what you did at your previous positions? What is customer service to you? . They wish you luck and encourage you to reapply in case you don't get called in. A week later I heard nothing still, so I gave them a call, the lady told me it's just a waiting game now, it's up to them if they want to bring me in. The very next day I get a call asking to come in for an interview. Interview day comes and get interviewed by RN and Supervisor. They has a list of about 20 questions some usual interview ones, and the other Clinical ones, so know your stuff! They said they were looking to make a decision next week. The very next morning they called me and asked me a few more questions and I was offered the position,  best day of my life, aside from when my son was born of course.
Interview Questions: MA Clinical questions

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted within 1 week by an HR recruiter. Recruiter made me fill out a detailed application with behavioral and analytic questions, administered a phone screen, then scheduled an in-person interview with a panel of 4 people. Questions were experience-based and behavioral. It went very well and every one was polite and prompt. 2 weeks later, I came in for a 12-person panel interview where I presented a small data analysis I had to complete in 1 hour beforehand. It was all straightforward and doable; everyone remained polite and kind throughout the process. Difficult interview process, but well worth it in the end! Within 2 business days of interviewing, I received my written offer.
Interview Questions: Q: What is an example where you had to use multiple sources of data for an analysis?

title: Associate Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Began with an informal phone all with a consultant, then had a case interview, and after that went well, a behavioral interview, each with two consultants. The entire process took about a month, and I ended up with an offer to intern for a couple months before the possibility of continuing full-time. I had connections to another employee at Kaiser, which I believe really helped.
Interview Questions: How would you decide which department to implement a new piece of technology given financial restrictions?

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had excellent scores on my skills test, and over 10yrs experience in customer service. My first interview was with the HR recruiter, and she was a delight. She was basically telling me all the great benefits about the company as if I were interviewing me. Asked basic questions, and recommended me for the next interview.  My second interview was also 1:1, and we had great rapport. She was sharing her personal life stories, and kept saying, "dont worry" the whole time. I felt very confident. No questions were hard, she kept forgetting my answers. I was told less than 24hrs later that I had not been offered a position, when I was told it would take 3-5 days. I was really fooled. Waste of time, she knew I wasnt "right" for the job when as soon as I ended, but pretended I was. Kept slipping up saying "when you start. Oh  I mean if"
Interview Questions: how do you handle criticism from a supervisor?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I passed pharmacy technician exam and typing test. Then they did screening questions on the phone. After that they invited me to interview. Interview went well. Now I am waiting my job offering from them. Amen.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Why do you want to work at Kaiser
What did you achieve in your past coursework in college?

title: GraduateProject Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Formal interview, typical behavioral questions asked. First asked what personal things I like to do. Described my background in growing up in another country. Asked questions at the end about the position itself as a graduate intern.
Interview Questions: If you had to lead a project and had some resistance from your team, how would you deal with it?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Antioch, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a call lasted about 5 minutes got asked a couple of questions. Then was told my application would be forwarded to the hiring manager and they told the May or may not call you to schedule an interview. It's only been a couple of days. Nothing yet but I'm hopeful
Interview Questions: What is your long time career goal?

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call to interview. The interview was at the Hilton Hotel in Sacramento and I received I'll call two weeks later that I was hired
Interview Questions: How do you handle an irate customer for waiting in line so long?

title: Test Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions:
A 3 step process - HR, Director followed by a Peer interview.
Applied for 2 separate jobs and The HR team was terrific in both cases.
In one the interview with the director went great but was up against a Peer team that was not upto the mark. Very cynical and it was clear that they did not possess the experience to do justice to their roles.
Their bad feedback denied my case.
In the second one - did not get thro' the initial interview with the director. Went on expected lines except for one Q that didn't meet expectations.. including mine. That probably settled it against my favor. No complaints though. I probably deserved it for not being ready for it.
Interview Questions: cliched questions that you will find everywhere - 3 things that are important to u in your role, positive about u, what your colleagues say about you, escalator pitch about u, ur greatest weakness or strength and why, what do u bring to the company, SDLC and testing in general., Automation skills, leadership skills, conflict resolution, how do u provide bad news as a manager, meeting and setting expectations

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted over the phone with a Manager who was very pleasant and personable.  She was looking to an assistant to one of the directors and had experience reporting directly to officers of the company, which I had.  She was very satisfied with my responses and indicated she would be in touch within a few days.
Interview Questions: My role as an executive assistant

title: Clinical Service Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Met with CNO and other clinical service directors. Panel interview - good discussions, Directors very open and friendly but asked tough questions. Lots of discussion around patient experience, employee and physician satisfaction. Discussion and questions regarding experience in building a service line in a union environment with serious space restrictions. New hospital planned but still many years away.
Good interview
Interview Questions: How would you handle pt experience scores

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had interviewed with Kaiser 4 times all with short phone calls inviting to do a face to face interviews.  Each interviews were all different my last interview (group panel) i was offered the Job which they mostly asked behavioral questions! Don't give up keep trying you will get there!
Interview Questions: How did you handle conflict?

title: Actuarial Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I was emailed by the hiring manager about setting up a phone interview. He was accompanied by one other individual during the phone interview. The questions were mostly related to why I was interested in the position. A few questions were asked about my technical skills. They also spent a significant amount of time answering my questions about the position. They were friendly and professional throughout the interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply for this position?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: first 1:1 interview with hiring manager, and then questions/answers with panel of pharmacy staff and technical staff.  It took 3 weeks for them to call back for drug screen/background check
Interview Questions: My strengths and weaknesses

title: IT Role Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Horrible...they came with a  group of 5-6 people panel if one of them dislike you no way you can get that job. I suggest to stay away with this company don't even bother to spend time for the face to face interview it's just not worth it. I had 3 different interviews and all had the same results. If an interviewer thinks you're better than them no way that they'd hire you.
Interview Questions: If you have someone working for you and he/she not performing well what take of actions would you take?

title: Management Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a three part interview process: First interviewed with Senior Manager and then his direct reports (the team of peers for the position).  I was called back to interview with another Senior Manager in whose organization the consultant position would be working.  Passed the first set great but the second Manager did not see me having sufficient executive presence.  I was more relaxed with this second manager as I thought that I had already been approved to move forward as a viable candidate.  I was wrong...as the second manager told me at the end of the interview that "they were looking at other candidates."  :(
Interview Questions: Questions were a lot about my relevant experience to the consultant position.

title: Supply Chain Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone interview then there was a panel interview. Everyone was friendly and the interview went well. There was also a list of questions asking for definitions to word or phrases such e.g., what does JIT mean and what does kaizen mean. The panel was a group of stakeholders to the position being filled.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for KP?

title: Supply Chain Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Walnut Creek, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process started off with the initial screening phone call from Kaiser Human Resources.  I received a phone call a few days later from the hiring manager who conducted a subsequent interview.  At the end of the phone interview he said he would be on vacation for a week and that he would call me back at that time to setup an in person interview.  After not hearing back from him after that week, I followed up leaving a voicemail for him to return my call me back.  To date, I never did hear back from anyone at Kaiser permanente.

I was a bit disappointed that I did not get a call back informing me either way about the job opportunity.  Surely, my interview time is worth the common decency of notifying their candidates that he or she did not get the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me your experience with managing people and budgets?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The requirement for the position was a high-school education, and I have more than that so they basically told me the things that they were in need of help of. They asked if I can do those things, and I said yes I could and the job was mine after that.
Interview Questions: They didn't ask me a single question aside from telling me their needs and asking if I could do those tasks. Definitely not a traditional interview in that sense however mine may have been an exception.

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed. More team based than anything else. It is important to build a good team moving forward as opposed to a very skilled bad team. I have no desire to work elsewhere.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult people?

title: Resident Physician - ENT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: initial exchange "tell us about yourself" and why you are interested in the job.  Then given a mission statement about nursing in Kaiser. Asked "what does this mean to you?"  Then there is a behavioral portion which examines specific aspects which I may or may not remember well.
Interview Questions: Questions like "tell us about a time you made a mistake and how did you handle it?"  Clinical knowledge" " you are about to administer a drug to pt so and so. What steps do you take?", " you are tasked with a project and not enough time to compete it on time. What do you do?",

title: Environmental Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Antioch, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first interview went well, the second interview went well to. But I have tried three times, and interviewed three times with no positive results. I have more experience than the three persons they chose which were not from our Kaiser. One supervisor only last one year and three months.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a supervisor?

title: Pricing and Underwriting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Ana, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview (I attend school in a different state than where the internship was located, majority of interviews are in-person).  Few technical questions, mostly situational 'how would you respond' type questions.  Several questions about interviewee's knowledge of the company, specific knowledge about the industry, and knowledge of current events that may affect the industry (know about healthcare legislation).  Situational questions were rather specific, requiring very detailed responses.  No indication of the quality of response was given, leaving me to question whether or not my answers were comprehensive enough or what the manager who interviewed me was looking for.  Interview lasted about 35 minutes, plus about five minutes of the manager describing Kaiser's role in healthcare and the underwriter's role and importance to the company, specifically the Sales and Account Management team.  No 'stress test' or puzzle questions, though the situational questions are intended to determine how the interviewee thinks or reacts on short notice, clearly intended to see if a candidate thinks analytically as required in the position.  Was called for a preliminary screening and to set up an interview about four weeks after applying online, and took about five weeks to hear back after interviewing (I assumed I didn't get the position and considered offers elsewhere, heard back as I was responding to an email accepting a different offer; stick in there, they get back to you eventually, and require a drug test within 48 hours of accepting an offer).  Overall a rather straightforward interview, though detailed situational questions are always difficult in nature.
Interview Questions: What challenges do legislative changes pose to the healthcare market, and how would you expect these changes to affect premiums and membership?  (I interviewed right after ACA was implemented).

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I have been applying for a year now. I received an email to set up an interview. It was a smooth interview. It took about 25 minutes. Two managers interviewed me and told me they would call me for the job offer in a couple weeks if they decided to hire me. The interview was just a day ago , so hoping I get a call back.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time when a supervisor gave you negative feedback.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was more in depth than I was anticipating. A lot of questions that required an example. They wrote on a sheet that had questions pre wrote on them as they asked questions. They started with the basic tell us about your work history then started the questioning. They informed me what my responsibilities would be if I was offered the job and then left me to ask questions myself. There were several questions about what I saw my coworkers do and what I did in response to those actions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a coworker that did something unethical and how you responded to it?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Hillsboro, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, the following week the pharmacy manager called me to schedule an interview for the following week.  Gave me 3 time slots on different days to choose from.  There were 5 interviewers (3 Rphs and 2 Techs).  They were very nice and friendly.  Made me felt welcome, but i was still nervous.  Mostly behavioral type questions.  The whole interview was about 35 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time....(behavioral type questions), why do you want to work for KP? Why should we hire you? How many sick calls?  How many mistakes?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went in for one interview in the office with two people interviewing me. Interviews are very general and important to find out where your interests lie so they can pair you in the right department. I was called back within two weeks after the interview. The people are all really friendly and interested in getting to know you.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Kaiser Permanente? What do you want to get out of the internship?

title: Lead RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Online application -> online assessment -> week later got a call from hiring manager. Interview following week. Followed by a second interview and job shadow (not usual). Roughly 40 days from application to offer. Overall, very pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you gave great customer service.

title: Business Consultant Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted an application online. I was called three days later to set up a phone interview with members of the KPIT RITO team: a manager, Lead Business Consultant, and a Business Consultant. The interview was driven by the Business Consultant. The Lead Business Consultant did not talk to me at all during the call. He didn't even say hello. The manager asked one question and did not speak again until the Business Consultant turned things back to her at the very end of the conversation. I found the Business Consultant to be condescending towards me during the call. 

There was only one general question related to my background asked by the manager (Tell me about yourself and what you're looking for). I tried to bring more of my background into the conversation. However, I was immediately cut-off to be drilled about databases and how to gather/analyze data using databases by the business consultant. There was no conversation about "fresh ideas", documenting requirements, analyzing business processes, or developing business cases as described in the job posting. 

I applied for a position with KP that I was qualified for based on the required and preferred qualifications, but I was "interviewed" for a different type of role. It was not a positive experience. I verbally withdrew myself as a candidate 15 minutes into the phone interview.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about databases? 
Do you know what SQL is? Tell me what it is.
Tell me in detail how would you pull data from different sources using Excel? 
What do you know about Access? How would you pull data from a database using this tool?

title: Marketing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: First, they will email you a short questionnaire that will need to be completed within a week. That is followed up with a one on one interview and then a panel interview.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize projects when working within a team?

title: CFO Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard process, started with a recruiter.  Then passed off to HR at the local office, then an all day interview with representatives from across the company.  I saw a tour of the facility as well as had the chance to talk with people working in Finance as well as leadership from other important areas
Interview Questions: How would i work to improve profitability for the organization

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, direct, and quick. They navigated throughout interview asking question to test your knowledge of their business processes. In addition, they asked question about any tools I knew how to use to benefit the work processes if I worked there.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to use excel?

title: Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Charlottesville, VA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my application online, and received an email in a few weeks. I did not do any networking or anything like that in order to receive an offer. I then had three relatively easy phone interviews and received my offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your interest in health care

title: Store Keeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called in for an interview. Interviewer ran late, seemed like a nice guy, pretty relaxed interview. Normal basic questions about being part of a team, time management and conflict resolution
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult customer that is qrong?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview experience was great. Felt comfortable and calm. There was a group panel interview which can be intimidating but I got thur it. I was prepared and ready for all the questions that came my way.
Interview Questions: What is my goals for the next 5 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a great experience with my one on one interview with a manager at a recent job fair the new hospital in Oakland had.  I felt at ease, no intimidation, comfortable and welcomed.  The recruiting staff had all been amazing and answered every question I had during the hiring process.
Interview Questions: The manager asked me various standard interview questions like: where do you see yourself in 5 years, tell me why you want to work for Kaiser, why do you enjoy being a nurse, tell me a time when you almost made a mistake and what did you do to prevent it, have you ever had conflict with a doctor and how did you resolve it?  She also asked me to simple clinical questions, nothing too hard.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: There group interviews are the WORST! You have 20 nervous girls in a room with a panel of 7 supervisors. They make you get in groups of twos and give a presentation of your partners work history.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress? Why should we hire you? What is your weakness?

title: Emergency Room RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by a recruiter a few weeks later. It took about 3 weeks for the ER director to call me for an interview. During the interview he asked me typical q's "Why do you want to work here? What have you heard about the company? Describe a time when you provided excellant customer service. Describe a time when you got into a conflict with a fellow co-worker."
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very quick (30 minutes) and they were very nice, not pushy at all. It really depends on you to sell your self regarding your skills and experience at school. the lady that gave me the interview was easy going.
Interview Questions: Describe your self

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fairfax, VA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was a phone interview; they emailed first requesting time and day.  I was unprepared for this interview thinking I could do it without preparation so I learned a lesson from this interview which cost me the job or second, face to face interview.  Overall these interviews at this company are looking for one or two things and if you do not seem to have this one thing (even though you have the 50 other things and 15 years experience) they start getting negative. Had two interviews with this company and both were negative.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here; describe yourself, describe your experience. Did you have experience scheduling calendars, working for one person specifically? Describe conflict with coworker and how you handled it.  Describe how you handled a stressful situation

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone screening with Recruitment Services Representative led to an online skills testing. Once the skills testing had been completed and passed, I met with the Senior Manager for a brief interview.
Interview Questions: How do you feel you would work in a call center setting?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with Program Manager and the team of IT Project Managers. Discussed my background and the upcoming IT infrastructure projects they were working on in the next year.
Interview Questions: Have you had to handle multiple projects at the same time and how do you prioritize conflicting schedules?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was first interviewed by phone, then I was interviewed in person and lastly i was interviews by the manager. All of the interview questions were standard interview questions, multiple interviews.
Interview Questions: The process was rather standard, I would not say it was out of the norm. All aspects of the interview were typical and ran smoothly.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview set up by consulting agency. Recruiter contacted me and did preliminary screening. Resume submitted directly to hiring manager. After a week, hiring manager contacted recruiter to set up interview date. Interview was very informal and took about 20 minutes mostly hearing about the position. Did not ask a lot of questions. Got an offer the very next day. The background check took about 3 weeks bec they requested a thorough background check.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fulton, MD) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group/panel interview with about 15-20 interviewees. We were interviewed by four different team managers. The interview took about 2 hours and each person was asked a total of 4 questions. Highly interactive and interesting. It was worth in the long run because I received an offer!
Interview Questions: "How well do you cope with stress?"

title: Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is: first telephone interview then if you pass the telephone interview you get a second interview which is a panel of 5-6. Each person ask 1 question from a set of 10-15 questions. At the end you get to ask questions if you desire, usually get contacted 1-2 weeks later to let you know if you will get the position.
Interview Questions:
Describe the best job you have had.  What made it good and why did you decide to leave? Now describe the worst job you’ve had and what made it such a bad fit. How long did you stay?
This position entails working with our Medicaid population. Please tell us about an experience you’ve had in working with a member who has had Medicaid.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: For the interview process, I was interviewed by 3 people. The Department administrator, the Assistant Department Administrator and the senior RN. They each took turns asking questions and asked one scenario question as to who I would prioritize! I felt comfortable during the whole interview process.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser Permanente?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter contacted me via e-mail with links to several problem solving/multitasking/behavioral tests. Do not shrug these off. They are crucial to the interviewing process. If you don't meet a minimum score your application will not be considered for 6 additional months. They're also intense--and take a couple hours to complete--so take them seriously. You will be required to perform logic-puzzle type questions (very similar to an IQ test), perform multitasking (this one was actually extremely challenging), and some behavioral questions. About two weeks later I was contacted by a manager for a brief chat and invited to interview. Expect a panel. 5-6 people were present at mine. The majority of the interview involved behavioral-based questions. They give you a particular scenario and frame the questions like, "tell us about a mistake you made at work and what did you do to resolve it?" or "tell us about someone you worked with and you witnessed them do something they shouldn't have, what happened and how did you act?" Also, expect a few technical questions related to your profession. If offered a position, you will be required to pass a background check and drug test.
Interview Questions: You run a CBC and it has a high MCHC. What could have caused this and what would you do to resolve it?

title: Senior Professional Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online at Kaiser's website.  I was contacted by someone on their hiring committee for a brief screening phone call and to schedule an interview.  The phone call was then followed by an in-person interview with a 6-person hiring committee lasting about 1 hour.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in five years?
Have you ever had to work with someone you didn't like or who didn't like you, and how did you handle the situation?
Tell us about yourself.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for an internship for high school students. The application was very straightforward and all the information that you needed to bring was clearly stated in the beginning. They processed the applications within 3 weeks and emailed the people who did not get in. The people who were scheduled with an interview received a phone call. Overall pretty organized.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Drawn out. HR seemed to be very uncoordinated with getting resumes to managers and response times were very delayed. The interview consisted of a test and a panel interview. The test was then presented during the interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you attracted to this position?

title: HealthWorks and Benefit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two people from the department I applied for interviewed me through a video conference. It consisted of basic behavioral questions, lots of "tell me about a time when..." Most of them are pretty straightforward if you have multiple stories prepared (preferably using the STAR approach). The interviewers were friendly and conversational, so it was pretty comfortable.
Interview Questions: Are you a general or specific person

title: Audit Summer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (East Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an on campus interview. Basic interview questions. Such as why do you choose Kaiser? What do you know about Kaiser.  What challenge have you overcome? Tell me about a time when you didn't get a long with someone you worked with. The two director I met were very nice, easy to talk with. Received the offer after two weeks.
Interview Questions: why do you choose Kaiser, describe a challenge you have over come

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 on 1 interview with the pharmacy manager. Interview lasted about 45 minutes. Brought into the pharmacy managers office and then asked behavioral questions mostly.  Be ready to to describe your answers in a STAR format so that your answers are clear and direct.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process took one phone call. Employer asked me typical questions (tell me about yourself, why do you want to work for KP). SInce it was an intern position, I don't think it was as high stakes. Relaxed interview process.

When hired, they told me right at the end.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Hire process took a very long time, several month to be exact. HR was very thorough on background screening, and initial phone interview included a skills test. After which I was invited to a 1:1 interview with the hiring manager. A follow up interview was set up with a panel of leads from the department. Both Interviews itself was conversational, but had many real life scenarios and I was expected to describe my experience or how I would handle a situation.
Interview Questions: standard questions, nothing unusual

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Messy.  HR didn't seem to know what they were doing and what all the options were. The people who did the interview and overall recruitment process varied and didn't seem to have their stories aligned. Once I did accept the job, understanding the benefits, the re-location package, and even the start date and whether or not there was an orientation seemed like novel questions. Very disappointing that in a company this size they can't figure out how to block and tackle. It makes me concerned that I won't be able to recruit the talent I need in my department unless I already know them (as was the case with me and how I ended up here).
Interview Questions: The type of culture I'm looking to work in.

title: Senior Consulting Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 1. Submitted a cover letter and resume online. 2. Asked for first round interview within 2 weeks. 3. Interview was in-person and two hours in duration, w/ optional webcam if not available in-person. 4. First hour was case study analysis. 5. Second hour was with Department Director and Associate Director. 6. Second round interview is in one month.
Interview Questions: Business case.

title: Consultant - Market Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. HR person responded back with a questionnaire to fill out stating salary requirements and to respond to a few questions. Got a response back that the max salary for this was well below my current salary. I decided to proceed anyway. Did a 1 on 1 with a sr mgr (1h). They are quick to schedule you in but did not tell me it was 1h long. Luckily I could push back my other meeting. But the call was a very structured interview, not a lot of time to answer questions about the organization on their part though. Easy case study. Second round included coming into their office. I met with the same senior mgr again for an hour. Lot of open-ended questions, no structure to the interview this time. Where do you see yourself in 5 years, etc. Questions seem to come on the fly. Again, not a lot of time to answer questions so I can understand their organization. In the end she cut it short, as it was probably evident that this was my practice interview as I was gearing up for other interviews not related to health care. They want someone dedicated to health care market strategy (not too many job openings in this realm so if this is truly what you want, then make sure you do your research around this). I think a market strategist coming from a CPG, CE or any other industry could be a good fit to this role, just have to be be nimble enough to respond to the current regulatory issues around healthcare but all industries will have constraints.
Interview Questions: What part of ACA do you find to be the most challenging?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Hasty and in retrospect, sloppy. While I was happy to be contacted over the "nothing gets done" holiday period,  I was pressed to commit to a panel interview before leaving for vacation. I made time, and was told 'd have an answer by XX which was right before vacation.  I didn't hear from them until I got back. Not knowing was at the back of my mind during my trip. While my vacation wasn't ruined, I was distracted.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of how you handled multiple requests from several superiors with tight deadlines.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very slow and minimal communication...recruiter asked a lot of meaningless questions and did not follow-up after for several weeks.  This is not an ideal or innovative company by any means.
Interview Questions: Talk about a difficult situation you dealt with at work

title: Team Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Contacted 2 months after applying online. Recruiter left a message for me and didn't return my calls until 3 weeks later. When I spoke to the Recruiter she did the phone interview screening and said I would hear back within 2 weeks. 1.5 months later I receive a call for a physical interview. Attended the panel interview and felt very comfortable with the Senior Managers who were very friendly and made the interview more like a conversation. At the end of the interview they set up 4 role playing scenerios to determined my leadership style. I was told I would hear from them in about 2 to 3 weeks as they had 20 more interviews scheduled. 1.5 months later I received and call to set up a group interview for the final candidates. When I attended the group interview it was set up with 4 Managers and 4 final applicants including myself. We were each asked a question and then went on a very detailed tour of the campus. After the tour we met with the Operations Director seperately for about 40 mins each. I was told in 10 business days I would find out the outcome. 47 long days of waiting- I received a call for the Senior Manager offering me the job. 3 weeks later my background check completed and then I was scheduled for my New Hire orientation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Received initial phone call 2 weeks after application and online assessment.  Had to do an interview with panel of 4 people.  Asked questions about how i handled my previous jobs.  Challenging but required a lot of thought.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time type questions

title: Principal Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was very thorough and I had the opportunity to speak and meet with about a dozen people on the team or whom I would interact with. I got a chance to understand the company culture. I had adequate opportunity to demonstrate my skills and show how I would be a good fit for the team as well as understand how KP could be a good fit for me and my family. 

Travel during the interview process could have been better coordinated and getting reimbursed for travel expenses was also difficult and took longer than it should. But, it was all resolved in the end. Overall, the interview process was a positive experience and I would recommend it to anyone.
Interview Questions: Explain and draw on a whiteboard how you would secure this type of web application.

title: Ultrasound Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Roseville, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very low key. Great atmosphere with the other employees. I really enjoyed the interview. I felt it went very well just/ When theres a full time position open I will be back
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us.

title: DIME Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call several day later. The person who was doing the prescreening was really friendly. They were very accommodating in finding a time to do a phone interview. I felt that it was a problem that I couldn't start immediately (couldn't give work two week notice). They wanted someone to start immediately after the next round of interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an issue with a team member not doing their work?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Long due to schedule availability.  The interviews were very good and were not difficult.  I think that they knew what they were looking for.  The interviewers were very knowledgeable and were able to answer my questions as well.
Interview Questions: Standard scenario based questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process is a pain if you are an external applicant, it takes at least 3 weeks for your background check to go through, plus the time it takes for all the paper work to go though, it can take anywhere between one month to almost two from the time you get the offer until you get hired.
Interview Questions:
One of the most interesting questions I got asked for my interview was this : If you had the person that loved you the most and that hated you the most in this room, what would they say about you? 
This question by far has been one of the most interesting and insightful questions I have ever gotten.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
At the time we could still submit paper resumes. Came to the call center to complete computer test, math and language test. Once you pass you will be called back for an interview. If you pass they will submit a background check. 

After the job offer you will be placed in a new hire class.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took forever to call me back but it was with it it's okay you're going to get it just be patient and calm and prepare yourself and you will see that you are going to get lucky be yourself and smile
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was in a group of 5 to 7 people asking each one a question. Everyone had a chance to answer. The manager then asked more questions, after which we responded.
Interview Questions: How was your experience?

title: RN Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Tacoma, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Start with online application. I contacted the manager of the department because my current manager knew her. I spoke with her by phone and then had a group interview. It took two weeks for the manager to get back to me but ultimately I was hired.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize your day as a care manager?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online, spoke to a recruiter.  Interview and testing.  One on one interview and then with panel.  Skill test and drug test, health screening.  Process took about 1 month.  Overall was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: This process went quick for me, about a week and a half between first interview (with peers,) second interview with Regional Administrator.  Countered initial salary offer and they met me half way.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that something negative happened that was not your fault but it was your responsibility to handle it, how did it turn out?

title: Sales Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process took some time my Initial talks began with them in October the ball didn't start rolling until January. It started off with a phone interview which from there went to 2 in person interviews.
Interview Questions: The interview was of more of a feel out "if you're a good fit for our team " .... Which I love because it gives a true sense of who you are.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was a group interview and there were 7 people. the interview was fun and the supervisors were very funny and nice. we went around answering questions one by one. it felt more like a group conversation than an interview!
Interview Questions: have you worked in customer service before?

title: Kitchen Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
