Interview Descriptions: phone call for interview then you are scheduled to a group interview by recruiter then there are 1:1 interviews call backs within 2-4 weeks. They look for confident and strong people out of the pack so do your best to shine
Interview Questions: why are you a good fit for Kaiser?

title: Nutrition Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They called me and interviewed me for 10 mins. I sat down and I didn't really get asked any questions. I pretty much got hired on the spot. The background check took 4 weeks, but other than that, I am very happy to work here
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Got email notification from HR within days of applying. Answered basic screening questions, a repeat of screening questions already asked and answered when applying online. Interview appointment was set up pretty quickly and casually. Standard canned interview questions, practically like an online questionnaire (why do you want this job, how do you deal with hostile coworkers, what do you do if your boss's peer wants you to do something...). There was a long quiet period until second round interviews. People seemed generally very nice, but very guarded at the same time, as if they/we were always being recorded or watched.
Interview Questions: Estimate annual demand for batteries in the US. A typical Google interview question, like how many golf balls fit in a school bus.

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Leandro, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Process to three weeks after interview which was on 11/18/14. Interview was basically a meet and Greet,Got offer today. pending background check,tentative start date is jan,12. Excited and thanking God for this blessing.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with EPIC?

title: IT Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I got an email to attend an interview in about a week and had time to prepare for it. The interview wasn't too difficult or out of the ordinary, but be prepared to speak for a group as there tends to be 2-3 interviewers. The head interviewer didn't think I was ready, but the other two liked me as a candidate. Oh well. Took them 4 weeks or so to get back to me after that.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest challenge and tell me how you overcame it.

title: Marketing Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser's hiring process can take 3-6 months, be patient.  They make a point of having interviewees speak with only relevant personnel.  Since KP's marketing group uses focused analytics in its preparation for, execution and testing/measuring, a member of the analytics team will surely be part of the interview.  The process takes a while, but it's to the point.
Interview Questions: Kaiser nurses are striking at KP's medical facilities in Southern California. KP has been made aware of the pickets.  What resources and processes will you use to communicate to members and employees on the situation and what to do if you encounter the strikers?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call one month later. I interviewed with 3 managers. They asked common interview questions. The interview lasted one hour. I will update my response if I am selected for the second round of interviews. There is an assessment test on the same day of the second interview.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your excel skills?

title: Customer Relations Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication was with HR recruiter via email to set up phone interview. Phone interview took place one week later with HR recruiter. Secondary communication was with HR recruiter to set up testing at main office location. In person interview was set at that meeting based on results of testing. In person interview took place after Christmas holiday. Approximately ten days after interview HR recruiter called with job offer.
Interview Questions: Why would I want to work for a health insurance company having only work for an auto insurance company previously.

title: Senior Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Quick Correspondance. Still about 1-2 month process for internal candidates and about 2-3 month process for external. Be prepared to take PC Skills testing and typing test. Interview was a panel interview with 4 people and they took turns asking the questions.
Interview Questions: What is the most amount of projects you have handled at the same time and how did you prioritize your time with deadlines?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call from HR for an invitation to a telephone interview. The telephone interview was pretty straight forward, nothing tricky or unexpected. I was then informed that if chosen to move forward, I would receive an email invitation to a group interview. I received the invitation and had to respond right away. The group interview was well organized, nothing tricky.
Interview Questions: There was nothing unexpected, overall the process seemed fair.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
many weeks phone contact with HR for documentation, arranging exams, verifying vaccinations and licensure.  many errands for tests, paperwork, background check.
then 1 group interview, offer immediately, starting a month later
interview itself:  waited 10 minutes for staff to gather.  ushered into conference room.  asked questions from hand-out.
did not follow up with thank you.  felt that interview went badly and did not expect offer.
overall experience:  felt like managers were just going through motions with questions, and would hire based on their feelings about personality.
Interview Questions:
standard interview questions
some specialty specific

title: Benefit Configuration Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Initial Communication was through an HR Recruiter. Followed by an in-person meeting with supervisor. Followed by a phone interview with another supervisor. Followed by a phone interview with a higher level supervisor.

In general slightly disorganized interview style with all the participants not being aware of the actual job responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Are you sure you want this job. It is a lower level than your current position.

title: Licensed Vocational Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview first: asking general questions like work experiences, bilingual abilities, worst situation at previous work and how you've handled it.
Group interview: about 25 applicants, picking random questions and answer it right away. 
Panel interview: with two managers, 10-15 questions about clinical skills.
Interview Questions: What do you do during the downtime at work?

title: Medical Assistant On Call Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Woodland Hills, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position November 23 and received a call for an interview December 7. The interview itself was great, I met directly with the hiring manager who was very nice  and we went over my resume. The interview took at the most 20 minutes or at least it felt that way and the manager made me feel relaxed and welcomed. I was told I would be contacted by Friday of that week by email as they had more interviews to conduct. Friday came and went with no call back, I figured they chose another candidate, which was a little disappointing.  But much to my surprise on December 15 I recieved a call with an offer of employment. Which of course, I happily accepted.
Interview Questions: What is your availability, are you flexible?

title: Staff Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, went through a screening phone interview, and then an in person interview at the office, and then another phone interview. The interviewers ranged from lead internal auditor to the director. The final interview is with the audit director.
Interview Questions: A lot of behavioral questions along with technical questions (what did you do in your previous job)

title: Staff Auditor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds of phone interviews. Followed by in person interviews. Most of interview questions were basic and not very technical. Recruiting process was a bit disorganized. Overall I would expect this process to take a while.
Interview Questions: Tell us about s conflict with coworker And how you resolved it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Got and interview going through a recruiter. Also applied directly. Went to interview and the process took 3 hours. A trainer interviewed me, followed by a written test and then 2 panel interview, asked general questions regarding knowledge of windows computer and abilty to navigate. Written test were scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: How do deal with a uncooperative family memeber/patient?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Process took an entire month from recruiter initial contact, then the next week a phone interview took place. The recruiter called an setup a face to face and then another phone interview the director.
Interview Questions: Working with difficult people

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went through 2 interviews: 1) with account manager at staffing firm. 2) with hiring manager and team at Kaiser. The team seemed uninterested from the beginning. In hindsight it is clear to me that I was a placeholder interview. I found out they already had candidates they offered the position to.
Interview Questions: The hiring manager was back/forth with interview questions and actually nearly shouted a comment to me. I was very taken back by the gesture and emotions. It was very unexpected.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview with the hiring manager of the department and an employee in the same job classification as the job I was interviewing for. Interview was fairly basic and consisted of standard questions, they were looking for an honest, capable candidate.
Interview Questions: Do you believe you would be a good asset to our company and why?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very stressful, when you are already worried or nervous, it would be helpful to feel welcomed. Not a very good start. Hope that things will change so they can value good candidates. Never judge a book by the cover.
Interview Questions: To personal

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was easy. It took about 3 weeks to complete the process, and everyone was very welcoming and willing to help others. I also had to take an exam about medical terminology, but it was very basic. Plus if you are bilingual
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied as a volunteer through paper forms. Then I received a mail where you choose what day that is listed for a conference/presentation. It took about two months for health screening and training.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-line, was contacted by a recruiter and answered supplemental questionnaire. Then the recruiter scheduled me for a panel interview. The interview just happened a few days ago waiting on email or telephone call from recruiter.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for the position?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Work with a recuriter at Kaiser Permanente.  It is difficult to get the initial interview unless you have the experience.  Use trigger words in your resume; otherwise, your resume will never be seen.
Interview Questions: How do you handled mutliple managers who work in different verticles?

title: Ward Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: phone interview asking about my skills, in the medical field. it was pretty easy. good luck. the recruiter was really nice and made me feel comfortable as possible. Kaiser permanente was a pleasure interviewing with my future co-workers
Interview Questions: nothing was difficult

title: Staff Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through website, got called by HR after a few weeks, interviewed and forwarded resume to hiring manager. Got a panel interview with the managers, offered the position and accepted. Got offer letter, background check, drug screen, then physical. Whole process took over a month. It was the background check that took 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: are you able to perform the requirements of the job?

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was a group interview consists of 30 applicates for 3 openings. it was setup in a classroom, where we had to stand up in front of the class and introduce ourselves( it was nerve recking) at the end they will call out names and ask them to stay in the class and those who don't hear their names have to leave. i didn't hear my name so i left. this is the second time i attend an interview with kaiser. i will try again maybe the third time is a charm.
Interview Questions: we were asked to get in groups of three and learn as much as we can about each other then come up in front of the class and introduce both people to the recruiter and to the classroom for one minute.

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed. Background check by 3rd party. Panel interview by 2 supervisors and 2 leads, 1 member service rep. Very tough questions.Be prepared to asked many questions about realtime situations.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Your first interview is a group interview which consists of 9 other job applicants. You're given 5 minutes to get to know the person next to you.  You then introduce them summarizing the information they provided. Next, they go around the room twice so that you answer two questions that are CBI (Critical Behavior Interviewing) questions which are randomly selected. The next and last interview is with the Manager and staff of the department for the position.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with someone you didn't like? If so, how did you handle it?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Website is hard to navigate but you will get used to it, build a profile and applying for jobs is so easy.
Recruiter will contact you and have a short informal interview with you regarding your experiences.
Recruiter will forward your contact info to manager and they will contact you for an interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Invitation to meet and talk with multiple managers and everyone had to weigh in to ensure that the candidate is the right choice for the position. consensus driven process that was long drawn out but helpful to the employer.
Interview Questions: improving data

title: Biomedical Equipment Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was long and the questions asked were gimmicky.   The group setting was awkward because people just printed off random interview questions off the internet.  It seemed to be not effective at weeding out people with poor co-worker relations skills as became apparent after other hirees.
Interview Questions: Why is a manhole cover round?  What gets you up in the morning.?

title: Kaiser Permanente, Health Education, Health Promotion and Women's Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The response to emails were very prompt, and scheduling an interview was not an issue. However, my original interview date had to be moved because the interviewer got caught up in meetings that day. We rescheduled and the interview went relatively well. I was told she will get back to me in one week about the decision.
Interview Questions: The questions were pretty general, such as "what are 3 words to describe you. give an example of you have demonstrated each" & "why do you want to work for kaiser?"

title: Implementation Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Berkeley, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called by the recruiter. Recruiter was pleasant and went over my resume and my expectations. The phone screen was followed by a telephone conversation with the hiring manager and 2 panel telephone interviews. Interview team was very professional and pleasant.  After about a month or so I was invited to a on site interview. The negotiation process was very slow and lengthy.
Interview Questions: Question are about your past experience?

title: PeopleSoft Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser doesn't screen resumes directly for these relatively smaller positions, like mine. They've external HR consultancies  to do that. I submitted to a third party, who had a quick response (I've lots of experience with the tool) and had a lengthy chat. Once that was done, she asked me for three times / days to be available for an interview. KP Interview panel had 7 people at various levels and the interview was over in just 2 hours where the questions ranged from the application knowledge, domain knowledge, skill sets and SDLC knowledge, business process and some written documents. After that I was called in for a face to face and that was done in another hour or so. Relatively easy process, if you know the tool. Some of the senior analysts, who did the face to face, are more hands on and have been using the tools, know the domain inside out. I finally met the director and he was hands on and very helpful. Strangely for a non-IT company, KP has excellent IT culture which I liked a lot. Overall a very professional and positive environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Contract Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via phone by the HR recruiter and had a screening interview with the recruiter.  That was followed up by an interview with the hiring manager. Then the recruiter contacted me with the job offer and we went through some negotiations. It was a pretty process.
Interview Questions: Questions were pretty standard.

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a group Interview of about 20 people. The panel was very positive and friendly. They gave off a really nice vibe. That helped, considering the anxiety of interviewing with so many people. They were pretty up front about the " ugly" of the job as well as the "perks". All of the questions were pretty standard and expected. Its been a week and I have not heard anything yet. Great pay, but if you are " on call" there are no benefits just yet. You only qualify for benefits once you become part time or full time.
Interview Questions:
I felt like I prepared very well for my interview, did lots of research on the company. The first question they asked was:

If you could be an animal, what would it be and why? I was caught off guard with that one.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online to a few positions with different locations over about 6 months. Not really actively trying. Once I reached 2 years experience in the field, they called within a couple weeks. Interviewed at one location but was turned down (I did a terrible interview so I wasn't surprised) but they passed my name on to other hiring managers (surprising because of the first terrible interview). I set up a second interview with the managers from other locations, more prepared this time. They asked the exact same questions and told me they would call by the following Friday with a yes or no. They called the next day and offered me the job at my preferred location (not the first one I interviewed with, they let me choose). It was very pleasant and professional in all regards.
Interview Questions: How do I handle unhappy customers? Give specific examples.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an volunteer application about 3 months ago and finally got a call about the information meeting. Was told that after the information meeting, if you are still interested there will be an interview session held right afterwards. The information given were about the roles and expectation that they will have on you. Requires a 1 year commitment and one 4-hour shift per week. The persons running this was very fun and laid back.
Interview Questions: Easy and straight forward questions were asked. What is customer service to you, what do you like to do as a hobby, tell me about yourself and why do you want to volunteer here. Is the customer always right?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initially had a phone screen after being contacted by a staffing agency. Follow up phone screen then the interview was scheduled. 3 peers/managers conducted the interview in a conference room. Each had copies of my resume and a list of standard questions. They took turns asking them.
Interview Questions: They asked for specific examples of my experience with technical health care projects. Also asked general questions to discern my understanding of technical issues in networks, servers, and applications. Each discussion covered other health care positions that outlined on my resume. Verified my PMP certification and experience and verified I had a working knowledge of SDLC practices.

title: Customer Service/Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I don't have anything to say except I went in for an interview now they want to do a group interview. Does anyone know what to expect? My original interview went great...They just took a while to get back with me re: the group interview
Interview Questions: Greatest weakness and how many days did you call in sick

title: Communications Manager-it Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the hiring manager, and then the job description changed- two jobs were shunted into one. As part of the job description change, the hiring manager became someone else. Even after having several years with the organization, I was asked to do a panel, and a "job test." Very insulting.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to deal with a difficult or unresponsive colleague.

title: Manager Network Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Walnut Creek, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved 2 director level and 2 peer interviews.  It was all over the phone.  There were a total of 4 calls where you are asked a variety of questions from peers that were technical and a very uncomfortable executive director level interview.  I enjoyed all except the executive director who did a great job of making it uncomfortable and made me uneasy.
Interview Questions: I was asked if about my previous experience managing technical staff.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was by phone call only and then had call back from Agency rep. saying that Employer was very interested in making offer of employment and accepted offer from employer
Interview Questions: Years of experience in Call Center position

title: Quality Assurance Utilization Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview round process includes the Department Director and Quality Assurance team members.  They inquire as to why the position is desires, what qualities does the candidate have that would make them a good fit and a scenario like, "Suppose you were planning a dinner party, what would you consider when doing so?"  They want to know if you can think about potential allergies, seating arrangements, elements of organization and self-management.  If one makes it through this round of the process, then a second interview is held with the Department Manager and the Senior Regional Directors.  The reason I didn't receive the position was because, although I speak fluent conversational Spanish, they were needing someone who had certified Qualified Bilingual Spanish Interpreter skills.
Interview Questions: If you were giving a dinner party, what elements would you consider when planning?

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and straightforward. Basic questions you will expect in just about every interview. Not too technical and more interested in the kind of projects you have worked on and methods/software you used in them.
Interview Questions: Describe a project you worked on.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and I was asked to complete an online assessment. Then a recruiter called me a week later to schedule a phone interview. After the phone interview I was scheduled for a bilingual test. After the bilingual test it takes around a week to get a face to face interview, then drug/background test.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult aspect of being an LVN?

title: Cashier/Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I have applied for jobs with Kaiser for nearly 9 months consistently. I was called 4 months ago for testing and did not immediately receive a call back. A recruiter called me a week ago and scheduled an interview, I prepared myself, aced the interview and was offered the job 3 days later.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult customer?

title: LVN I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Took about a month for them to email me an online test. Once I completed the test, it took about a day for a recruiter to call me. about 2 business days later I was called for an interview in front of a panel.
Interview Questions: what was your most stressful situation and how did you handle it?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application online which was a detailed process but fortunately KP's career portal will save your info for future applications. Not not after my submission I received a call from what I believe was a representative from HR who wanted to coordinate a phone interview with the Assistant Controller. The phone interview was short and sweet, nothing too complex. I was invited to the first in-person interview where I interviewed with the Assistant Controller and Finance Manager one-on-one, answering fairly basic questions. Afterwards I had to take an Excel skills test which was fairly complex and covered advanced functions within excel,  basic MS Acess skills, and even some SQL code. I did well enough on both the one-on-one and and Excel test to be invited to a panel interview where I presented multiple case questions I had emailed to me 48 hrs prior.
Interview Questions: Create a financial model that will display an expected profit level when given inputs are changed.

title: Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the position online about a week later I received a call center assessment interview. I then received a call to set up interview it was a panel interview. I was asked general questions and from that point on I was told that I would hear back from a recruiter when a final decision was made regarding the selection. It was a pretty easy interview aside from the fact that I seemed to be overqualified.
Interview Questions: What position do you want to group to in this company?

title: Marketing Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Initial contact requested that I complete a questionnaire.
4 week process. Deal with HR in initial stages until they narrow down candidates. Took about a week between stages to be contacted.
Obviously has some bureaucracy issues slowing down the process. 
Friendly staff and office -- good corporate culture, especially in the interview process.
Interview Questions: Grilled on technical knowledge as a new candidate just out of college.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by recruiter by phone and was asked routine questions about my interest in the company and my work history. Set up interview for the next week. The interview was panel style with 3 interviewers asking situation based questions. I finally received the call from the recruiter concerning the job offer about 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you disagreed with your supervisor about how to resolve a problem. What was the outcome. Give specifics.

title: Senior Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was a contractor for almost two years and was recommended for hire to the hiring manager.  Extensive background check and health screen.  It took almost a month after the request to reply to finally get the interview. Once the interview was started it took an additional two weeks for Kaiser to reply and when they did the offer was non-negotiable.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was questions related to BFD and BGP.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Union City, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by a panel of physicians and managers. Questions on how I would deal with unruly patients, how I would handle some one who fell. Must apply online first . I was able yo transfer from another department which helped.
Interview Questions: What do I have to offer the company or department.

title: Department Manager of Family Medicine, OB/Gyn, Pediatrics & Injection Clinic Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1:1  with the hiring manager then a panel interview with the staff.  It was a very pleasant experience as everybody made me feel welcomed.  The staff were very appreciative to know that their opinions were entertained and valued.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a first interview with a recruiter who went ovee job duties and qualifications. I was then invited to a group interview with a panel of three managers. If they like you, they invite you to a third round of a one-on-one interview
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions. Strengths, weaknesses, how would handle a stressful situation?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Redwood City, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a long time, it took me about one year of constantly applying to different positions for over 1 year. After I interviewed it took about two months for the manager to offer me the job. I am glad I got the job because kaiser is a great company to work for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Presentation Designer (Specialist) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: For the most part, the interviewing process was good. Kaiser is a very large organization, and some of that bureaucracy shows up in the interviewing process. I imagine it would be great company to work for though. Phone interview was great. In person interview was fine for the most part. Follow up skills test was fine as well. However, the follow-up communications regarding next steps after that could have been better.
Interview Questions: To paraphrase: "Tell me about a time when things did not work with a job/project as you had planned."

title: Physician Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Hiring goes through Human resources: alot of paperwork. Takes months. Eventually = Two interviews. Chief is very upbeat, and makes alot of promises, that end up unfulfilled. Interviewed by group and department administrator = vague answers.
Interview Questions: Did not expect to be asked if I was o.k. in a system without seniority rules?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was able to connect with a campus recruiter from a target school. My resume was able to be reviewed by hiring managers and had various phone interviews. Why would you be a great fit, why Kaiser, past experiences, teamwork, how to make change in a  big company.  Interns have various weekly activities and guest speakers. Great managers and place to work at.
Interview Questions: I'm not sure there was, it was a conversation and talking about past experiences.

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line - very easy process. After about 7-10 days I received phone call from human resources telling me that they would like me to come in for a group interview. I then received a detailed e-mail with instructions and directions for group interview, including the expected attire. This was my first group interview - it was strange at first but I soon felt comfortable. Everyone I dealt with from the security to the human resources personnel to the managers were extremely nice and very proffessional. They made you feel at ease, we were in a large meeting room, there were three Kaiser staff members and about ten interviewees. They set us into groups to get to know each other so we could introduce each other, then they gave us questions regarding previous work experience, stressful situations and the like.
Interview Questions: Questions are all very well written, directly relate to position. Nothing all that difficult nor unexpected

title: Staff RN Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Open-Ended Interview Questions:

Tell me about yourself.

applicable to this position?

Why are you interested in this job?

How would you describe yourself? How

Interview Questions:

What was the biggest obstacle you have overcome?

What two or three things are mo
st important to you in a job?

Describe the kind of 
relationship that should exist
between a supervisor ?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR couldn't get the interviews scheduled and kept cancelling.  Finally schedule everyone with 6 hours notice.  After the interview, no follow-up.   A simple email saying thanks  would have been nice.  I followed up with multiple emails.  I think larger company's forget that potential employees also are performing  an interview.
Interview Questions: None.   The interviewers really didn't interview for subject matter experience.

title: PRN Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
HR Rep called and confirmed interview/date time...Interview was done via a group panel the panel I had was excellent they were extremely professional and put me at ease almost immediately!

One thing that should be obvious be extremely honest about your background (education, job experience, etc.) because they do a very thorough background check...
Interview Questions: Explain how I would handle angry/upset members?(or something similar to that scenario, forgot exact wording)

title: Associate Applications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, got call back to take an assement exam.  About 1 week later got call back to interview for 2 different open positions.  Just under 2 weeks later, I was called by HR and offered a position
Interview Questions: What career choices would i have done differently.

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interview with 2 team managers...We review and approve every post before it appears on our site, and in the case that the community sees something suspicious we will look into the issue and take appropriate action.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you fell you didn't perform as well as you could have.. name a time when you didn't appreciate managers feedback

title: Senior Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Complicated, hard to get through first door, so I was sent in as a temp.  Online isn't always great, good people are missed - rather impersonal.  referral helps. their recruiting office is really just processing on boarding paper
Interview Questions: weaknesses!

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 1-hour phone interview and then an invitation to an all-day interview in-person.  1) I met with the Director, 2) had several individual interviews with research scientists, 3) was taken out to lunch; 4) gave a 1-hour research presentation; 5) followed by more individual interviews with research scientists.
Interview Questions: The interview was so long along that I can't recall the exact questions that were asked...only the context.  I was asked technical questions about my research during my presentation. I was challenged on my methodology such as study design (recruitmemnt, data collection) and implications of findings. The grilling was similar to what you would expect from a journal reviewer.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Skills testing. Interviewed by HR and then interviewed in a group in a panel interview. Applicants were cut or asked to come back for next session.  Background check, license verification.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you have gone above and beyond in a work environment.

2 rounds of interview with principal engineer.
1 round of interview with principal architect.
......lots of hands of Question.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral Interview.  Tell us about an experience.  Tell us what you did....  How would you approach this...  Just give them the best high level answer.  Don't ramble.
Interview Questions: When were your wrong?  Did you tell anyone?

title: Department Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The position was a transfer from another position and the whole process took about six weeks.  We had to bid on the position and wait to find out if we have the needed seniorty for the job.
Interview Questions: Are you reliable?

title: Senior Manager In Marketing Area Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Initially did a phone screen with Recruiter. Basic questions looking to verify skills listed on resume.  Also be prepared to discuss salary.  Salaries listed on GD seem to be inline. 1. Came in for interview with hiring manager. Mostly behavior questions looking for a fair amount of detail in responses. 2. Invited back to meet hiring manager' boss, someone else familiar with the position and a case with the hiring manager. All three were separate mtgs.  More behavior questions and qualitative case questions in first 2 mtgs. The case with HR was qualitative and quantitative, similar to B-school cases.  3. Ask to have phone interview with someone on west coast that works with this position.  4 Received call HR and was told it was down to 2 people and I would here something in a week.  5.Two weeks later had to send in a case that centered around lots of data. They also contacted my references which I was told and is listed on the website as being the last step.  But the.... 6.Then asked me to come in and present the case. 7. Was told more interviewing had to be done and I would hear something in 2 weeks, totally going against the message from HR.  About a month later was contacted and told the job req. was being canceled and was not going to be filled.  It was the most disrespectful process of which I'd been a part. This process went on for over 4 months.  In looking back if to do it again I would have removed myself form consideration but was always told one more week.  I'm not sure it's a reflection of the co. or HR (I think they were frustrated by the lingering of the process also) but was totally engineered by the HM in marketing area.  They showed no regard for my time or any professionalism and can only imagine they would be very difficult to work for.  If interesting in marketing area and are selected to be in process ask very specific questions about process and be conscious of your time. The treatment during interview process is typically very indicative of working environment.
Interview Questions: Ask to lay out steps to forecast business revenue for a new product and an existing one and identify the key differences.

title: SAS Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
-The process intially started with a phone screen with the manager
-Setup onsite interview the same week 
- interviewed with manager and two other people. I was asked a few SAS - technical questions, and understanding of clinical data review. The entire interview lasted about 90 minutes total
Interview Questions:
-Knowledge and comfort level with SAS Base/Advanced 
-Utilization and development of Macros

title: Administrative Specialist IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed at the Regional Office in Pasadena.  It was a group interview comprised of seven candidates.  The interview panel consisted of an HR Manager, two department hiring managers, and an HR student intern.  We were told to spend five minutes gathering info about the person to our right, and vice verse.  At the end of the time, we had to introduce the candidate to the panel.  After all the introductions, a round basket was placed on the table containing strips of paper.  Each strip was a numbered interview question.  We were told to pick a question, read it aloud, and answer to the best of our ability.  The basket was passed around the table twice.  The Hr Manager would further expand on the question with certain individuals.  Then she would say great answer or good and smile.  It feel like she was steering the panel toward certain candidates that she personally liked better or knew (three candidates were internal).  The two department managers just feverishly took notes, checked boxes, and scored.  At the end of the session, one candidate asked about the next steps.  We were told we were the first group of the day, and a few more were scheduled.  Another candidate asked about the length of the process, from interview til start date.  We were told the process could be as short as one month or as long as two.  Three separate positions were being filled from this pool of applicants.  The HR manager seemed annoyed by the questions.  She thanked and dismissed us.
Interview Questions: All of the questions can be found online.  Easy to prep ahead of time.  Though the numbers went up to 50, many questions were the same reworded scenarios.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I easily applied online. Once you get your info in the kaiser Talent network its pretty easy to apply for other jobs within the company. I then received a call to come in and interview.  I was interviewed by two managers who were very polite and professional. Interview went well but I think I may have been over qualified for the position at hand.  That being said I am still applying in hopes to soon become part of the Kaiser family.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with someone who wanted to enter the office and refused to sign the log book.?

title: Project Manager II Interview

The interviewers were very nice, but asked the hard questions. Definitely come prepared to answer those standard interview questions.  They also cared a lot about how I interacted and related to the rest of the team, which I'm glad they value.
Interview Questions: How many windows are there in Chicago?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great experience for me. It was my first phone interview and it was with 5 individuals. They all had great questions for me and were very eager to get to know me. They asked questions that were challenging, however, they were not overly challenging. They all were very informative when I asked them questions in return. Overall, it was a great first phone interview experience.

title: A Count Administrative Representative Interview

title: Psychiatrist Interview

title: Informatics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Asked to come in about 2 weeks later. Hated the process though. No one talked to me they just placed me in a room to take an assessment that was very weird. It felt like the LSAT logic test, but programming-type questions. Weird and really complicated questions. After the test, someone just showed me out. They are very impersonal with their interview process; at least, that's the experience I had.

title: Volunteer Interview

title: Solutions Consultant Specialist Interview

After completing 1-on-1 with hiring manager,  3 people panel interview. They interviewed about 1 hour. During interview they asked me to draw on the board about a design of an application.

title: Recruitment Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2014

Interview Questions: Tell me a time when...How would you handle X, what req loads are you used to working?

title: Oncology Clinical Trials RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved first meeting with a manager. Questions mostly to fish out getting along well with others, how well you multitask. questions about handling conflict without direct supervision, and a pretty comprehensive explanation of what the job entails. Then wen on to second interview with another manager. Final interview was with the staff and physicians I would be working with directly.
Interview Questions: What has been the most helpful piece of constructive criticism you have received?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
After applying for a job position online through their career section on their website, I was contacted by the regional HR director 3 months later to join a group interview. It was scheduled about a month out from the invite. When I arrived there were a panel of 8 Kaiser directors from various departments. Everyone filed in and picked their own seats. The lead of the panel then asked all nurses RN and LPNs to line up and order themselves in alphabetical order. After being in line we were then assigned to the partner next to us for the next interview step. 

We were then asked to obtain information from our partner: name, title, work experience, education, where they currently work, why they want to change jobs, and why they would be a good candidate for a position a Kaiser. After we had a few minutes to chat we then had to present our partner to the panel.  

After that we had a small break and were given a sheet with several questions. We were to pick one and tell our answer to the group. After everyone answered their questions we were given the opportunity to ask our own. They then said someone may contact us for further interviews if they feel like we are good candidates to move on.
Interview Questions:
EXAMPLE QUESTIONS:

Describe an episode when you had to deal with an angry or upset patient/ customer.

What are some steps you have used to raise the level of service on your unit?

Tell me about when you received developmental feedback.

Tell me about a time when you dealt with people from different backgrounds.

How does your personality change under stress?

Describe the most difficult decision you ever had to make.

Do anticipate problems or do you react to them?

Tell me about a time when someone disagreed with what you were doing.

title: Associate Provider Contract Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Extensive interview process.  Applied in March of 2014 and was offered the job in May - started in June.  Simply filled out application online at kaiser career website.  I attached a resume and cover letter that was specialized to the job posting.  Received an email about a week later at about 6pm on a Sunday, and as I was reading it the HR lady called to let me know she had just emailed me (they wanted a response by the next day).  She asked me to fill out a two page questionnaire.  Pretty standard - lots of behavioral questions (i.e. Tell us about a time when you had to compromise or work with a difficult employee) and why do you want to work for Kaiser, as well as salary expectations and assurance that commuting would not be an issue.  I sent it in that night, and on Tuesday a manager from Kaiser called to request a phone interview.  A week later I did an hour long phone interview with the two managers.  It was a great interview - they clearly had read my stuff and were contacting me because they thought my experience fit very well.  The interview was a nice conversation.  
The next day, the manager called back and scheduled my on-site interview with the same two managers as well as the executive director.  This took place about a week later.  Fairly laid back; good conversation.  Discussed what I was looking for in a job and how my experience fit the current job description.  Was a nice conversation with occasional requests for examples of when I'd dealt with certain issues.  
The next day the manager emailed to schedule a meeting with just me and the vice president.  He was on vacation so it was scheduled for nearly 3 weeks out.  I went in and he was a lot more difficult - not as open or friendly.  He seemed to be frustrated with work and employees, but had lots of work to do.  He did most of the talking.  I tried to chirp in to explain how I could rectify the issues he complained about, but it was difficult.   
I sent thank you cards to all involved in in-person interviews.  A week later when I hadn't heard anything I emailed the manager to request a status, and she said that HR would be contacting me soon to inform me of their decision.  This was on a Friday.  The next Thursday HR called to offer the job.  On the phone they told me pay and basic employment package to make sure I would accept, and they offered more than I requested so I accepted, and then they informed me of next steps.  Their hiring process is pretty difficult.  I had to do a drug test within 48 hours and then submit an application for a background check - which is thoroughly checked out.  They called everyone - including the job I worked for for 3 weeks in college.  Then they asked for 5 year old W9 tax forms.  They are definitely not messing around with background check so make sure all of your stuff is in order and correct - Kaiser HR was quick to inform me that if anything could not be verified the job offer would be rescinded.  
Thankfully after a week the background check went through and I started getting my next steps packet for first day orientation and all that!  As I said, extensive process but never terribly difficult - it all felt pretty natural and well set up.  Lots of behavioral questions and seeing how your experience applies to specific job.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult or stressful situations and/or coworkers?

title: Senior Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy.  3 interviews.  Whiteboarded.  Very specific questions.  Genuine and sincerely interested in getting to know me and making sure I was the right fit for the position
Interview Questions: Why do I think I would be the right fit for this position

title: QA Test Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone screen after a recruiter found my resume online, followed by a panel interview onsite, then finally a one on one interview with the next level manager. Process overall seemed rather informal but was clearly aimed at finding someone who not only had the skills but alos the right cultural fit.
Interview Questions: Give me your 3 minute elevator pitch. What makes you a great fit for this position?

title: Dental Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hiring is tough. You have to apply every week. I know several people who applied every week for a couple of years before getting hired. Interview is a panel of three, that include management, and union employees.
Interview Questions: Describe a mistake you made at work, and how did you correct it?

title: Senior Configuration Analyst, Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was as expected nothing out of the norm, basically asked about my work history.  Do you work well with others? What management style do you prefer?  Tell me about a time you had to work with a difficult employee?
Interview Questions: Tell me about your prior work history have you ever worked in a union environment?

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The entire process took 3 months from applying. It consisted of a phone screening interview from HR, then an 1:1 with the HR rep.  She then sent me off to the hiring manager the next week, which then scheduled a panel interview with fellow PMs, the dept director, and a relevant person in a sister department.  After getting the offer, I had to wait 2 weeks to start. Overall the process I expected for a large organization like KP.

Note: Having a concise and printed project portfolio really, really, really helps.  That way you get to control the interview direction rather than having the team do it for you.
Interview Questions: None - my project portfolio answered almost all their questions.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very basic questions about yourself and values. Asked "what is one time you...." type questions regarding leadership, work ethic, personality, etc. Made me write an overview of an article in 20 min. Overall pretty easy, first interview I've ever had so I was really nervous and didn't well. Wish I had prepared answers.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It went very quickly. No phone screens, but there was a questionnaire to complete. Everything seemed great until I got to the interview, although I was not well prepared because many of Kaiser's roles share the same generic job description no matter the department. The hiring manager was confrontational and not friendly, seemed unhappy in his/her own job, the job became more vague and horrible sounding, and the whole matter was rather disappointing. However, I suspect this was more indicative of this particular department and hiring manager than of Kaiser as a whole.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with ambiguity day-to-day?

title: Kp Org Registration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume and cover letter, I received a call for an interview within two days. The interview was scheduled for a week later. I was interviewed by two project managers, who were co-managers for my position. The interview was very relaxed and they presented their questions in a way that felt like they truly wanted an answer, not a "gotcha" moment. They both asked questions and gave positive verbal affirmations after some of my answers, which was unexpected but also nice. I went on a two trip immediately following my interview so I received an email while there that they'd like to bring me in for an interview with the director of the department. In hindsight, I realize this was less an interview with her and more of a confirmation and offer of the job. It reviewed what I discussed in the previous interview and she also asked if this job really fit my passions, which happen to be very different from the daily activities for the job. While this was true, I wanted to the job so I was somehow able to link the fundamentals of my passion to the job. My position is technically contracted, so there was no room to ask for more than what I was offered, which was $13.50/hr with little mileage reimbursement. The director described the work environment as "work hard, play hard" and it seemed to ring true as all employees in the department except director are under 35. The actual hiring process took a month and a half and my direct supervisors kept referencing how slow things move within Kaiser, especially paperwork. Even if the job is an ASAP hire, it will most likely take a month to onboard, which is on the quick side. Job descriptions at Kaiser also tend to be written more intimidating and demanding than they actually are, so don't let that scare you off from applying.
Interview Questions: None of them were generally difficult, though the question specific to my background and passions within social justice and fitting with a very non social justice oriented job was unexpected.

title: MA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: it took forever, so long. Phone tag between the initial HR person took 3 weeks. She was miserable. Then it took months to do 2 interviews. Then another couple months to hear back. Then another couple months.
Interview Questions: what is your strength, weakness

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Met at college job fair. Had in person interview first with employees
Interview Questions: Why choose Kaiser

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Then they call/email you to pick up your packet which you then proceed to get your shots (if not done so), drug test and so on .
Interview Questions: What I would bring to the company

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a group interview with other possible interns and then the directors of the program. We had to answer questions within a group and answer later.
Interview Questions: How would you respond if someone needed medical help but you were not trained?

title: Learning Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was quite easy and it was conducted by the Project Manager. The PM was kind enough to provide the background information about KP in general and the expectations for the role. The interview started with:
1. Introduction about yourself
2. Describe your passion and expectations for the applied position
3. Types of methodology that I applied in my projects

Nothing crazy. 

But, please make sure that you keep in touch with the interviewers.

Well, I had an experience that I was accepted as an intern but, the HR had forgotten to inform me about the new. I almost lost the opportunity. Fortunately, I followed up with the PM to get my status. It was such a close call.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

title: Enrollment Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interviewed at Oakland, CA with 2 people. Very nice & approachable & not intimidating. Very warm & opened up with job description & expectations. Provided their experience with the organization and wanted to just really get to know the person & interpersonal skills
Interview Questions:
Many experience scenario questions.. 

Why do you want the job? 
Name a time when you didn't agree with something in the workplace...
An initiative that started & why.. 
What are your strengths & weaknesses?
How can you contribute to the organization?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview with HR, then 1:1 interview with hiring manager, then panel interview with the dept. Both intertviews asked behavavioral type questions
Interview Questions: Behavior questions were essentionally the same question asked but worded differently

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application and did not get a response until almost 2.5months later. I had a phone interview shortly the first contact and an in person 2 weeks later. It was a great experience as the penal was basically talking about the position and what to expect than ask a lot of questions.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions. Pretty general.

title: Director of Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Cumbersome.  HR is slow to respond or completely non responsive.  As a manager, the hiring tools and HR staff make it difficult for you to review resumes personally except those they pass on, many of which are not ones you would choose for the role and dont fit because humans dont review most of them and good people are screened out by computers,
Interview Questions: How would you describe what I do?  Not a trick question.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The recruiting and hiring process at Kaiser is a disaster.   As both a hiring manager and as an applicant, I have seen qualified applicants routinely "lost" in system.  The online application process is outdated and decidedly user-unfriendly.  The job database (Taleo-based)  is extremely difficult to search.  Each position has to be applied for separately.  Applicants rarely receive acknowledgements and almost never get status updates from HR.  The hiring process is extremely protracted, inefficient and almost hostile.
Interview Questions: There is NO standard interview or screening process at this company.  Most managers recruit their own candidates because the system is so broken.  In 10 years of hiring, only once did I get a qualified applicant from HR.

title: Environmental Services Technician (Housekeeping) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online in September and was called for an October Interview, it was with 3-4 of management team and a 3 part interview. In January after my many calls with a contingent job offer based on drug and background check has taken from Jan-March.
Interview Questions: What does the word Team mean to YOU?

title: Human Resources Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Alameda, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Kaiser hires a lot of contractors who may or may not eventually become full time employees.  So one important path into Kaiser is to find what staffing firms they are currently using and to get registered with that staffing firm.  Also, Kaiser's hiring process is glacial in many cases. Your recruiter may alert you to an opportunity for which you will need to fill out forms and re-write your resume, but it could be MONTHS before you get a response (and they might even LOVE your resume, but just take the typical Kaiser epoch in order to make a decision).

Now, the interviews almost never start with a discussion of your resume and often never even reference you resume.  The interviews are a conversation about general experiences.  Be ready to tell them a story about a time you had to give someone disappointing news, a time you had to tell someone 'No,' a time in which you had a problem you simply couldn't solve on your own and how you dealt with that challenge.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you dealt with negative feedback that you thought was inaccurate.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited by a recruiter. A team of 5-6 managers interviewed me. They were very friendly and sincere and I could feel their sincere interest. I got the job after that 1 interview, but was told that it was really unusual.
Interview Questions: Experience working in a union environment.

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Redwood City, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I recieved a call for a short phone interview.  SHortly after I recieved a call for in person interview.  I beleive It went good but I do believe I need to practice not being so nerves.  They said they would call in 2 weeks after they interview a couple of more canidates.
Interview Questions: What software are you more familar with other than what you listed on your reseme

title: ON-CALL Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: got a job interview on march 7, 2013 one weeks later they called me with a  job offer. its been two weeks background check is clear, drug test still pending (was done 2 days ago) and now an previous employer verification check is pending. my start date is April 7. Lets hope that happens.
Interview Questions: none Interview went great.

title: Clinical Documentation and Audit Operations Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Woodland Hills, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Called Department to ask if positions were available. I was immediately given an interview date based on skills and qualifications. The day of the interview I was asked to demonstrate Microsoft Excel Proficiency due to the large amounts of data that the department gathers and maintains. Interview questions were a bit difficult to answer but skills landed me the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you should be hired to work here?

title: Process Improvement Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications were done through HR.  Through email they set up a phone screening interview.  The interview was about 20 minutes. Next a group interview was set up with members in the department.  Process went quickly.  Everything completed within 5 days.
Interview Questions: Asked about the usefulness of the six sigma certification for me.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: group interview with 2 supervisors. Asked numerous questions involving certain situations. 5 people were there total being interviewed. Initially applied online through the website and then they emailed me for the interview or group interview.  After that they called or emailed you to let you know if you were selected initially for float pool and then you would be allowed to bid on permanent positions.
Interview Questions: About a situation in which you went out of your way to help a patient.

title: Associate Provider Contract Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: LONG!  Entire process took 5 months or so.  I applied online, and then an internal HR person called and said she would email a questionnaire to me that needed to be filled out ASAP.  Then, phone interview, then in-person interview with same people on the phone (2 managers) plus the Executive Director, and then one final 1:1 interview with the Vice President, just to make sure you're not crazy.  Then job offer takes forever.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in contracting?

title: Clinical Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Modesto, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: i first met with the incoming and outgoing Director at one location. I was then asked to come for a second interview a week later. I was put in a panel interview where I sat across the room from 5 people who were literally 20 feet from me. It was awful. Obviously I felt it was very impersonal. Even though they liked me I found out later that I was second choice to a someone who was within the company that they wanted to give it to that had NO experience with the area that they were hiring for. I was not asked any questions about the job itself or how I would handle the work or train people....just the usual generic questions. I was told after I got the job that I better put on my rollerskates which was not a lie because I literally walked two miles a day going to meetings.
Interview Questions: How do I deal with conflict.

title: Data Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was reached out by an employee via email asking if I am interested in their works. I replied and schedule a day for a phone interview. There were two phone interviews before the on-site interview with different groups. Everyone was professional and super nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: They introduced their work and I was asked about my research backgrounds and skill sets.

title: IT Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: KP IT HR Recruiter was very knowledgeable about the position they were screening and interviewing for.  The next steps process post the initial phone, screening interview  was thoroughly and clearly explained.  The recruiter was an advocate for matching the applicant skills to the position requirements ensuring a good fit for the company and the applicant.  A very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you are a good fit for this position?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: For this position, interviews varied in the way they were conducted. People had webcam, phone call, individual, and/or group interviews. I was interviewed in a group by a panel of 4 individuals.
Interview Questions: Give a situation where you had to utilize your communication skills to solve a problem.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied over a year ago and got a random call  I was told to take an assessment test in which I did exceptionally well. Then I was scheduled for 2 interviews did really good on both got a call with an offer and now im just waiting on  grtting drug tested and background.
Interview Questions: What makes you the right person for this position. What makes you better than anyone else.

title: QOS Interview
