Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and cover letter, and was directed to a lengthy questionnaire. Weeks later, I got a phone interview, which I thought went quite well. I was given a final-round in-person interview with a panel of three interviewers. Not crazy-hard, I'm just an extremely awkward person. They asked the usual questions about why do you want this position, why are you qualified, etc. They also gave me a short SAS exercise, which did not go well, plus some case studies in which I had to think outloud and outline how I would approach the situation. Everyone was very gracious and pleasant.
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: If you are chosen you have a telephone interview first, once passed if the hiring manager likes your resume they set you up a face to face interview. If they decide to hire you, they call you the next day and offer the position. From receiving the offer letter to going through background check and drug screen all took a little more than a month.
Interview Questions: Clinical Medical Assistant questions.

title: Compliance Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, went through a behavioral interview and heard back from them pretty quickly. The phone interview was about an hour long and I spoke directly with the manager I will be working under.
Interview Questions: Q: What is your biggest weakness?

title: LVN III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: none really, based on seniority, with the union environment, you were picked on seniority, not on merit, so you never were able to get the job based on your own abilities.
Interview Questions: Depends on who was interviewing and why, usually wanted to know what you would do in certain situations.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Kaiser is a large and (interview wise) slow moving company - I had 5 separate stages to my interview which ultimately ended with an offer extended about 3 months after the process began.  So, if for financial reasons you need a job immediately, this may not be the place for you.  

The interviews were 2 phone, 3 in-person, the last of which was an informal lunch.  The questions were fairly standard about past experience, how have you dealt with challenges, give examples of past experience and what you learned etc.

There was also a fairly standard business writing test administered during one of the onsite meetings - It took about 30Min.
Interview Questions: I was changing job focus from one focus to Project Management - Explaining why I was interested in project management and how it would be a fit long term was difficult.  Especially because it is a wide open question that forces you to be descriptive yet to the point.

title: IT Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from HR to set up a time to interview with my Director. I had one phone interview and then an offer the next day. The interview was behavioral questions, my work history, my education, and why I would be a good fit for the position. The internship lasts 3 months : June to September.
Interview Questions: None. All the questions were behavioral and based off the resume.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Went though an organization through school. I spoke with two employees in the department and they only asked behavioral questions. The interview took about 30 or 45 minutes. Once I spoke with them, I heard back a few weeks later. Hiring took a few weeks because I had to get drug tested, a physical, and return paperwork in person.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult.

title: Operating Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Telephone contact and interview with Manager, then the supervisor. Once the confirmation letter is send out, before starting the job, 2 days orientation is mandatory.
Interview Questions: Few questions about engineer job to make sure you have some hands-on experience.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Varies with the hiring source. Probably the application process, review, initial selection, telephone interview, selected for face-face or panel interview, final selection, and hire.
Interview Questions: NA

title: Workstation PC Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The whole process from initial recruiter contact to offer took a little less than 3 weeks.  The initial phone screen was about 10-15 minutes going over the position and my background and work experience.  The in-person interview happened 3 days after and it was a group / panel interview with 3 people.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you like / dislike about your boss?

title: Conciege Health Plan Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Relatively long hiring process. Recruiter phone screening, online assessment test, in person group interview and one-on-one traditional behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about yourself" in only 2-3 minutes to include what you know about the role and Kaiser, your background and why you would be a good fit.

title: Department Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interviews and two interviews if they are interested
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses

title: Senior Analyst Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: n/a
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Community Benefits Administrative Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Completed a prescreening questionnaire and was invited to a group interview. The group interview had about 9-12 people in a panel interview setting. They asked many behavioral questions related to past work experience. I was invited to an individual panel interview afterward with the regional manager of the department and two current employees who gave information about the job, company, their line of work and asked further behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a creative idea you had to implement. What did you do and how was the outcome?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty straight forward and formal. It was focused on my personality traits and work experience to gauge whether I'd be a good fit for the department. They also asked what drew me to the company and why I do the work I do. It wasn't the hardest interview, but it's best to be prepared by knowing the company's mission and function, and being confident in the skills you have.
Interview Questions: What project management/ coordination experience do you have?

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: To be hired in to company can be from 3 - 6 months. To move around company takes about 1 month. There usually is a 1 - 3 panelled interview with leadership.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult issues or employees.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process took probably two months.  The only way to get an interview for most people is to be recommended by an employee,  since they get about 1000 applications per opening.  Interview was pretty standard behavioral questions.  Be sure your application and resume are extremely accurate because the verification process is brutal.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult people

title: Retail Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received a one on one interview a month after I applied. Started working about a month after I was interviewed. HR worked extremely slow and made the hiring process longer than needed.
Interview Questions: Every question seemed to be the typical interview question: why do you want to work with the company, tell me about yourself, tell me a time when…

title: Human Resources Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process is probably like every other company, a long process.  HR screens, call for more information, forwards resume to hiring manager if feels you are qualified.  Then the interview process starts.  Can take weeks between first, second, and third face-to-face interviews. Usually panel interviews, which I prefer. Sometimes HR will decline you as good candidate, but the hiring manager will somehow get resume and contact you if they are interested.  So that is a good thing because you have a shot at selling yourself.
Interview Questions: Some interviews focus on behavioral questions, while others are more focused on your technical skills.  Most recent interview focused on technical/job knowledge.  These are most difficult.

title: Teleservices Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fair Oaks, VA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very fast. Interviewed at hiring event. Hired on the spot and given schedule and pay offer all at the interview. The interview was short and sweet and to the point. Hours were selected by candidate and are first come first served
Interview Questions: What would I be able to offer to the position and company

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Great interview! Asked quite a lot technical questions.It was one onsite interview with the hiring manager, technical lead and one fellow consultant. Overall, I was satisfied by the interview process. I got the offer a week after the interview. Background check took a lot of time (40 days).
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience.

title: Flex SHIMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Washington, DC) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: After applying at Kaiser and not hearing a single response for nearly 7 years, I finally made it to the next step when I applied for a position in the Mid-Atlantic region. First I was required to take a Medical Terminology test. About two weeks later, I received an email from my potential supervisor for an interview. In all honesty, I felt I bombed the first few questions, but I made sure to speak about good management skills, patient privacy, and learning how to work as a team. I had a panel interview with three people, and in addition to my being nervous, the questions were somewhat difficult.  Interview lasted about an hour. Once I returned home, I sent a follow-up letter to the three interviewers, thanking them for their time, and further expressing my interest in the position. About a week and a half later, I was offered the position! They did a background check and of course a drug screening. Once that was completed, the offer became final. Will start soon!
Interview Questions: What do you know about Kaiser and our organization?

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online.  Was contacted directly via phone by hiring director.  He bypassed HR, which I very happy about.  Entire process took 4 weeks (which is fast for Kaiser) normally much slower.  He scheduled a phone interview, then in person in Burbank to meet + an additional colleague.  Also, met another Director one week later via face to face.
Interview Questions: How do you manage projects and work cross-functionally with teams.  Your experience with working with large accounts and consulting companies

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy. It was 2 people that did the interview at the same time. Made you feel comfortable. The interview lasted about 15-20 min. If you graduated from an RHIT program it’s usually a guarantee they will hire you if they need workers.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Got referred to the department and was called by the supervisor for an initial phone interview. I was asked to come in to interview with a 3 person panel. Had to take an excel, word, powerpoint, and typing test prior to interviewing. I think the whole process took a couple months.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process itself was fantastic. However due to them using multiple temp agencies the actual hiring process is a bit chaotic.I was offered the position two days after the interview but the start date kept moving, and my agency didn't inform me of the correct day, so i had to scramble for the first day on the job.
Interview Questions: They asked typical questions such as what is your best quality, and what is your weakest.

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I have no idea...the initial recruiter never answered my return phone calls or voice mails that I left on her voice mail system.  This was very disappointing after she left a message on my answering machine to give her a call back about my my experience and skills and to arrange a further time for a more delailled phone conversation.
Interview Questions: Can you please contact me at the following phone number so that I can learn more about your skills, experience, and background? I also want to explore setting up another phone interview to discuss your experiences in greater detail.  Can you please give me a call back at your earliest opportunity?

title: CSC, Member Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Most interviews are Behavioral, so you will have 2-5 people asking you questions that center around past experiences- "tell us about a time when you....".  Be sure to have examples readily available!
Interview Questions: Most difficult task is usually thinking of a scenario on the spot.  If possible think of all types of situations that you have been in before, both good and bad, so that you can draw from them.

title: Strategic Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Good process and thoughtful thinking goes into each position
Interview Questions: none

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Rafael, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The main reason I am writing this review is because after I was initially rejected as a candidate Kaiser San Rafael is so disorganized they mistakenly called me back for an interview 2 months LATER -  completely forgetting (missing) that I had already be previously rejected as a candidate!  They didn't even have the balls to call me back to apologize for their error.  

Back in January I interviewed multiple times (for multiple RN positions) at Kaiser San Rafael.  I was a travel RN for them so was able to be granted an interview just on knowing people.  You still need to do a basic skills test online before you are granted an in-person interview.  I interviewed 3 times! These were all panel (3 person or more) interviews with a hiring manager, RN staff, and/or nursing administrators. When I say I had multiple interviews it's not a good thing - it was a complete disorganized cluster F and a waste of my time.  Kaiser San Rafael in particular is administratively extremely disorganized.  Management turnover is epidemic.  Managers don't even know what jobs are posted as open because position openings are entirely mitigated by a central brain in Oakland.  To top it off, they disrespect candidates by dragging out the process and feel no obligation to tell candidates they will not receive an offer so basically they leave you hanging...
Interview Questions:
Tell us a time when you had to think critically or make a tough choice.
Tell us a time when you had a difficult situation, and what you did.
What do you do to say on top of your nursing practice?

title: Technical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
My first interview was completed over the phone and it was long, almost 90 minutes Then I was given some writing assignments to complete within a  certain deadline. This was actually difficult because the free version of the software I was required to download onto my computer was buggy. Still, I was given a second interview, which was in-person and with the entire team I would be working with. This was fairly informal for a panel interview.

The whole process took a long time from start to finish.
Interview Questions: If you knew you had a deadline coming up and that you were not going to be able to complete your project on time, would you rather turn it in late, but complete, or on time, but incomplete?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: In initial stages, you will be interviewed by the recruiter.  If invited for an interview, you will interview with the chief and likely other members of the department.
Interview Questions: Straight forward. They are getting to know you, and you are getting to know them.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Canoga Park, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was only a one on one interview with the manager of the group. The interview lasted maybe a few minutes, I was allowed to come back in the following week to be briefed on compliance and privacy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: typing test and then an online assessment. The online assessment took about 3 hours and test you in Math, Business writing and other general education areas. It also test you on Word and Excel. There is also a personality test that you should answer honestly because it was designed to tell if you lie.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied, was called in for testing, then group interview then finally 1 to 1 interview with the legal department. I made it to the final round however the job ended up being canceled. It was extremely disappointing considering all the steps that needed to be taken. I took a lot of time off to go in for everything only for the position to be canceled a few weeks later. It was very disheartening.
Interview Questions: While doing monotonous or repetitive work, how do you stay focused and alert?

title: Labor Relations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, phone interview and online testing preceded one day-long, personal interview: 2 rounds of Q's & A's with company officials, HR representatives and union reps.The online tests were not designed to reflect nature of job applied for; several questions (i.e., mathematics) were wholly irrelevant to job.
Interview Questions: How would you handle this crisis, that problematic development (absenteeism)?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They asked a lot over question, went over my experience and skill set. Typical interview. The hired me on the spot. I told they about previous job, skill, prior experience at KP, which they were really happy about.
Interview Questions: Can you start on Monday ?

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, after a month received a call to attend a personal interview, presented myself and interviewed with several people in group and personally, a week later received a call with an offer.
Interview Questions: What to do in very specific research scenario and what decision making process and decision to make.

title: Senior IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: A single interview with another Project Manager and the Hiring Program Manager. The Drug Screening, background check and immunizations check was a long and drawn out process. In addition, the HR process can take a while to get through.
Interview Questions:
How do I handle non-performing project team members?
Describe my method of tracking project status?
How do I handle multiple concurrent projects?

title: Primary Care Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Great process, several current docs will talk with you and you can ask them questions.  You will also meet the PIC and the head of the department you will work in as well as get a tour of the facility
Interview Questions: Basic questions, most importantly they are just looking to see if you are a good fit for the organization.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: after submitting application, the HR department was slow paced. I believe I received a phone call within 2 months? I was given a phone interview, and called in for a "group interview." where you sat in a conference room, at a large table with the other applicants. A nurse manager, another MA, and I believe someone from HR led the interview. I was then called back for another one on one interview. lengthy process for sure.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Manager of Sterile Processing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Walnut Creek, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I Started with an interview on the phone with the Recruiter and then a phone interview with the hiring boss.  Finally, I was able to interview with other managers assistant managers, and tour the facility.  The phone interview was very basic to find my interest, and see if I qualified to be moved to the next level.  My interview with the hiring Director lasted about an hour and was directed at behavioral questions.  Finally, the panel interview included other managers, and my future assistant manager who also asked mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a  situation where the Operating Room Want instrumentation but it is not sterile.

title: Psychiatric Social Work Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Sent in CV, writing sample, with email. Emailed for interview. One hour long interview
Interview Questions: Case vignette

title: HIM Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was painful when I applied at Kaiser.  I had to come in for numerous interviews.  I'm not one to complain about the number of interviews, but having 4 interviews with the same person who asked the same questions wasn't really a sign of trust in my abilities.  Also, the job was an entry level position where all I was doing was filing charts.  In my opinion, I feel like I had to jump through hoops just to called back got another interview.  I ended up accepting the position when it was offered but was very skeptical about the management.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult but the repeated interviews with repeated questions was less than desired.

title: Customer Relations Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Brooklyn Heights, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Back in late 2002 the interview process was a phone interview, then an assessment test for typing speed and accuracy, and finally a sit down interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: This was a Kaiser position offered through a recruiting company. The interview was done completely through Kaiser. It was a group type interview and there were multiple rounds of questioning. There were 3 Directors there asking us various questions. People were sent home after each round, so you knew right away if you weren't chosen. We were told at the end whether we were picked for the position or not.
Interview Questions: What were some types of organization skills you applied at your last job?

title: Director - Product Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was quick in 2-3 days. I had 3 rounds and an other informal round. The first two were Telephonic, then 1 with the actual team and 1 with a Senior Consultant. It was quick but I can't say was very well organized.
Interview Questions: There were no odd questions, it was along my experience and what my expectations are from the role. I had done some earlier analysis on the popularity of the platform among the Physicians at KP. I felt quite soon there was a culture mismatch. This group seemed very close-minded.

title: Managerial Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions:
First round interview was a case interview about hospital operations. You are provided time alone to read the case and review the questions. You are then joined by two interviewers who ask you to answer the questions orally. You then are asked to interpret some data provided in an excel spreadsheet related to the case.

Second round interview is a typical behavioral interview, with questions about your work habits and experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about how to work with a client.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Norwalk, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: 2 part interview on the same day and they interview everybody the same way and u just had to be patient with the process and nobody got asked the same question because they want to see how your interviewing skills where.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self...

title: Appointment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very streamlined. They emailed a document advising step by step application and interview process therefore you knew what to expect and what documents were needed.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about taking call after call making doctor appointments for paitents who may not be feeling good?

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great. Meet some great leadership in the organization. Walked in sat dow and was interviewed by a panel. They were very impressed with my qualifications. The interview went smoothly. The interview was great. Meet some great leadership in the organization. Walked in sat dow and was interviewed by a panel. They were very impressed with my qualifications. The interview went smoothly
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Principal Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Due to distance, interview was held over the phone. It was also with someone I had worked with before, so they knew me. Since this was a move in the company, and they had knowledge of me it was a pretty smooth interview. I was well qualified for the position, so there were no problems
Interview Questions: Have you done policy analysis?

title: Cashier/Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The only way to apply is online now. Look for a job and remember the reference number. If you are selected, they will call you in to test for the job of this specific reference number. Typically, for a cashier/receptionist position, you will take Basic Computer Competency courses, tested on you WPM, and medical terminology. If you pass these test, then you go into the next phase and get an interview. The interview typically has 3 people evaluating and asking questions. This is a conservative company. Refrain from showing tattoos, piercing, and unnatural colored hair. Be friendly and professional. Make sure you know a little bit about the company and the department you applied for. It will help knowing what kind of procedures the department does so you can explain the process to patients. Knowing a little bit of medical background definitely helps, even if this is a desk job.
Interview Questions: The hardest questions to answers has to do with customer service. From previous customer service jobs, you learn that "the customer is always right". But that is not the case a hospital because of HIPPA. Learn what HIPPA is and scenarios that directly involve HIPPA. Kaiser Permanente is very strict about following the law. These are not customers but patients who have rights you must protect.

title: Underwriter I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Usually a long 3 to 6 month process.  First interview is usually over the phone.  Second interview has 2 or 3 people interviewing you for the positions.  If they are still undecided, then a third interview with a panel of managers.  Once they like you, they will look into your background.
Interview Questions: They make you take a basic math test.  At first I thought it was a trick because it was too simple.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Just learn to kiss as much ass as heavenly possible. Stroke egos and play the slave trade game.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? I still wonder why I do.

title: Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is long and takes time. There will be anywhere between 2 to 5 interviews based on the business area. It is important to research the company and understand Kaiser's value system. It at all possible, learn about the department you are interviewing for. The more information you have to provide the better.
Interview Questions: You must be able to point out your greatest weakness, a difficult challenge you overcame and what you would change about your past job.

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Years ago I interviewed for a psychologist position. It was worse then the horrible oral exam I went through to get my psychology license. Fortunately, oral licensing exams are gone, and horrible job interviews with Kaiser Permanente are very rare. (I passed the licensing exam because I showed great restraint. Same with the job interview.)
Interview Questions: What comprises a mental status examination?

title: Senior Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was surprised at the lack of urgency. I felt like the process took a long time (2 months from interview to hire, but the job was posted for a couple months before I applied). Since being in the company and seeing the entire hiring process, I think it's fair to say the process takes an average of 3-5 months from positing to hire. Once I actually received an interview I was turned off by the aloof attitude of the hiring manager. The interview itself was more heavily focused on my technical proficiency and skills, as opposed to culture fit/personality (perhaps it was because I was referred from someone internally, so the hiring manager assumed I would be a "fit.")
Interview Questions: I was not expecting multiple skill/proficiency tests

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively straight forward. I had a phone interview, and then a full day of interviews with a case study, and then another in person interview that were 1:1s.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you developed a strategy

title: Human Resources Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The recruitment process at Kaiser is HORRIBLE!  The recruiters are of two "types":  arrogant, unpleasant, aggressive, smug, rude, and self-important OR totally not "accountable" ignorong requests for updates.  They are quite arrogant.
Interview Questions: Did you do your homework!

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Panel interviews are conducted. No one other than myself, arrived at scheduled time, nor apologize. Promotes oftentimes form within, leaving those outside of the company little hope to become an employee. Often the temporary positions last 2 yrs or more, then are hired by another department full time, usually taking a pay decrease.
Interview Questions: Wanted to know why I left a former employer and didn't stay when the company was being split into 2 companies.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 people (manager, supervisor, and employee), background check, drug test, typing test, then got the call with the job offer. Started working there about 5 days after the offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a previous error I made, and how did I handle it after?

title: Programming Analyst Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had 3 phone interviews, first one with the manager, second was with the team, and third was a lunch interview with the manager.  No difficult interview questions, mainly behavioral.
Interview Questions: SQL related questions

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Began communicating through inquiry email.  Eventually brought in for an informal email with three team members.  Was offered the internship on the spot.  Team members seemed to get along well and appeared to be a positive work environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Phlebotomy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Kennesaw, GA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I went to the open house fair at Kaiser Permanente Gwinnett Hospital. I got there thirty minutes early because I wasn't sure how many people would be attending despite it being invite only. I saw a recruiter within ten minutes once it started.  I have been invited to the next step a panel interview with a group of managers. The recruiter stated once he gets my assessment scores back he will contact me.
Interview Questions: The assessment was mostly about personality and dealing with patients but the second part got a little more interesting. There was a lot of the math and reading on the second part keep in mind every question is timed.

title: Pharmacy Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: usually there is 1-2 interviews with the supervisor and her assistant. This consists of themselves praising how amazing they are and what an honor it is for you to be considered to work under them. Then you are told that you should expect to have nothing else going on in your life in order to accept a position so that you can be given every shift that no one else wants since you are the least senior employee.
Interview Questions: Questions are not difficult, Why you want to work for them, where you see yourself in a few years, what is important in a job....

title: Senior Business Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was initial HR contact with a list of qualifying questions to complete.  Thereafter moved on to panel interview 3 weeks later.  Was hired maybe 3 weeks later. Background search company is terrible and acts for the same information over and over. You will not receive a written offer until after you pass the background search, so its not official until then.
Interview Questions: None.  Typical interview questions.  Lots of group or panel interviews.  This is what lots of depts. like to do at Kaiser.

title: Senior Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 1.  Submitted an online application  2. Filled out questionnaire received in the mail  3. Phone screening interview with the recruiter  4.  In-person interview with team members (not hiring manager)  5. 1-2 weeks after, recruiter said that team members have chosen another candidate to interview with the hiring manager
Interview Questions: Presentation skills, Excel skills, reports, etc.  What kind of manager would you like to work with?

title: Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Multiple review process via phone and in-person. Detailed engineering group level review (s) and hiring manager one-on-one. Followed by HR consultant followup
Interview Questions: A number of very detailed technical level questions were asked (subject matter specific)

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vacaville, CA)
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was pretty easy for me.  I interviewed for a Y2K project and knew the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: There wasn't anything I wasn't expecting asked

title: Psychosocial Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel type interview consisting of 4-5 individuals within the psychiatric department
Interview Questions: Be prepared for a vignette

title: Undergraduate Level Student Temp Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They contacted me by email. Brought me in for an on-site interview within a week. I was given a packet and asked to find all the mistakes in the representation of the data. Furthermore, this was paired with a behavioral interview. Three current employees in the same position asked me about my interest with working at Kaiser. Furthermore, I was asked to translate a letter from Mandarin to English.
Interview Questions: No question really stood out. Be prepared for a variety of behavioral questions

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an online ad.  A week later I received a phone call to set up an interview.   It was with 2 pharmacy managers, was relaxed, with typical questions such as why should we hire you - what makes you different? HR sent an email rejection a week later.
Interview Questions: What motivates you?

title: Analyst (Contractor) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called me a did a pre screening. Hiring Manager called me and did a brief intro. Was hired over the phone
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: This firm took 4 months to make a hiring decision.  It took me almost 3 months to be reimbursed for travel expenses related to the interview. The process included phone screens and panel interviews.  There was an initial phone screen by recruiter, phone screen by hiring manager, face to face panel interview and multiple additional phone screens as follow up.  Copies of presentations and communications were requested as work samples.
Interview Questions: Detail the change management process that was used in an implementation that you conducted.

title: Administrative Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Involved a distance phone call. The process was minimal and yet rigorous.  Required thinking on feet during case study.
Interview Questions: There were not any questions that were particularly difficult.  There was a case study but it should not be difficult if you have MHA training.

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Union City, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very long process. 30-minute phone screening with recruiter a few weeks after submitting my application, followed by a phone interview with the hiring manager and one in-person panel interview. The entire process was approximately 2 months.
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from the other candidates? Are you comfortable working independently? What type of patient do you find to be the most challenging?

title: Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Before you interview you must take an EKG test at human resources. No appointment is required. They take a week to correct it. Then they call you to notify you if you passed. You must wait until a Unit Director reviews your application and test results to set up an interview. Many never get that opportunity. Once you get an interview you are interviewed by Charge Nurse and Director. Should take bring to interview copies of references, resume and cover letter. It willtakes two weeks for them to tell you if they hired you.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate? Why work for KP? What are your qualifications and how would you approach a co-worker that is rude?

title: Senior Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through a personal referral. Got contacted by the admin for a F2F interview (no telephone pre-screening). Both rounds of interviews had 3-4 people in the room with a standard list of questions given to each of the 3 candidates. Questions were simple and mostly behavorial.

One weird thing did happen. I was waiting outside the interview room after a previous interviewee left the building. The 4 people on the hiring panel proceeded to talk loudly about the pros and cons of the other two candidates for 10 minutes while I was waiting. I could hear everything! It was quite unprofessional and strange.
Interview Questions: Standard questions. On the second interview they wanted me to repeat what I understood the job to be.

title: Business Line Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Was rferred to hiring manager by a friend.  Interviewed with manager and a future peer.  Next interviewed by another future peer and future direct report.  Finally interviewed by the executive consultant to the department vice president.

Process took 3 months.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your last job to improve the employee satisfaction

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Roseville, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted about 30 minutes. I had met with the director and manager of the department in an office. Both asked me questions and gave me enough time to answer. I felt comfortable and relaxed and positive about the experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you encountered a difficult situation or co-worker. What was the outcome?
What would your current supervisor say about you or your work?

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received a call to setup the interview. I had the interview within 5 day. Day interview I showed up we went into conference room I was asked a list of questions like why should they hire me, what do I bring to the table and if I have reliable transporation to work.
Interview Questions: Why should they hire me?

title: Senior Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Sent in my resume one night, heard back the following morning from the recruiter via email, who sent me a questionnaire. Filled that out that day and sent it back. Heard back the following morning again from the recruiter already trying to set a salary level. They asked me to come in the next morning to interview with the LSA, but due to some personal things, I couldn't the next morning, and so I accepted an interview with their colleague and department head (at the same time). I thought the interview went very well, but I never heard back from the recruiter. I emailed the recruiter immediately after the interview thanking them for setting up the interview and for considering me. I called again a week later to thank them again and told them why I was right for the position. Never heard back. Emailed two weeks later with similar info asking when a decision would be made. Heard back a week later from a generic email saying I was disqualified. 

The work culture looked great; people dressing both casually and business casual with headphones in their ears as they came in and out of the building. Very clean looking building with security in the front to check in with.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Finance Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
1. HR phone screen 2. Interview with hiring manager 3a. Interview with staff 3b. Interview with peer group 4. Interview with hiring manager again.

Everyone took notes and they asked follow up questions.
Interview Questions: All behavioral question: tell me about a time when.  All predicated on past behavior is most indicative of future behavior.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview.  A little intimidating. Some questions were difficult, but I made sure I was prepared for the interview.  Lasted about an hour total.  The tests were very difficult!  Make sure you have a calculator available!
Interview Questions: What would you do if you could not satisfy a patient?

title: Senior Health Plan Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: initial interview was over the phone and lasted about 30 minutes. we discussed resume and work experience and issues that would arise with the position. 2nd interview was in person. more questions were asked and was a total of 60 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple tasks that have the same due date

title: Certified Clinical Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: For me it was awesome vey smooth and very quick. Very please with that transition.
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing not to participate in the assisting of abortions?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Great way is to do your internship with Kaiser to get a position here.
Interview Questions: Getting another position without enough years at Kaiser

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Inside for staff position, already an educator at site. Face to face
Interview Questions: Re  in class treatment of difficult topics

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Simple, quick and relaxing. Conducted in the hiring manager's office, with only two people conducted the interview, then presented offer the next day. It depends on who you interview with, I guess.
Interview Questions: what you have done, what's your strength, weakness, etc.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with 2 managers. One was the direct manager for the position and that person's boss (who managed many departments). The interview was brief.  Manager was personable and friendly yet professional.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you were facing hardship in a project...

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Great, felt very relaxed and the manager made a very comfortable environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PM Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process - multi levels of interviews (phone, in person).  Panel style interview.
Interview Questions: How to handle a situation where resources are just not available to get the job done?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Most interviews are conducted by panel and often involve a selection from pre-prepared list of questions, although some also involve some kind of performance testing as well. It's usually a lengthy process, so except for positions where they have an urgent need, don't expect quick results. Most are planned and organized through their in-house HR department.
Interview Questions: I really don't recall, but it was probably something about identifying your own weaknesses.

title: Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is not as bad as one might expect. On top of the usual behavioral interview and meeting various people in upper management, there is a case study interview which was new for me. This was a great way to get a taste of what types of issues you'd be consulting on if hired. You are presented a previous project they have worked on where they outline an issue and various data/background. You are also given a set of questions to help guide you to create a presentation you give after the alloted time to look over the case is over. The next part is simply showcasing your thought process working through the case. For me it felt more like a conversation than an actual formal presentation.  It was actually a fun process and if the idea of going through a case study freaks you out... maybe consulting isn't for you.
Interview Questions: What is your brand?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a behavioral interview which in my opinion show nothing of your work history or skills. Most of the questions were simple and answers could have been made up on the spot.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you made an error and how you corrected it and did you report it to management.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for one position with the supervisor and director. I then was called back in for another position with the supervisor, director, and 2 co-workers. They all had questions for me, related to the current position and my past positions. Very friendly and informed.
Interview Questions: Please discuss any negative experience with a past co-worker and how you handled it.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview that asked very basic questions like what are your best qualities and what previous experiences you have had that would make you qualified for this job. Other questions included situational experiences that are problem solving.
Interview Questions: This was not very difficult per se. It was very formal and straight forward.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The panel of interviewers was amazing and made me feel instantly relaxed when I walked in the door.Normal interview questions nothing out of the ordinary. I was prepared and did lots of research before my interview. That made me super confident for the whole process although I was a little nervous when I found out it was a panel interview. I look forward to a very long career with Kaiser.
Interview Questions: None, They were all pretty normal interview questions and some that were position related.

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Received a call for an interview with 2 managers.  Interviewed 2 more times for a total of 3 interviews.  Questions included:  What are your strengths?  What is one area you are working on?  What professional development have you engaged in this past year?
Interview Questions: If you encountered a very upset patient, how would you handle this patient?

title: Project Manager III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: HR phone screening, 1st in person interview, and 2nd group interview process was used.  There was a test to evaluate skills in excel and email composition.  Other than the phone screen, each interview meeting lasted 1 hour.
Interview Questions: Ability to understand data, Presentation Skills, and Comfortability with Candor

title: Senior Technical Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
There was an interview screening conducted with the subcontractor/vendor/recruiter to describe the rypes of work you've performed.  An 
Phone interview  was then scheduled and conducted with the Kaiser Permanente Program Manager once approved for the next step I. The process. The Face to Face interview was conducted with not only colleague Technical PMs but also with the Program Manager, followed by the Director of the Department.
Interview Questions:
Talk about your responsibilities on your last positions and how they relate to the candidate position.
What is a typical day and week for you as a project manager?
What were some of your most challenging job risks and how did you handle/mitigate them?
What is your management style?
Do you feel comfortable managing cross functional teams and how would/have you handle a disgruntled staff member in matrix managed environments?
Why did you leave your last job?

title: Support Services Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Can take 6 plus months with many interviews
Interview Questions: Normal

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Short, not a lot of questions. They want to see that you actually want this job, not just getting into it for the money.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Principal Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very slow and drawn out. Not very transparent with infmration about job clsasses or salaries. The Coordination between staffing and human resources was difficult to witness.
Interview Questions: Tell us of a time when you were faced with a challenge and you failed.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The process was long, mainly due to travel schedules, but stretched over nearly 2 months.  I had almost four interviews, including 2 phone, 2 person and had a mock assignment.  HR/Recruiters were helpful and responsive. However, received little feedback about final decision.
Interview Questions: Questions were standard, nothing difficult or out of the blue.

title: Senior IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Walnut Creek, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was direct and quick. My Director was a rare breed - made a decision quickly and then moved fast to fill the position. Most other interviews I've heard of at Kaiser (or experienced) will drag out for extended periods, with feedback seeming to imply that many managers have trouble making decisions quickly. My Director was fantastic, definitive, and was a great person to work for.
Interview Questions: Definition of "Critical Path" in Project Management

title: Revenue Cycle Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial brief phone interview, that was followed by a person to person interview with the hiring manager or HR representative, and finally a panel interview that included peers for your perspective position and staff members.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations with a patient?

title: Benefits Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a little hard. I had unexpected questions. I had this interview years ago I don't remember  exactly everything. I do remember being nervous and had two people interviewing asking questions about performance and ethics and to give examples. I do also remember them asking for my strengths and weakness in the work field.
Interview Questions: Questions about Ethics  and Team building

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied a month later received a call for an interview. The interview was very short.  There were four people. One of them was very nice and one was very short and to the point. The other two were nice recieved a email letting me know I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you went over and above for your job?

title: Senior Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: it was very disorganized and chaotic, the manager left the room several times, the space in which i interviewed was very cramped.  I was not given a tour of the facility and not provided with an accurate description of the organization's receptiveness to suggestions
Interview Questions: they asked me what i would do if a patient who does not qualify for a 4 wheeled walker came in for an evaluation and demanded one

title: Business Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Contacted on linked in, responded, was called within a few days.  Phone interview with the recruiter and the hiring director.  Panel interview with peer senior managers.
Interview Questions: None - it was all about my experience.  Some questions on how to handle conflict between business needs and IT restrictions.

title: Sales Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had three individual group interviews before being hired.  All of the interviews were based on the Behavioral Interviewing techniques.  The Behavioral Interviewing is a very good predictor of past and current behaviour.  These were all panel interviews with at least 3 or more individuals.  The questions were like "tell me about a time when you went above and beyond what your job required".  What did you do, what did you learn, what would you do differently next time.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you had to influence a group of people to do something that you have no control over them.

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Previous experience, excel skills.
Interview Questions: Were you exposed to confidential information in your experience?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online and after about a week I got a call from the HR individual. She left me a message, and I called her back. We set up an in-person interview time for later that week. I arrived at the interview 15 mins early and was taken in ten minutes before the interview. They asked me question about why I wanted to intern at Kaiser, what I knew about the trends in healthcare and what I could contribute to their company. I got a call back within 3 days with the internship offer.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of behavioral questions that were unexpected. Like how would you handle a supervisor who isn't treating you well.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the Director and an in-person interview was scheduled. It was an all day interview from 9-5. After meeting with the Director, I had several 30-minute one-on-one interviews with different Research Scientists. I gave a 1-hour job talk and was taken out to lunch by several people from the Biostatistics Department. Afterwards I had more one-on-one interviews.
Interview Questions: What, in your career, are you most proud of?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Calverton, MD) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 3 people had a background check and drug screening,
Interview Questions: Unix questions because I was not a Unix user.

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process consisted of an initial submission and rough quaification overview with the recruiter. Then a 15 minute phone interview with the hiring manager where we discussed the project I would be working on.  Finally an in person interview with the one hiring manager that lasted about 30 minutes, again discussing the project, more so than my qualifications.
Interview Questions: Does this seem like a project you would want to work on?

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Recruiter will email you to fill out a lengthy questionnaire.
Recruiter will conduct a phone Interview
Recruiter will determine if you get an in person interview
Hiring Manager will conduct an in person interview
(sometimes there will be a panel interview - 4 to 1)
Recruiter will call you to offer the position
Interview Questions: What have you done to show that you are credible?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had to sit before a group of coworkers and department head. It was rather informal but most of the conversation ranged upon my prior skill then it was followed up with a site walkthrough
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult coworkers?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy interview process, talked to various people in the organization through phone interviews before being invited to an in-person interview. No coordination by HR on the various open positions. But people are very nice and passionate about their job.
Interview Questions: experience related questions.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was quite a few group interviews.  I sat in at least four group interviews.  The first interview had 20 people and a panel of 6 Doctors and Nurses.  It is hard to make a good first impression when there are 20 people interviewing.  The worst experience ever.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Kaiser?

title: Digital Imaging Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sonoma, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line and was given an oral interview by HR and told my resume would be presented to a Hiring Manager.  The Hiring Manager called a week later.  We did not interview until several weeks later.
Interview Questions: How many days a year are you sick?

title: Hospitalist/Internist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: meeting with VP answering to questions about my qualifications, background, and skills,  later with chief telling me my job description, location of work, and hours, then I was introduced to HR staff my benefits were explained
Interview Questions: are you applying for permanent job?

title: Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by a Kaiser recruiter for a position within IT. Had two rounds of interviews. The teams didn't seem to know exactly what they needed, and had no clear communications strategy for their project. I had two interviews with two levels of recruiters then was brought in for two rounds of interviews. The first one was with team members. The second was with other team members and the leader of the group .
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a group that has low morale and has undergone a lot of change?

title: Addictions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (North Richmond, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview where I was called without notice. I spoke with a former student of mine.  She told me they were looking for some very specific qualifications. I had the sense that they wanted very specific orientation for the position.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would treat dual diagnosis

title: Entry Level IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and e-mailed recruiter. Got an email and then a call from the recruiter asking me to come in a week to their new location. I was met by some current young employees and then taken into one interview room. Two people asked me about my technical skills, although I had already told the recruiter I don't have any programming knowledge. Lasted about 10 minutes. Then went into a 2nd interview with 2 group managers and a Sr. director. This was more pleasant and was mostly behavioral, with a couple technical questions. Mostly focused on why I wanted to work for Kaiser, what I knew about them, my background, etc.
Interview Questions: What kind of programming skills do you have?

title: Kaiser Paramente Sterile Processing Tech/Externship Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Antioch, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Gained a lot of knowledge and experience from externship with this facility. I received a great student evaluation. Finding out it is very difficult to get hired. Have to wait till job is posted on line then apply. Upper management is in charge of hiring not individual departments
Interview Questions: I do not have a difficult or unexpected question at this time

title: Member Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Extensive application and testing procedure leading up to group interviews.  All impersonal and based on performance, as it should be.
Interview Questions: How would you define "Taking Ownership" of a telephone call as a Kaiser Permanente Employee.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: KP HR came to my college and did resume reviews and mock interviews. Then I applied for the internship and received a phone interview from HR then from the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work at KP?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Went through an initial phone interview, which resulted in an in person interview. They have a strong multi-year finance intern program with 25 interns.
Interview Questions: What is a personal area you want to work on?

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very stratified and thorough. I applied online and was contacted by a recruiter. After my phone interview I had 3 in person interviews. The interviews were a panel style then a second round panel style followed by a 1 on 1 with the hiring manager. The process was efficient and quick.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience as it relates to the position

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Berkeley, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the internship program recruiter asking for my availability for a phone interview with her and a project manager. The phone interview went well and had an in person interview on campus. From there, I waited a week for a phone call letting me know I got the position and my hourly wage.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I Met with several business unit managers and directors from around the region.  They were very good at letting me know what the culture was and what my job would entail.  A couple phone interview and then a couple face to face.
Interview Questions: Basic questions

title: Health Plan Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: First recruiter calls to confirm interview appointment. Interview takes about 30 minutes and with a panel of people that include Director, department lead, and a fellow Health Plan Rep. After the interview is over, a response with whether the job is offered or not happens in about two weeks. The Director calls the employee with the offer.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Front Office Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Called by HR, basic phone interview, went in to interview with department, again basic interview questions
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Hillsboro, OR) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with manager, panel interview with behavioral Interview style where everyone asks a question. I waited about a week to hear back and was offered the position based on passing the next steps. It still took about a month for everything to go through, reference checks, drug test etc. before getting a start date
Interview Questions: Give a situation where you were part of a team and how you functioned in that team? Give an example of a time when you had a problem with a co-worker and how did you handle it. Name your biggest weakness.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter contacted me 3 weeks after I applied for this position. Right of the bat, she asked my desired salary range and why I want to work for KP. The hiring managers requested a phone interview 4 weeks later and then 2 face to face interviews.
Interview Questions: What is the one thing you absolutely cannot stand?

title: Lab Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very long and tedious. It took about one month to get a call from HR for the phone screen interview, then another month to hear from the Manager for an interview.
