Then from the interview you have to wait for the manager to check your references (only two needed), Which took about two weeks. Now if everything is good they give your stuff back to HR which then officially offers the position. Now it gets tedious. You have to reapply with more details for the background check. You have 48hrs to do your drug test. And then fill out a short form. Simple but after waiting 2 months you get tired and worn out from wondering and waiting to hear from them. Not knowing the whole time if your actually getting hired.
Interview Questions: Basic questions. What kind of worker are you? What do you like to do for fun?

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume online then got a one hour long phone interview
Interview Questions: some specific technical questions about database

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The first step is to answer a pre-interview screening.  This appears to take the place of what a normal telephone interview entails with most other companies.  It's nice to have some time to consider your answers, but it takes away the opportunity to make an interview into a conversation about the job and whether or not it may be a good fit on both sides.
Interview Questions: What is your current or last compensation rate? Specify base salary, bonus, and incentive plan separately.

title: Senior Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Took over 6 months. During this time 2 recruiters either left or went on leave of absence and never assigning the process to a counter part. It was a lot of waiting before I was informed that the req was closed.
Interview Questions: No questions just a scenario questionnaire

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very engaging and friendly. Respectful. They ask the typical questions, such as, tell me about yourself. Telll me why you're interested in the role. Tell me why you're interested in the company.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: First you get a phone interview with HR, then a group interview and lastly a one to one interview. The group interview is not as intimidating as it sounds. It is just important to be prepared and study up on what the company does, what the job is, and bring more examples to the table. They want to see people who are willing to work hard and have a positive attired
Interview Questions: What is a good customer service moment you've had?

title: Editor/Writer (Burbank) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by phone and asked if it was a good time to talk. I said yes, not expecting to be interviewed on the spot without being given fair warning or time to prepare. 
The caller then proceeded to ask me questions that were, frankly, outdated and somewhat ridiculous. This person was obviously reading questions from a list and did not seem to have my resume anywhere near her. Having someone like that be in charge of reaching out to potential employees was a huge red flag. 
I've since gone on a couple more interviews with other companies and true professionals who know what they're doing and have breathed a huge sigh of relief!
Interview Questions: "What are your strengths and weaknesses?" I thought people stopped asking that in the 80s when they realized how dumb it was. I've interviewed quite a few people myself and have never asked that - and no one else has asked me that.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD)
Interview Descriptions: several steps
Interview Questions: this is a union job. Are you as a professional able to work in an environment like that?

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Annoying.  First, you have to talk to the recruiter to reiterate all the things which you already have spent hours cutting and pasting into your application online.  Then, if everything checks out, you can interview with the department manager.  The manager I interviewed with was EXCELLENT!  But then, it goes back to HR.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself ultimately.

title: Ward Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Honolulu, HI)
Interview Descriptions:
-Apply Online
-If a qualified candidate HR will call you for an interview.
-Interview with hiring manager.
-If selected HR will call you with a offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 3 Manager panel interview with generic interview questions related to experience in similar positions held, management style, short and long term career plans, and expectations working in the unit.  Followed by 10 panel interview with unit nurses, probing questions focused on management style, and extent of loyalty to staff nurses.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to staff nurse complaints against your own manager colleagues playing favourites and being unfair to the staff nurses?

title: Supply Chain Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews one phone interview and one in person interview with the supply chain director. The phone screen was very basic: tell me about yourself, why supply chain management, etc. Basically turned into a casual conversation. I was invited to go into the office and met the director of supply chain operations. He introduced me to some of the team members and gave me a tour of the workplace. No technical questions.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected if anything interview was a lot more laid back than usual.

title: Admitting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied. Received a call from HR recruiter to come in for typing test after that did a phone interview with the recruiter. Did not hear back for months until the department manager emailed me asking if i was still interested in the.
Interview Questions: very simple customer service questions

title: Manager of Coding & Compliance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Great interview, very thorough and detailed. Asked questions about coding and what are the most common codes found. Focus on specialty of billinh
Interview Questions: How would you manage a labor dispute?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typical sit down, tell me about yourself and your skills, what are your strengths, weaknesses, what is your five year plan. what computer programs have you used, showed me around, introduced me to possible coworkers. Then brought me back into her office and said everything looked good as long as my background/drug screen came back clear, the job would be mine.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to handle being around blood vomit and other body fluids without getting sick yourself.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview with different levels and about background. Asked behavior questions and previous experience questions.  Talked about expectations and what is expected for the role.  Talked about salary expectation and work life balance.
Interview Questions: Years of experience and how experience is relevant

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fremont, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel style so be prepared because you'll be asked multiple questions by more than four employees. Also, panel interviews can be a bit uncomfortable because of all of the questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me why you're leaving your current company?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online application process . Got a returned call from friendly and informative representative . Interviewed following week. Interview with nursing director of the unit. Offered the position three days later. Orientation into Kaiser (general staff of all departments and positions), took place about three weeks after interview. It was an introduction of the company with information and huge exciting production on how and when Kaiser began.  A lot of pride for being apart of this company was clearly noticed.
Interview Questions: How many times did you call out sick within the past year?

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Cannot remember the process however was friendly and not difficult at all. Had a great team.Cannot remember the process however was friendly and not difficult at all. Had a great team.
Interview Questions: Cant remember

title: Anatomical Pathology Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Usual group interview with questions probably from the internet
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was a very thorough process. First, I had a phone interview with a company recruiter. Then, I had a phone interview with a senior manager. Then, I had an in-person interview with the hiring manager. Finally, I had a writing and editing test.
Interview Questions: Experience and how it related to the position

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Quite easy, but they try to intimidate you.
Interview Questions: None really

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: After my resume got selected, I had an initial phone screening from the HR department asking behavioral questions. After that, I had another interview appointment with the marketing manager about experience in the field or other relevant experience. The manager also asked several behavioral questions that are more relevant to the position.
Interview Questions: What was the toughest work you've had and how did you tackle it?

title: Graduate Business Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: First I applied online because I saw that Kaiser recruiting was going to be on campus. I told the recruiter the job number and got some questions about my interest. After a few days I got an email from another recruiter and in it was a pre-screen questionnaire document. After completing the document and sending it back I received a call from the same recruiter to set up an in-person interview with the hiring manager. Interview went well and I got the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I have a friend who works at Kaiser in Northern California. She referred me to a recruiter at Kaiser Los Angeles, who contacted me and connected me with the department to which I was interested in. The interview consisted of two department heads and myself.
Interview Questions: Are you six sigma certified?

title: Assistant Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: After credentials were confirmed candidates were asked to come in for panel interview. We were 3 all lined up for back to back sessions. Hiring unit manager was less of a participant than his 2 assistants who asked better interview questions. The lady interviewed ahead of me was obviously close to the hiring manager as I saw them having a friendly conversation over snacks at the cafeteria earlier. Results were given after a week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was hired during my externship. Due to an unexpected opening I was told by the manager to go downstairs and fill out an application.
Interview Questions: My work ethic during my externship secured me the job

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: In person with al the people on the team
Interview Questions: People Management and resolving conflicts witht the management teams

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Contacted the hiring director directly as well as putting in an online application. Interviewed with the hiring manager, then with the staff who report to me. Mostly used a behavioral question format. It helps to find out the name of the hiring manager and call that person directly. The hr people don't always pass reumes and applications on in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were either hard or unexpected.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer said, "I know I'm not supposed to ask, but...'ARE YOU MARRIED AND DO YOU HAVE CHILDREN?"  Egad, EEO law has been clear for many years on the inappropriateness of these questions.  I was extremely surprised and disappointed that the largest healthcare company in the US would so blatantly violate employment law.  What else are they doing that's not right?
Interview Questions: See above forsurprising illegal questions.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Was called for a pre-screening "interview," which was very informal, asking about my interests.

It was followed by the actual interview, which was a panel of 3 people. They were interested in why I wanted the job, previous leadership experience, and my coursework. Last about an hour
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a time where you were minimal direction on how to approach an assigned project, and how you tackled it.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The human resources people are a joke. The only reason that I was able to get an interview, is because I looked up and inquired with people about who the hiring manager was and contacted directly. I think that you have to be in KP or know someone to get a good job here.  My interview process was lovely. I met a panel of three and then a one-on-one. The communication after the interview was a bit spotty, but after about two weeks was told that I would be offered the position, but they were still dealing with HR in making the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Advice Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Completed the online application and submitted my resume.  Few days later I was emailed a notification to complete an online assessment.  Assessment included a timed typing test then 200+anatomy & physiology, syllogism/logical/deductive reasoning, and behavioral type questions. 2 days later I was called to schedule an interview with the site manager.

The Interview:  3-panel style with each panel member alternating asking scenario type questions.  I didn't feel intimidated but the set-up is a bit anxiety-inducing; almost like an interrogation-tell the truth and you'll do fine!
Interview Questions: Name a time that you went above or beyond expectation in your current job.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: From hitting send on the application to starting my first day it took over 2.5 months, so be patient and don't get discouraged. Everyone I talked to was very nice. I had 3 interviews total (2 on the phone and 1 in person). First one was with a HR rep and next two with the hiring manager. Overall everyone really put me at ease so I could do my best in the interviews.
Interview Questions: The very first phone interview happened unscheduled. I got a call 2 weeks after the HR representative let me know they wanted to interview me. So as soon as they tell you they want to interview you, start preparing for that first call (it may be impromptu).

title: Senior Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: over the phone, in person, direct hire. the job description did not really match what the manager was trying to accomplish so i had to switch gears very quickly to keep them interested.  The entire session contract was very interesting and from a distributed network of professionals trying to come to the same final approach.
Interview Questions: how do you handle ambiguity

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser uses behavioral interview questions, to find out the applicants service attributes. They believe that past behaviors determines future success.
Interview Questions: What is something you did wrong and how did it impact your job and what would you do differently in the future?

title: Medical Transcriptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Assessment tests, both in typing speed and medical terminology. Had to transcribe different accents. Had to show at least 99% accuracy on reports transcribed. The manager asked me what my availability was. He wanted to know how I handled conflict. It was pretty much the same as any other interview. Now they are all focused on the personality assessment tests.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What are your future goals? Are you willing to work nights and weekends?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: welcoming, brief overview of previous jobs held, typical and average interview. reasons as to why there was a change in work goals, what I was looking to do in about 5 years.
Interview Questions: what made you choose KP?

title: Nurse Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: II applied online. About 2 weeks later, I was then contacted by HR to review my resume and application. Once HR felt I met qualifications the application was sent to the hiring manager. 10 days later a interview date was set up for the following week. I had not been told that it would be a multi-person panel that would be present at the interview. Present at the interview were multi-disciplinary representatives including a physician, nurse, a person currently holding a similar position, a medical assistant, member of management and a person from HR. At the conclusion, they explained the next step and when to expect to hear back from them (7-10 days) which was accurate.
Interview Questions: Was given a real life clinic scenario of an outpatient day surgery and asked to identify areas of concern and how I would have addressed the issues at the time and what training/education/policies would be developed to change the practice.

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baldwin Park, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied personally in human resources. I then got interviewed by the human resources recruiter, then I got interviewed by the department administrator. I had plenty of job experience on the field, having worked for a temp agency provided me with the opportunity to put my foot in the door with Kaiser Permanente.
Interview Questions: Former job experience, questions about attendance for example when is the best time to call out, questions about customer service, example: How would you deal with an irate patient, or how do you get along with difficult coworkers.

title: Postdoctoral Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Started with a screening phone call, then an in person interview with a panel of clinicians. It was pretty standard for a postdoctoral interview in terms of presenting case material and explaining ones professional interests.
Interview Questions: asked to review a vignette and give my clinical impressions.

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I started as an intern with a written questionnaire for Internship role, which involved 2 follow up interviews - one over the phone and one in person. I was extended offer next day after in person interview. After a year internship I was offered a FT role.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial Phone where they reviewed and confirmed the resume.  During Phone interview they were interested in reason why I was wanting to leave current employer. Followed up with 3 in-person interviews to meet all the staff I would be working with. Job offer on Third in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Asked a lot about my work history and they type of people I worked with. Company is large and its hard to lay off people so they make sure you are the right fit before hiring.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was walked into a room with three managers and read a list of questions to answer.  The thing you remember is that you need to show you're resourceful and that you can research effectively
Interview Questions: What was a difficult decision you had to make in the workplace in your previous job?

title: Business Process Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted by a KP recruiter on LinkedIn.  The communication with KP was great.  They had me fill out a survey describing my experience in more detail.  KP scheduled a phone interview with hiring manager.  Then, went in for a in-person interview with two panel groups.  1 hour with hiring manager, HR director, and director.  30 mins with coworkers.  

Interview was comfortable  in a conference room.  They were warm and friendly. 

Mainly behavioral questions related to problem solving and team building skills. Answered with my experience using the STAR method.
Interview Questions: What have you done with a project when you're not reaching ROI?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: submit cv to hr for an initial review. photo interview with department head. face-to-face interview with department team and head
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: One week after phone interview got the on site interview. There are around 7 people to interview me on-site together and asked both behavior and technical questions.
Interview Questions: What is the principle for setting up QC specification

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Stockton, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with staff, managers, peer Directors, senior leaders, physician leaders and executive leaders.  They were thoughtful in their approach. The detailed interview process demonstrated the importance of the role and their desire to find the right candidate. I especially liked that they included the front line staff who would report to ths position as it positions me in a much better place.
Interview Questions: How would you measure your success in he first six months?

title: Senior IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: From time of application to interview it was a month and a couple of weeks. Interviewers asked basic behavioral questions. Job description was not conducive to the work they expected the PM to perform. They wanted a business analyst, not a Sr. PM responsible for ICD-10 end to end testing.  From the time of application to 1st day of work it was almost 2 months as they have a minimum of 3 weeks for on-boarding new folks.
Interview Questions: Standard behavioral type questions. "Tell me about a time you were unsuccessful and what you did to rectify the situation."

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Most people feel the  interview process is very extensive! But if you a professional its a breeze. They conduct a panel interview, maybe 4-5 upper management & Directors. Overall its a great experience
Interview Questions: How do you handle hostile patient?

title: Applications Development Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Found the opening through their jobs website. In person interview with a panel.
Overall, interview was pleasant and straightforward. Most of the questions revolved around team building, handling difficult situations and people. Was also asked about achievements with current employer and projects/products that I consider a success. Was also asked why those projects were my favs, my contribution to the projects.
Interview Questions: Explain in detail your activities and initiatives towards team building?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews with normal type interview questions. Describe how you deal with an irate customer.
Interview Questions: Share a time when you may have lost your temper with a customer.

title: Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: First did a phone interview with someone at the corporate office. Then, I went in to the Corona location and took a computer skills test. Did an interview with panel of three people.
Interview Questions: What do we do here at Kaiser Permanente?  Provide Health Care

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was approached by a Vice President because my work was known to that individual. I was asked to apply for the position. I had a two-and-a-half hour interview with a group of people, including my potential boss and potential subordinates (this last part was new to me). The interview was very pleasant and relaxed. People were working from prepared questions, but I certainly had the ability to provide additional, clarifying information, as needed. There were a LOT of questions.
Interview Questions: "Tell us why we need YOU specifically to do this job. What can you bring to it that absolutely puts you at the top of the list."

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Long recruiting and interview process. Recruiter screened. I had several phone interviews and met with 5 different executives in the process. Everyone was very friendly and asked helpful questions.
Interview Questions: Past experience leading in a complex environment.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very long with a series of phone interviews and little to no communication in between.  No communication about the position being filled on not so you won't know if you are still under consideration.
Interview Questions: No surprising questions....just the typical interview questions such as interests, time something worked well, time something didn't turn out as expected, weaknesses, etc.

title: IT Compliance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter contacted me and set up 1:1 interview with the hiring manager. Hiring manager was a total jerk. Job description didnt have anything to do with the actual job. Interview consisted of him telling me how stressed he was and how badly he needed a manager.
Interview Questions: I was told I was in the final 3 candidates and would be scheduled for that. Never heard from the company for about 3 months when I got an email saying I was not selected. Terrible hiring process.

title: Javascript Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: phone interview
Interview Questions: very detail about javascript and jquery

title: Regional Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Chino, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a panel process.  I was asked to share my career experience and background.  My manager was very professional and explained the details of the job requirements (commuting, early morning or even hours occasionally).  I landed the job right on the spot!
Interview Questions: Have I ever managed a project where my deadline move-up abruptly?  Was I able to meet that deliverable deadline, and if so, how?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview questions were straight forward and relative to job posting.
Interview Questions: In relation to your job, please describe a weakness that you may have.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Casual. The lady in charge of the department was a complete joke. Was sent here by a recruiter, so it was not your average interview i guess. Other departments may have been different.
Interview Questions: I dont remember what questions they asked. Nothing difficult, since this was a temp position

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Littleton, CO) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Committee interview by staff manager, medical office director, several physicians, advanced practice providers, and staff at all positions and levels.  Truly was a team effort to ask questions.  Standard experience and future goals/expectation questions asked.  This occurred after contact from HR rep to schedule interview day and time with the hiring manager. Was also able to interview for several locations needing same position.
Interview Questions: Patient care and how to handle care situations.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Website for job application is a nightmare.  that is the only way to get a foot in the door. Networking does not seem to help.  HR generally is slow to respond.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you would do if you heard a rumor about someone and then you had to work with them.  Would you assume it to be true or get to know the person first.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume to employee referral, had a phone interview with the dept manager, then had to apply on the company website. Onsite 1st interview with 4 people individually, then came back for a second interview with manager and director. After getting the offer, had to complete drug test within 3 days.
Interview Questions: How have you handled ambiguity in the past and what did you do to resolve it?

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took over a month because the hiring manager went on vacation for a month.  But after she came back, everything went fast and smoothly.  A phone call, followed by two interview sessions, each with three individuals, and finally a chat with the director of the department.
Interview Questions: There was no difficulty nor any unexpected questions.

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by the Assistant Chief Learning Officer, the PM and two Analysts. The initial communication was with the PM first by phone and then by e-mail.  We briefly discussed my background and then he touched on some of the areas of the job duties and responsibilities and the salary for the position and at the end of our conversation  he set the appointment for the interview .
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Charge RN, Triage/Message Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Panorama City, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
panel interview with nursing staff, nursing supervisor and manager, Consisted of several questions by all individuals involved. at first, it was very intimidated, but them I was not as stressed when answering all necessary questions.

very intimidating with panel interview
Interview Questions: am i flexible to other opportunities, eg. Asthma education

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Handle 40 to 80 bed unit during a time period including employee reviews, regional goals and attendance.  The assistant management follows the management style and work philosphy.  They champion one or two issues in the unit to encourage, direct and reprimand front line staff into following the standards.  

The interviews were divided up in three separate panels.  One panel included management and educators.  The second group included physicians.  The third panel was made up of front line staff.  Each panel interview took approximately an hour.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation that you had to present and support an idea that you didn't agree we?

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Leandro, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initially I was contacted by recruiter who did a telephone interview/screening.  About a month later I was contacted by the department manager and then the actual interview was with a Panel of 5 people (Director, Manager, other social workers, Union shop steward). The interview was with scripted questions & previously selected vignettes.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict with a co-worker? What would you do?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. Started out as a big group then it's a process of elimination. I survived til the 3rd interview of the day. Questions are easy and straight to the point but the other candidates has more experience than me being only in my 3rd yr or nursing compared to their 10-15 yrs, and other candidates has masters and some are charge nurses.
Interview Questions: Why kaiser?

title: Project Management Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I got an email from Kaiser suggesting I apply for this job because my skills matched what they were looking for.  I filled out app online.  I was called to come in for computer testing.  They told me on the spot that I passed.  They called the next day to schedule interview.  I was the first person they interviewed.  The manager had to go out of town for a few days, so that prolonged the process, but it was probably 2 weeks before I received a call that I had not gotten the job.
Interview Questions: Several questions were focused on customer service.

title: Chart Room Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied and took a basic skills test. Was given a date to return for a group interview. After the group interview they selected right then and there who would advance and go on to 1:1 interviews later that afternoon.
Interview Questions: Most difficult but easy question was "What would you say is your motto in life?"

title: Human Resources Call Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Alameda, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted through a staffing agency; the interview took place a week later; It was a phone interview with two individuals, although I was only given one name and surprised when he stated we will conference in shortly.
Interview Questions: Explain in detail a situation where you had a difficult client, how did you handle the situation, what was the outcome?

title: Software Automation Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: First a phone call with the staffing Agency, a very brief interview. The process with Kaiser  involved, coming in on sight and talking to the lead one on one. The project was described and the requirements of the role. Mostly standard  questions about previous projects were asked. A few technical questions here and there to test the skills required for the role.The results came back very fast as well.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were faced with conflicting priorities on a project and how you handled that

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview was by phone (basic questions), 2nd interview was in-person and more technical questions
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Retired Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in person with Manager, then interview with team or group. Average time depends on group and demand for position to be filled. Can range from 4 weeks to 2 months from first contact to offer of employment.
Interview Questions:
-How have you resolved or dealt with different difficult personalities?
-How did you encourage teamwork and supporting fellow employees?
-How were you a proactive employee?

title: Ward Clerk Transcriber Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I needed to had my BLS card and have a Medical Terminology certificate to be considered. Applied online, 1 week later had a phone interview with an HR Representative. Had to fill out another online application to be submitted to hiring manager. One month later scheduled an interview with Hiring Manager. Said I would hear back in 2-3 weeks if I got the job.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had an irate patient? Explain the situation and how you dealt with it.

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met informally with the prospective manager and we talked about the role and expectations.  I had already spoken with the manager on many occasions, we had discussed a lot of things about the job and what it entailed, and she knew that I was finishing my degree so I could accept the job.  I know she had already spoken with my current manager and my work performance was strong, so I guess she didn't feel the need to perform a formal interview.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't an interview, per se.  I had bought a suit and was expecting a formal interview, but that didn't happen.

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process was ok.  The length between interviewing and hearing feedback was too long.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vancouver, WA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel and they ask you the usual questions, about your behavior, about you, about the job, about the skills of you, how you can work with a twam, how you cant work with a twam, how there is no set schedule
Interview Questions: Twll me about a conflict you had with an old coworker

title: Health Promotion Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had done a couple months of training at Kaiser while a student so I kept in touch and when new positions opened, I applied.  Promotions, transfers and hiring are based on seniority first.
Interview Questions: How to handle a threatening patient

title: Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then Face to face with two managers. Hardest part was the background check.... brutal! Really this level of investigation should be illegal. It was so invasive and disrespectful.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Learning Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three part interview.  First is the phone interview with a HR recruiter, phone interview with senior management and lastly a panel interview with three people.  The panel interview did take about two hours.
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified to work here?

title: Project Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my resume in response to a posting on their internal job board.  I got a call from the recruiter within 1about a week.  We had a really good conversation (45 minutes or so).  He told me during that conversation that the hiring manager had already seen my resume and asked him to screen me.  A few days later I got an email to set up an interview time.  I had the interview with the hiring manager about a week later.  Again, the conversation went well (no unusual questions).  She said she was interviewing more candidates, but they would get back to me.  I sent a thank you note, then followed up after a week, after two weeks, and again after 4 weeks.  Finally, the recruiter sent me a note back telling me they were moving forward with other candidates.  Seems sort of unprofessional that they didn't proactively tell me that I was no longer under consideration, but I had to keep following up with them.
Interview Questions: none - very basic.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (McLean, VA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: My supervisor who interviewed me was very nice, genuine, and can easily take away all the anxiety of an interview. She gave me an opportunity because she looked beyond who I was on paper and saw who I could be as a part of a team. The questions were on a packet of paper and they were chosen at random. I did not have to answer the entire packet. It lasted about an hour and most of it were pertaining to patient interactions and how we would handle certain situations.
Interview Questions: What was one thing that you did that was above and beyond your job description?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a one on one interview in the afternoon completed towards the end of my internship. The position was suggested to me by my mentor. I interviewed with the director of the department and it was generally a short process. I believe she only asked 4 questions which should have been an indication of what was to come. I ultimately did not get the position due to experience level. An older lady with more experience was given the position but did not stay in the position long.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult customer whether it be internal or external.

title: Materials Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Clackamas, OR) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was long and started with HR contacting me and then I interviewed with the department manager and then a month later went through orientation. The background check took a long time.
Interview Questions: None, they were the normal ones.

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Its really good they dont make you wait , in and out and they make you feel comfortable like if your at home.the interviers are really nice and helpful. try your best
Interview Questions: how many years a day should you miss

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Combination of phone screenings, 1:1 interviews and panel interviews. These were conducted by leaders, peers and direct reports. All the people I spoke with were very professional and cordial.The interviews were drawn out over a long period of time, that was definitely a downside to the interview process.
Interview Questions: Fit is very important at Kaiser Permanente, many of the questions centered around that. There are many questions about managing a team, leading a team, dealing with difficult executives, etc...

title: Psychiatric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I received a recruiters phone call after submitting my resume, application, and cover letter online and was given a date for an in-person interview in a couple of weeks time.  I was surprised to learn that the interview was a "group interview".  Something less suited for an inpatient psychiatric care position and better suited to a sales associate job at a large chain store.  At the interview I was appalled to find that job candidates were asked to wait with members family in a lobby while a hiring manager discussed the job. Since he was not accustomed to working with people in crisis he made all sorts of inappropriate comments.
Interview Questions: The questions were pretty common; Describe three characteristics of a good psychiatric technician and tell why they are important.  And completely designed to reveal the personality of the applicant; What movie best describes you and why.

title: Lead Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with recruiter, written pre-screening questions, two in-person interviews and offer process.  The questions were thoughtful and the people I met with were all helpful in selling the KP message to me, as well as the type of work I would be doing.  The people really took the time to make sure I had a full picture of the job, the culture and expectations.  I also liked the excitement people showed for the company.
Interview Questions: Please describe one project where it didn't go as planned and what did you do?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three step process: Phone first, then two in person interviews.  Once the offer is extended (which can take a while) the process from offer to hire is about two weeks of background, drug testing, and paperwork.  Nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't a non-standard question asked.  These are pretty tame and typical HR driven interviews

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process was lengthy and redundant. I had a phone interview with HR followed by 4..yes 4 interviews with various individuals whom I would be working with and for. It turned out the reason for the 4 interviews was because they could not coordinate the schedules for the 4 people.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a project or initiative you either developed an / or led. What was achieved and were there any failures?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Washington, DC) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Question types were around Behavior and Skills sets. Much of the discussion focused on previous projects and achievements and strategies to achieve the goals that were set. Experience was what I thought it would be, not too relaxed nor too intimidating.
Interview Questions: How would you ensure you built relationships within the organizaton?

title: Certified Surgical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Long and drawn out, and behavioral questions,  five people asking you questions very intimidating. That is all I have to say, I worked there for 14 years after that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time, when you had a conflict with on of your co-workers?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a panel interview with a lot of "tell me about a time when" questions. Be prepared to answer nursing questions like, the patient is upset but there is an emergency,  how do you handle questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you experienced difficulty with a coworker and how did you handle it.

title: Practice Leader, Health Plan Quality Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter to go over benefits/salary/location/schedule. Interviewed with the hiring manager about specific skills around Peer Review, Policy and Procedure review, technical background, process improvement, then I met with a few people from the team, more for cultural fit
Interview Questions: Asked about experience in Health Plan quality and performance improvement

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from a recruiter the following day. When the recruiter called me to set up a phone interview, they also emailed me an additional questionnaire. The questionnaire had about 15 questions about the "required/preferred" experiences from the job description. The interview was very thorough (more than the typical phone interview questions many guides have suggested) and took about 45 minutes. Questions were related to the specific position as well as about specific examples from your experiences. At the end of the phone interview with the recruiter, I was told there would be an additional in-person interview with the hiring manager  followed by a panel interview with at least 3 people. After about two-three weeks, I received an email indicating that the position was put on hold.
Interview Questions: What are your values?

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Individual interview followed by a panel interview.  Four people took part in the panel interview and it lasted about 2 hours. I received a follow-up phone call the next day.
Interview Questions: Mostly related to problem solving

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with Director and Manager if NSG dept... They misrepresented this position as well as salary.  They asked s barrage of questions and told me of a vision they saw for the department.
Interview Questions: How I handle prioritizing job duty demands.  How I eorked with physicians and staff.  Accomplishments

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was un-intimidating, very nice people, friendly, and made it a very comfortable atmosphere to be in. I would recommend studying for the position ahead of time in order to sound knowledgeable.
Interview Questions: tell about a time that you had to deal with an irate customer.

title: Administrative Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Leandro, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser promotes within first.  I applied, met with the manager/director for a panel interview and was offered position because of my Kaiser experience.  The whole process takes  about a month, Kaiser posts the vacant position, if an internal candidate is selected, they are typically help in their current role for 30 days, to allow time for backfill before moving onto the new role.
Interview Questions: General industry questions.

title: Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Honolulu, HI) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 other Communications Consultants (peers of the position being hired for). This was the first time I've ever been interviewed for a job by people who might see me as competition. If you're a Communications Consultant and have your eye on the next job up the chain, are you going to hire someone with more and better experience than you have? Crazy system. The kickers were the questions about my own history of health care insurance. "We were all Kaiser babies. Are you currently or have you ever been insured by Kaiser Permanente?" (I never have been.) It had that certain cult-like feel. And what were they going to do, check my medical records before hiring??
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview, drug test and background review
Interview Questions: What is syntax for case in pl/sql

title: Regional Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pre-screen phone interview from recruiter - very nice guy, standard questions.  2 part In person - 1. panel of peers in small meeting room 2. hiring manager
Interview Questions: none

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with two people. Manager and associate. Described job and some questions. Took 1 hour. And went very in depth about making it seem like job is super hard and actually said "we try to break our interns" after that I was done. No thank you
Interview Questions: How would you do a white paper

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was very professional and cordial. I received a phone call to set up the interview which was confirmed by email. I was not kept waiting and the interviewers were very friendly. I received a personal call telling me that I was not going to be offered the position and was offered constructive feedback on my interview performance.
Interview Questions: Help us understand how your background brings you to this position?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
HR contacted me by email. I needed to fill out the question form. After that, HR arraged me for an in-person interview. 

I had an interview with two managers. One manager was mainly talking and the other was quiet. The managers give me a good understanding of job.
Interview Questions: Provide me the job experience related the job description

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, per diem position offered, manager asked for my medical assistant diploma and CPR card, showed me around and asked if I wanted the job/position, had me fill out a lengthy job application
Interview Questions: Asked for my medical assistant diploma/certificate and for my CPR/BLS card.

title: Project Manager I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very corporate and by the book with minimal personal interaction. You could tell HR ran the entire question process and the manger hiring for role had little wiggle room. I don't care for this style as candidates simply have to have canned answers and you don't get to really know the candidates and the candidates don't get a sense of the company
Interview Questions: All behavioral questions... Give me an example of a time..... Etc

title: Senior Organization Development Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Went through several one-on-one and group panel interviews and met with day-to-day management personal which was last step in the process. They never got back to me to continue the process, or tell  me I wasn't selected. I just dropped and never received confirmation on my status, or if they hired someone else.
Interview Questions: Walk through process of implementing change and managing resistance in same environment.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very standard with a total of one phone interview and three in-person interviews followed by an offer.
Interview Questions: I don't remember specific questions

title: Proposal Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It takes a long time and is thorough. They require a background check. They often tend to favor internal candidates that you don't realize you are up against. Patience is key as there is opportunity.
Interview Questions: They ask about your job experience.

title: Analysis Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Basically went from email to phone interview. Discussed alot about what they wanted to do..didn't really ask me questions. Second phone interview they had 3 people on the conference call but only one of them did most of the talking.
Interview Questions: What interested you about kaiser?

title: Team Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Kaiser has an extensive process which includes background checks, drug testing and personal interviews with many departments at various levels of the hierarchy. The pre-interview process took over 1 month and the interviews took place over two weeks. Final selection took an additional 1 month.

Candidates should be prepared to present in front of several panels of employees of various departments and answer their questions of the top of your head. Very little preparation can be done for this process since the questions are often not very well organized.
Interview Questions: I was asked to answer questions about internal conflicts and politics in the organization and how I would navigate through these issues when executing my job responsibilities.

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Roseville, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call for an interview after 3 weeks. The initial interview was scheduled for 2 weeks. The interview consisted of the Director and Staff assistant. After the interview, another 2 weeks had gone by with no response. It took several follow up emails and calls to get a second interview. Four weeks later I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: How passionate are you about administrative work?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Springfield, VA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview panel, with rep from each service line that job was providing support to. An offer letter was sent from the HR department then a drug and background screening were preformed
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Communications Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was one-on-one with the person who would be my supervisor. Asked very pointed questions as to what exactly in my past was applicable to the types of marketing programs Kaiser wanted to pursue. Had to speed up my answers, be extremely concise, no time for even a smile or a sense of gentle humour.  

I was asked to wait almost an hour to meet with the interviewer, and then after 20 minutes, my interview was ended.  Being rushed and cut-off mid-sentence as I attempted to respond to a direct query was quite frustrating. I had the ideal background, experience and qualifications, so I was really surprised to be treated like this. I even had a reference from someone who worked at Kaiser. Definitely had the sense this was strictly something that they had to do; there was no desire to interview any outsiders.  I felt an internal candidate had already been selected, and the interviewing of outside applicants was merely a formality. 

That being said, I would really emphasize that this is just one experience, with one person, on one day. This could be a complete anomaly, I can't imagine this is the SOP for Kaiser. However, my best friend -who is a rock star candidate - received the same treatment. You will simply have to go in very well prepared and if you aren't offered a second interview, chalk it up to….. sometimes Kaiser Is strange.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a marketing program your developed?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Long process. Intense background check. Then you meet with a recruiter and from there a panel interview. After being hired you have to attend a week long orientation. Everything just takes a really really long time.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with unruly patients?

title: Practice Leader Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Internal Transfer. I knew them for years. Finally told them I was interested in joining. First lunch with the hiring director. Then a team interview in person (small team). Than a bizarre written exercise where I tried to respond to a large, unfamiliar problem. Then a follow-up team phone interview. Then HR had to do a screening process (after the interviews!). Then a long delay, a verbal salary offer that had to be corrected (downwards!), and then it all went through.
Interview Questions: Write an essay answer to how you would handle getting a large project going without executive sponsorship - regarding a business process I was unfamiliar with.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three steps interview with hiring manager, technical test and executive interview.  The whole process went smooth but the executive interview took time to make the interview arrangement.  The interview was more like conversation rather than Q&A.  Executive interview looks like just for formality
Interview Questions: What kind of analytic did you do in the previous companies?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Before the initial interview, I was given a pre-screen questionnaire to fill out. After sending that back to the recruiter, I got a call for an in-person interview.  

Overall the interviewers were very professional and cordial. Interview questions included a little background about what I currently do (to see how well of a fit i would be in the open position) -- work experience and projects.  Group/panel interview questions were more behavioral type questions : "what would you do in this situation..." / "how would you feel if this happened.." "what can kind of contribution can you bring with you if you were hired..." 

The wait in between interviews were long --- at least 2 weeks in between interviews. 
Hiring manager was apologetic about the slow process. In the end upper management decided not to hire externally and I got an email from the hiring manager explaining to me what had happened.  Could have gotten the job, unfortunately they decided not to hire at this time. The hiring manager was nice enough to write the letter himself and volunteered to keep my resume in case any jobs opened up.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this position?

title: Project Manager III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with multiple standard questions basics such as how you would handle specific situations.   Other questions included wanting to know what your skill set is and if it fit the job.  The hard part is when you do not know that specific department they tend to hire from within the department due to the knowledge of that employee.   There was a second interview where I was required to prepare a presentation to the same panel.
Interview Questions: Think of a situation where you had to manage a difficult situation what did you do?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Walnut Creek, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was initially referred by a co-worker. I applied for the job and was eventually called in for testing. Once I passed, I was called in for an interview. Shockingly, there were only two people present for the interview - the person who would become my manager and the director. Probably a few days after the interview I was offered the position. This initial process took about two weeks, but there was a lot of back and forth about the salary so the entire process from interview to actually starting was about a month.
Interview Questions: It's been a while, but the main ones I remember are tell us a little bit about yourself, what do you know about the department/position, How do you handle deadlines/prioritize your work, How do you handle sensitive information?...

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with Lead and Supervisor. Also took a clerical skills, test for typing, excel, word etc. in addition helpful to know Generic and Brand name of drugs. Asked if I had any phone experience.
Interview Questions: Do you have pharmacy experience? Is your schedule flexible.

title: Event Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the hiring manager and informed that the recruiter would contact me. That took 3 weeks. The recruiter called and we finally connected for an initial screening interview. I waited another 2 weeks to schedule the 1:1 interview with the hiring manager, as well as a panel interview comprised of managers in the department.  I prepared for the interview and brought examples of my work.  The interview was relatively low-key; the panel was friendly and receptive, and my 1:1 went past the designated time as the hiring manager and I had a positive discussion.   During the interview, I was told by the hiring manager that I would receive a from the recruiter, whether I received an offer or not.  After the interview, I waited 2 weeks after my post interview follow-up to contact the recruiter.  I contacted the recruiter 2 more times before catching her on her phone to find out that she dropped the ball on calling me back to let me know that I did not receive the offer. Fortunately I was able to still contact the hiring manager, who was extremely apologetic about the lack of follow-through.
Interview Questions: You have extensive experience in events and trade shows. How would this experience translate into meeting planning?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: This process was the most exasperating that I have ever had with any company! I interviewed for 6 (yes 6) various assistant and 2 project managment positions with 4 different departments! I made it to the final selection process twice, each time they chose an internal candidate.  It was exhausting, and apparently the departments did not notify the recruiter in their HR department that they selected an internal candidate.  I finally moved on and just registered with an executive search firm where I landed a temp to permanent position in healthcare.
Interview Questions: If you had several tasks and had to finish them all by the same deadline, how would you approach this?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Stockton, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. They each took turns asking me questions about my experience, my idea of customer service, why I wanted to work for the company and if I had any questions for them.
Interview Questions: What&#039;s your idea of good customer service?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Modesto, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was not easy to talk to an individual. hiring process is very impersonal. I felt like it took forever to hear from someone. Once I did, hear from someone it still took a really long time to hear back about a position.
Interview Questions: How many years experience I had

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Roseville, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: three managers interviewed me for the on-call housekeeping position originally at kaiser oakland.  I had to go through to interviews before getting a call that I got the position.  I transferred to Roseville to be closer to my grand children and went through the same process as any other candidate would go through even though I was a current employee.
Interview Questions: how would you address a patient when entering their hospital room

title: Communications Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call several days after application submission. Asked if I was able to interview on the spot that lasted one hour. Received a phone call from the hiring manager three days later to schedule an interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about what you know?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of about 5-7 questions that could be answered without preparation.  There was nothing probing or anything requiring thoughtfulness.  When I asked about the culture to the hiring Director she didn't really have an answer or else didn't know what the culture is.  I had the same experience when asking about the vision of the group.  This should have been a warning, but I accepted the position anyway and was bored out of my mind and only stayed about 1 year.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Environmental Service Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Long process, be honest and get as close to job dates as you can get. Several in the room, narrow down to less people until it's one on one. It was a while before I was called for more information. A while longer before I was told I was hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2012
