Interview Descriptions: Behavioral Interval and Typically a Panel. Sometimes you may have two intervals. One with the group and the second with the hiring manager. After the interval you will other receive a generic e-mail or a call from a recruiter. The hiring process can take an extended time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult employee?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process involved a phone interview then an in person interview - then they flew me to Oakland to meet with several members of their team and then two weeks later I was offered  the job.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want this job?
What can you offer KP?
Do you know how KP operates?
Why should we hire you?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the recruiter and exchanged emails and spoke. The hiring manager was nice and professional, and the interview was ok. The post interview follow-up was terrible. Repeated emails to the recruiter went unanswered until I "got the message" and moved on. In the end, not even a form letter email saying - thank you for applying but we selected someone else.
Interview Questions: Standard stuff - background, career highlights, info about the position etc.

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: First, I was contacted by a recruiter through LinkedIn, then I scheduled a phone screen with the recruiter. After that, I had another phone call with the hiring manager, and then then was called in for an on-site panel interview with the local leadership team. Finally, I had a meeting with the site manager and the hiring manager.  Then I got a verbal offer and then the recruiter sent me an offer letter.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your time and handle multiple priorities in an ever-changing work environment?

title: Lab Assistant 11 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: He calls to check if your still interested and meet qualifications.  Application is then forwarded to manager for further reconsideration.  Interview set and mine was done panel style.  Asking why I'm the best candidate, order of draw. Erc
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone interview asking how I heard of the position and why my background would fit with Kaiser. Lasted 30 minutes going over my resume with a fine tooth comb asking questions about each of my duties or responsibilities.
Interview Questions: What was the hardest task you had to do on your own?

title: Network Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I met with the hiring manager and a technical resource and was given a personal and technical interview. I was asked various questions regarding the technologies mentioned in the ad to assess my skill set and experience.
Interview Questions:
Why are you leaving your present job?
What can you bring to this company?

title: Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: tough but you have to be confident in answering all their questions and concerns,what else your knowledge and ideas to contribute to the facility,are you able to accomodate all the schedules that given to you,are you aware about the policies and procedures...
Interview Questions: what skills can you contribute to the facility in order for you to help all the staff

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Elk Grove, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Started volunteering while in College. I had to go through the Volunteer department. There is wait list to be a volunteer. So, apply for the position couple of months in advance.
Interview Questions: What do you want to gain from this role?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process was very choppy and took a long time. Ultimately, it took so much time I accepted another offer. It was uncoordinated with multiple assistants scheduling interviews for the same day. The key contact did not maintain my confidentiality of my job search, despite several conversations, and called my current employer (who did not know I was looking for a new job) without my permission or "heads up".
Interview Questions: What do you think are the most important changes or challenges Kaiser faces?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Reston, VA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The offer orientation for new hire employee 
And they inform them salary and the benefit and they give them good training before starting their job and kaiser also offer raise to the employee every years and continuing educations
Interview Questions: What I do know about the company

title: User Interface Design Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Overall, I had 9 interviews-- 3 times on site (some with multiple people) and 4 phone interviews over more than a month. However, other than a simple notification that I didn't get the position (second choice) I could not reach anyone for feedback or a conversation. I appreciate the process but it was rude!
Interview Questions: Rather than a question, I was put on the spot to participate in a brainstorming session and then present the ideas to an audience of 15 people.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on line.  I received a call a several weeks later from the hiring Director's assistant.  I then had multiple phone interviews and then several on-site interviews.  Once I interviewed on-site, it took several months and a lot of follow-up on my part to close the deal.  Even after that, the negotiation phase and such were painful to say the least.  HR is a process I don't even want to go into.

Overall I would say the interviews themselves were great, but the process after made me want to eat nails.  It made the overall experience for me horrible.
Interview Questions: The questions were general - no specific surprises.

title: Technical Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process at Kaiser Permanente IT is a very, very slow process.  One who is interested in seeking employement as a FTE, should be prepared to undergo a long screening and interview process.  Depending on the position, there can be as little at 3 interviews to as many as 14 interviews.  I personally had 6 interviews over 8 weeks.  

If you are lucky to make it through, and you are offered a position, there is a detailed background / credit check that is done.  Be prepared to wait a couple of weeks to clear this process.  You are also expected to do a drug test (blood and / or urine).  

After this, you will be given a start date.  Note that you usually start on a Monday.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you worked with a difficult person.  How did you handle the situation and what did you do to overcome the difficulty?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I received a phone call from the internal KP recruiter after applying for a position online.  This initial phone screen lasted about 20 minutes and consisted of basic questions about professional background and experience as well as a basic overview of KP.  The recruiter set up a phone interview with the hiring manager for the next day.  The phone interview lasted about 20-30 minutes and was slightly more indepth than the phone screen, with specific questions about work tasks, experience, and a lot more detail about the specific position being filled.  A few days later, I was asked to come in for an in-person interview. It was 1 on 1 and lasted approximately one hour.  It was very relaxed and the hiring manager was extremely transparent about what they were looking for, some of the challenges, and opportunities.  

The recruiter called a few days later and made the offer contingent on background/drug test, etc.  The total time from the first phone screen to passing the background check and getting a start date confirmed, took 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser Permanente?  Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Data Entry Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Paramount, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going. It was through a temp agency and they just wanted to make sure I passed testing for typing speed.They asked about my working history and wanted to make sure I was dedicated to my jobs. Difficult for me

title: Lead Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Washington Metropolitan Area Transit AuthorityWe're committed to protecting our community from fraudulent submissions that might affect our ratings and reviews. 

We review and approve every post before it appears on our site, and in the case that the community sees something suspicious we will look into the issue and take appropriate action. 

We will not post reviews containing: 

• Rants, venting, or obscenities 
• Personal insults or defamatory attacks (by name, title, or association) 
• Aggressive or discriminatory language 
• Trade secrets or information protected by employer contracts 
• Content not relevant or helpful to our community 
• Text in ALL CAPS or us
Interview Questions: Please read our Community Guidelines for more information about our review criteria

title: Clinical Pharmacy Specialist Interview

The interview considered both my professional experience but also my personality type and assessment of how I would fit in with the existing team members as well as how my own personal values and approach to practice matched with theirs.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a difficult situation that occurred in the work place and describe how you managed and resolved the situation.

1.  How would a colleague describe you?

3.  Are you a team player?
Interview Questions: What does accountability mean to you?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was really fun. I know you really can't say that about most interviews, but the two individuals interviewing me for this position were intelligent, friendly, and engaging. 

I was lucky to go straight from the online application to filling out an additional set of questions after my resume/application was reviewed (intended to assess my skill level in various areas) to the in-person interview, as usually there is a phone interview prior to a 1:1 interview) because I happened to be in the city interviewing for other positions over the period of time my phone interview was scheduled. The interview questions were really easy for me to answer because the job fit perfectly with my past experience; the questions were focused on assessing my technical, analytic and interpersonal skills.

Despite the fact that I got three really great job offers over those few days, this company really made an impression on me because of the culture and the fact that my new boss(es) would really be fantastic; I accepted the position.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with EPIC and Cognos?

title: Intern Interview

We touched base on my credentials. (If you are hired without the credentials they need they will let you achieve them at a later date) I let the interviewer know what I could bring to Kaiser and they let me know what they could do for me.
Interview Questions: Past experience, credentials, why I wanted to work at Kaiser....how long I was a dental assistant prior to applying to Kaiser, why I left my last employer.

title: Administrative Interview

title: Senior Business Specialist, Trainer, Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for 15 minutes but took a long time for background check and drug test.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected or difficult was asked.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume, was contacted by Human Resources within a few days.  Had an initial phone interview with the HR representative, who was very polite and professional.  Resume forwarded to appropriate department, and was contacted several days later for phone interview with department manager.  After phone interview with that manager, was scheduled to meet face-to-face with another department manager about a week later.  A little over a week after that, I was scheduled for panel interview.  Then back to face-to-face with first manager.  Was told that they needed to staff up quickly, and I would be notified of a decision within the next few days.  I waited a week and one half, and after not hearing from anyone, I contacted the first manager.  She told me that my qualifications didn't quite match what they were looking for, but my application would be on file. I scheduled my entire afternoon on no fewer than three occasions to interview face to face (plus a fourth afternoon, as one interview got cancelled at the last minute.), and then did not even receive a "thank you" for my time, or an "I'm sorry, but here's a lovely parting gift". Nor did anyone contact me when it was clear that they were not going to hire me.  I had to contact them.  This entire process took well over a month, probably closer to two.  I don't mind not getting the job, there are other jobs.  I just thought it wasn't very professional to have such a disregard for the applicant's time.  All in all though, everyone I met with was pleasant enough.  It just seemed like they could have been a bit more organized.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Q. Can you tell me why are you considering leaving your present job?
A. Regardless of the reason, do not bad mouth your current employer. Negativism will always hurt you. Good answers include: “There is no room for growth at my current employer. I am looking for a company with long term growth opportunities”. “Due to a company restructuring, my entire department is relocating to Florida. I was give the option of moving, but do not wish to relocate”. “My current company is not doing well, and has been laying off employees. There is no job security there, and more layoffs are expected”.

title: Project Manager Interview

The questions showed they authentically understood what they needed and weren't afraid to say 'I don't know' when necessary. Overall, although intimidating, it was great learning experience with incredible people.

Anyone who would work for this organization would be because they are desperate!

title: Member Services Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for KP Santa Clara January 2011. Asked in depth about Customer Service Skills and where I used those skills in my background. They also had me write a response to a letter they gave me --> It was a complaint letter and they asked me to write a letter 'back' to the person b/c they wanted to see how I write, my style, etc..  So after the interview, I stayed another 30 minutes to do this task.
Interview Questions: 2 on 1 interview.  At one point, the 2 people interviewing me said they wanted to put me in a typical situation and they would be the Client, I would be the KP MS Rep and need to respond. they basically both started yelling at me at once! then taking turns. They wanted to see how I reacted under pressure, under due-stress ! They tried to push my buttons. They did a good job in this situation of making an example of hostile clients that from time to time come into the offices and complain.

Interview Questions: Have you ever had to deal with difficult physicians?

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Parma, OH) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
was contacted. Very professional. Asked all the right questions. Tone was a bit cool and stand offish.

Very much " a Kaiser Way" or no way.
Interview Questions: Details about drugs used in nursing setting

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process was Very thorough.   I completed my profile online.  I then completed a questionnaire.  I was later asked to a phone interview which led to a panel interview.  I was asked to prepare a presentation on how I would address a certain diversity issue.  I was given a week to put this together.  I decided to go with a PowerPoint presentation.
Interview Questions: What would I do if.........

title: Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions:
This job consisted of 3 person panel interview.  1 network manager, 1 desktop manager, 1 IT director.
90 of the interview was technical.  Interested in troubleshooting flow process.  
Asked about 20 questions.
Explained the employment process at Kaiser at start of interview.
Poeple there consist of 20 techs responsible for 2 branches.
The entire IT dept is outsourced and it is further sub contracted
Enviroment is casual but not exciting.

Make sure you know everything that you clain on your resume and know all basic aspects of desktop support role.
Kaiser is interested in exact skills in order to select the right person.
Interview Questions: The printer does not work.  How do you fix it.

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I wasn't hired by Kaiser.  I worked through an agency, Sperion now known as Randstad.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.  It was a very easy interview process.

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to schedule a face to face interview. When I arrived I had a panel interview of all the staff in the department (4 at the time). This was followed by a few 1 on 1 interview sessions. Questions were about my experience and asking me to explain bullet points in my resume.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions combined with explaining your experience. If you prepare to address both there will not be difficult questions.

title: Account Administrative Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had two different interviews. The first interview was with 2 managers, and I didn't get the position. My second interview was with 5 people (3 managers and 2 team leads. This is a very popular position at this location, so you interview with many different managers who have an open position, and the managers basically decide who they want. I had about 7 situational questions. ex: Tell me how you handled this situation? Tell me when this happened? However there is a 20 question math test and typing test you have to pass before you can even get to the interview stage. It consists of simple word problems that do contain a few fraction and decimal questions.
Interview Questions: I didn't really have any difficult questions. They wanted to know how you handled certain situations on your past job.

title: Administrative Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Bakersfield, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview took place with a panel of two other candidates and three total interviewers. Awkward and stressful interview that led to one of the other candidates, who worked within the organization, to despise me upon getting the job over him.
Interview Questions: How would you handle the schedule when an employee calls out and another employee wants to go home sick?

title: Senior Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted company through ad on Monster.  3 interviews with HR, including extensive written questionnaire for Hiring Manager.  2 telephone interviews with Hiring Manager, and background check.  1 in-person interview with Hiring Manager and team.  Entire process took over 4 months.
Interview Questions: Hiring Manager wanted to discuss problems with current team communications style.

title: Human Resources Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Honolulu, HI) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had to first take a typing test. Then had a group interview (with the two managers) asked behavioral questions along with past work experience questions. Lasted about an hour. Wanted a month then asked for a second interview. During the second interview, had to complete a writing sample then had same two people interview me again. Asked very similar questions, lasted only 20 minutes. Seemed like a waste to have second interview. Was offered the job 5 days later, with a start date a month away. Seems like they are very slow at moving to the next stages which is what I heard before.
Interview Questions: Describe your work experience.

title: Point of Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Online application only and pray you are selected. Interview with hiring managers and senior staff is standard. Preset questions that has no relation to the current post. Mostly
"tell me about a time" questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to do something you thought was right and for a patient that was outside the scope of your job.

title: X-RAY Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Lake, MS) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: did not like the people because they were rude how ever they made me feel comfortable when i was able to reach the ceo right away
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Group interviews are the most common. I interviewed with around 35 people for 3 openings. They sit you all in a room, pass around a hat with easy questions, and you stand up and answer. They also gave us 1 minute to learn about the person next to us, then pitch them for 2 minutes to the interviewers.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was the team exercise in which you are given 60 seconds to learn as much as possible about your neighbor, then have to pitch them to the interviewers for 2 minutes. Mainly hard because you talk for twice as long as you learned.

title: Materials Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Largo, MD) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: From all of my interviews that I have had when applying for positions held here, they were very diffienent from any interview that I had previously. I walked into the room, and to my surprise, there were seven people. This was  a panel-board interview. It was a little overwhelming initially. But after I took a deep breath, and had a sip of water. the questions came. The panel consisted of my manager, a few department mangers whom I would be working with and a few area manager from their respected areas. They all fired away with questions. It was a great experience and learned that I
Interview Questions: I always get a little stuck with providing real-life experiences of how I have responded in varios scenarios.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very standard process.  Submitted an on-line application and got a response within a month.  When the recruiter couldn't get ahold of me by phone, she sent me an e-mail.  The manger that I interviewed with was very nice and fairly casual.  She assured me that everyone goes through an extensive hiring process, but well worth it once you get in.
Interview Questions: Do you have a problem with working Per Diem over the next year?

title: Strategic Sourcing Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Hiring team was very professional and thorough. Interview process consisted of multiple rounds starting with phone screening and multiple 1:1 interviews. Focus of interviews was generally technical and based on previous projects. Hiring team regularly emphasized that Kaiser Permanente is a consensus driven organization with multiple silos and stakeholders. From that standpoint, they were very interested to know more about my stakeholder management skills.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RFP Proposal Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Marketing Manager and her assistant for this position. The primary responsibility was to take material from the copy bank and use it for proposals. It sounded like most of what I would be doing was copying and pasting.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a problem that came up during your last job and how you solved it?

title: Pharmacy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I talked to the person in charge of the program I was in, and she chose the top 30 students who qualified from 2 different schools. I was very blessed to be chosen one, afterwards we had to go through drug testing process.
Interview Questions: How do you think you will benefit from this program?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Walnut Creek, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Asked a lot of what I i did at school. Really fun interview chatted with my about my personality. learned a lot from them. Really enjoyed my volunteer experience. Many chances for promotions such as becoming a shift leader.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite subject in school?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of interviewers who were all involved in the department, including the hiring manager as well as workers in the department.  The questions asked were all behavior based questions...give us an example of a time you acted and something did not go right. What happened/  What would you do differently if it happened again?  How would you approach a project of getting a new initiative started?  How involved would you be in the initiative?  What would you be looking for as the project progressed?  Describe how you would handle a situation if you found employees not completing their work and hiding it?  What if there was one employee doing this?  What if there were ten employees and you couldn't keep up with the work if you fired them?
Interview Questions: Describe a situation from your recent work experience which produced a high level of stress for you.  How did you cope?  What was the result?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: They are very courteous and always made sure that the interview process and my needs were taken care of.  They even made accomadations for my overnight stay prior to the interview and gave me plenty of opportunities to ask questions, state my concerns, and even made time for me to meet other staff members and see more than one facility.  Lastly, I had the opportunity to have lunch with multiple staff getting a good vibe of their personal/professional interactions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict in the workplace... have you ever had to?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview with 6 people lasted about 30 minutes.  After being hired, and working in the job, it became clear they did not know what the job entailed.
Interview Questions: Interviewers were inexperienced.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Panorama City, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had applied a great deal online. While on vacation, just about to enter the Grand Canyon, the recruiter called. She interviewed me over the phone. I have not be called for a face to face interview yet, but I continue to apply and occasionally speak to the recruiter.
Interview Questions: I see that you worked for us in the past (before I was a nurse), and you left after 3 months.

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview was scheduled with the IT Program Manager and Development Manager.
Interview Questions: SDLC questions were posed; site examples where SDLC was used

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with a representative of Kaiser, for a travel RN position in PACU. It was very intense and a lot more difficult than I had anticipated. She asked tons of clinical questions and the interview lasted an hour. I have never been so nervous and intimidated during an interview. If you want to work for Kaiser, you'd better know your stuff!
Interview Questions: The interviewer asked me a question about a specific anesthesia drug with which I was not familiar. I just didn't have enough years in PACU to know enough for their requirements, so I didn't get the job.

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Walnut Creek, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview.  I met the entire team.  Questions were related to IT.
Interview Questions: Questions were about lab workflow and knowledge of laboratory.

title: Java Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: the interview wasn't as hard as i thought it would be. They didn't ask anything really technical. Mostly they asked about your experiences and if you understand particular topics in Java. The interviewers were friendly and the interview was more of a conversation.
Interview Questions: Why kaiser?

title: Ward Clerk Transcriber Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was long.  They only hire top and very best of the best.  They make sure you are the right person for Kaiser and the position.  It was a long process but it was worth it.  We have some great people there.
Interview Questions: where do you want to be in 5 years

title: Applications Development Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Found initial gig on Craigslist. Came in as a contract-to-hire. 2 interviews. It would have been nice if it had gone quicker.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with an ACD, left my book to be reviewed by CD and other management. The postiion was freelance to start and then after a year went to FT. After they had my portfolio for a week, I picked up my portfolio and received an offer a week later. Had to do a  drug test and background check before I could start work.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for Kaiser Permanente?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process is pretty smooth
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview followed by two panel interviews with 2 people each. One would be direct manager, others were directors/practice leader of department.
Interview Questions: What would you say/do if the group you worked with ask you for xyz product? or Wanted to do xyz?

title: Lead Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was able to get into the organization via an internal contact. It is very difficult to get a position at Kaiser without a referral. I had two interviews. The first one was with the director who asked me some experience related questions, but most of them were geared to determine if I'm a good cultural fit. Focus on collaboration and teamwork will help.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't an unexpected question. As mentioned before, focus is on collaboration and teamwork. Make sure to focus on experiences you have had that highlight that skills. How you overcame challenges by utilizing internal and external resources.

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was a phone interview with an HR manager in January. Second interview was a 1:1 with the hiring manager a week later. Waited 1 month and was contacted by another HR person for a third 1:1 interview with the hiring manager and his boss. The interview went well and I was contacted a week later by yet another HR person and presented with an offer over the phone, which I accepted. I waited another 30 days without any more information. I then saw that the job had been re-posted to the KP job site so I contacted the hiring manager who assured me that I was still in the process of being hired. No background check was started yet or offer letter sent. After 55 days of waiting I contacted the person in charge of the Human Resources dept in Georgia. I was finally contacted by yet another HR person who told me that my rec # (???) had been dropped because of a budget problem in the IT department.  Kaiser HR is a disgrace. Even if offered a job there I would think twice about taking it. The organization is a huge mess.
Interview Questions: Do you know PowerPoint?

title: Director, Project Management Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initially I requested an informational interview about a new job in a new department, wanting to know more about the function of both.  I had a one on one interview that was very nice and respectful.  I then had a formal interview, and was very open about the areas in which I excelled, as well as the areas where I might need further training, etc.  I felt like I had a chance at the job and continued in the pool.  I was called back for a second job in the same department, with different functions, but found out that I was technically not eligible because I had received a promotion into my current job within the company within 6 months of time.  You are obligated to stay in a position for 6 months after you get a promotion.  I think there were other higher qualified people who had been interviewed, and this gave HR an easy out to eliminate me from the pool, though this rule is apparently very rarely broken.
Interview Questions: If you were brough on board, how would you expect the manager to bring you up to speed in the department, so you could perform the duties as you understand them?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had 4 interviews in 5 days with 10 people. First started with a phone interview with hiring manager, I was asked to meet him for a personal interview next day, on 3rd day I was asked to call in to a conference bridge where my future colleagues interviewed me, last round was an hr interview to check about my job expectations
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you are asked to work on a project with out having provided any background or documentation

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
You don't hear form weeks after you apply.  Phone interviews can be with HR or hiring manager.
Be prepared for the slow culture, the pecking order, and everything is done by committee and not getting anything done.
Interview Questions: What does the department do and how would you contribute to it.

title: Operations Supervisor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was referred in by a friend who works at Kaiser.  Got an initial phone screening interview from HR, then a follow up call to schedule with the hiring manager.  Met in person for the initial interview with the hiring manager and was asked a series of written questions.  It was pretty impersonal.  Got the feeling they'd already found their person and were just going through the motions.
Interview Questions: What would you do if?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was refereed by a former colleague who worked there.  He helped me  tweak my resume to  point out the need of this employer.  I can 't emphasize how important it is to modify your resume each time  to point out what it is that you can provide them based on their needs and not forward a boiler plate.  .He forwarded the resume to his boss.  I received a call for an interview.  Once I interviewed them, I submit my resume on line officially to HR..  I forwarded a thank you email after the interview which the supervisor graciously responded and said they are still in the process of making a decision.  A few weeks later I received a call from HR.  The HR person was not very polite.  She was so rude and pushy to the point that I considered declining the offer.  But my colleague reminded me that I will never  see or work with that person because she is in the headquarter. And that was true.  7 years later and I am still at thee company and have never seen that person.
Interview Questions: Provide an example of a project or task where you saved money for the client.  provide an example and what was your role in the decision.

title: SMC Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: So, I'm writing this from the perspective of someone who interviewed a lot of candidates for the Strategic Management Consulting (SMC) Department at KPCO.  Remember, HR often blocks good candidates so either network your resume into the organization or make sure the key words in the job posting are on your resume.    People who know people at the organization were frequent hires.  SMC is made up of 4 teams (1) project management (2) performance improvement - lean (3) data analytics (4) care delivery consultants.  The teams have very different functions and personalities.  On the project management team the interview consisted of an initial phone interview listening for people skills and basic project management skills.  If you make it past that you are called into a group interview.  This usually consists of the manager and two of the project managers from the team.  The group interview is very unstructured.  Just be yourself and ask about what projects they have in the pipleline that you might be getting.  The projects vary vastly so make sure it's something you want to do.  Keep in mind these positions are not for creative types.  These are very much do what you are told positions.  SMC has extremely high turnover.  Management tries to say it's a good thing but it's not.  Once your honeymoon period is over in SMC you'll likely want to get out as soon as possible.  Most people leave between 1-2 years.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength and weakness?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser Permanente's interview process can be lengthy.  For me, it began with a screening interview by an assigned HR recruiter.  The questions asked in the screening interview are straightforward.  It's easy to tell that these are the questions the hiring manager provided to the recruiter.  Once past the screening interview, I met with the hiring manager.  I was then invited back for a second round interview with members of the team and also internal business partners.  There were about 4 in total.  Start to finish, the interview process took several weeks.  Once Kaiser gave me an offer, there was another two weeks during which they conducted a very thorough background check.  I also had to submit to a drug test.
Interview Questions: Describe in detail a successful project you designed and managed.  How did you measure success?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with upper level management and leadership. Each one will ask you two questions of their choice. You have to answer the questions in a manner that they will look at your communication skills, which is an essential part of the job.
Interview Questions: Which resources do you use when performing research?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situation with your boss?

title: Senior S/W Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with 5 people logged in, it was basic questions. Had a very nice experience as the questions were not of type gocha... as they are in some interviews when market is bad...
Interview Questions: portlet lifecycle

title: Individual Contributor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I first participated in an email screening with a set of questions related to my field. Then I had a phone interview with an HR consultant. 1 month later I had 1:1 interview with a hiring manager; then three weeks later I had a panel interview. Two weeks later I got an offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Organizational Architect Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by the employer and told that I met all of the criteria for an opening they had. They sent me an extensive set of questions about Organizational Architecture. I spent close to an entire day answering the questions. They then called back and said that the criteria for the position had changed and the individual selected must have managed care experience. Boom! Door slammed.

Questions asked on the 'essay' weren't difficult. The process was just time consuming.
Interview Questions: 3.	What is your definition of business architecture? What would you say are the broad responsibilities of a business architect? What would you say are the major personal traits/qualities this job demands?

title: Intern Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was able to get the job interview when I met the pharmacy supervisor at a career fair at my school.  I had my interview on-site with 2 pharmacy supervisors. They both had a set of questions to ask me and it was intense.  Many follow-up questions to my answers.  Since I was a 1st year student at the time, they didn't ask me as much drug-related questions during my interview.  I heard back 1 week later that I got the job.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about what you can offer to Kaiser.

title: Proposal Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions:
The process began with an initial phone interview with the recruiter, followed by two in-person interviews (one with staff and another with management), and a final phone interview with the director of the department. The interview process lasted about a month.

The team at Kaiser was very nice. Everyone seemed to really enjoy working there. I left my interviews with the impression that they were looking for candidates that were excited about Kaiser's mission, friendly, and competent.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at Kaiser?

title: Human Resources Technology Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the recruiter, followed by three in person interviews (two scheduled for the same day). I interviewed with a peer, a subordinate (weird!), my future boss and his boss. Questions were pretty basic, no surprises. They were eager to fill the position and shared a lot about the organization.
Interview Questions: Nothing tough as far as I can remember.

title: Assistant Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: It is a 2 step process. Both steps include interview questions in front of a panel consisting of managers, RN's and Doctors. The questions are quite detailed and if you can't think quick on your feet than don't interview with Kaiser.
Interview Questions: Kaiser uses Gene Watson as part of their nursing model. The question was something along the lines of Please describe a caring moment in your career? Isn't nursing all about caring?

title: IT Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume to the hiring manager per instructions from a friend who is an employee there, I got a call from the recruiter about two weeks later to complete a page of detailed finance background/experience questions.  I got an interview with the hiring manager.  One of the first questions within 5 minutes of the interview starting was we work a lot of hours, does that bother you!  I took it to mean that we work 60 hours a week and weekends also whenever necessary.  I made it past that interview and did four phone interviews over the next few weeks, then they had in come in for an additional four interviews. Clearly they hire through consensus or the director of IT finance just cannot make up his mind.  After that nothing for a few more weeks.  When I followed up, I was told they felt that the candidates they had were all over qualified and they were re-writing the posting and starting again.  As a manager, I would take a person who is more qualified and have some bench strength rather than a person who can just do the job.  If everyone in your department is working in access of 60 hours a week, I would find a way to leverage the over qualified person into a broader role to free up band width. While some feel that they person would be bored if they were over qualified, I think a person with the right work ethic would find other things to do which add value. They strike me as an organization that has grown rapidly and there is a highly level vision of where they want to go but they are lacking a detailed plan. People were bright, environment was professional, recruiter seemed to carry a lot of influence.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. Relaxed interview. Hiring process professional. Training well-presented.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your family.
